original: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong bas yongs su bsgyur ba bsgom mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He cultivates them by way of complete rejection.

original: theg pa chung du las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas bsgom par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: theg pa chung du las kun du bsrung ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas bsgom par yongs su ston te /
translated: In the Lesser Vehicle, he teaches that one cultivates the factors of enlightenment by way of guarding, by way of the view of all sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For he says, ‚ÄúThey also have the view of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa de yang 'phangs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa de yang 'phangs pa ni /
translated: The impetus of that view of all sentient beings

original: gang gi phyir sngon smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar bstan pa de yang gsungs pa'o //üîΩsnying brtse ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar bstan pa de yang gsungs pa'o // snying brtse ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: is taught by ‚ÄúHe has the aspiration that he previously accomplished.‚ÄùüîΩCompassion is taught by ‚ÄúHe has great compassion and is endowed with great love.‚Äù

original: 'dun pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Aspiration is taught by ‚ÄúHe has the aspiration that he previously accomplished.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la lhag par dmigs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la lhag par dmigs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Intention is taught by ‚ÄúHe has the aspiration that he previously accomplished.‚ÄùüîΩExertion is taught by ‚ÄúHe has the aspiration that he previously accomplished.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang /
translated: Practice is the accomplishment of the adornment of the buddhaverse, the accomplishment of the powers, fearlessnesses, special qualities of a buddha, major and minor marks,

original: gsung dbyangs phun sum tshogs pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / gong nas gong du khyad par can gyi chos yongs su tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnam par thar pa mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa chen pos rnam par spyod pas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung dbyangs phun sum tshogs pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / gong nas gong du khyad par can gyi chos yongs su tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo rnam par thar pa mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa chen pos rnam par spyod pas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the perfect voice of a buddha, the pursuit of ever more special qualities, the pursuit of listening to the profound Dharma of the Buddha, and the practice of great skill in means.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa nyid de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung bas byang chub kyi phyogs pa bsgom pa la gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba ni 'phangs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa nyid de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung bas byang chub kyi phyogs pa bsgom pa la gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba ni 'phangs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is shown to be superior by its association with all beings, by its protection from the addictions, and by its protection from the lower vehicles.

original: snying brtse ba dang / 'dun pa dang sgrub pas yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / 'dun pa dang sgrub pas yongs su bstan te /
translated: It is shown by its compassion, aspiration, and practice.

original: de la byams pa dang snying rje gnyis kyis ni snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa dang snying rje gnyis kyis ni snying brtse ba'o //
translated: Compassion and lovingkindness are its compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob par mngon par 'dod pas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob par mngon par 'dod pas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to attain the knowledge of a buddha.

original: sgrub pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Practice is fivefold.

original: zhing yongs @184b su dag par byed pa'i sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa dang / de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas sa la chog par mi 'dzin par sgrub pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon pa'i sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: zhing yongs @184b su dag par byed pa'i sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa dang / de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas sa la chog par mi 'dzin par sgrub pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon pa'i sgrub pa dang /
translated: It is the practice of purification of the land, the practice of the realization of the qualities of a buddha, the practice of not being satisfied with the attainment of the lower stages, the practice of the irreversible stage, and the practice of the consecration of the stage of enlightenment.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: and the practice of bringing beings to full maturity.

original: gsung dbyangs ni chos kyi dung yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung dbyangs ni chos kyi dung yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the melody of his speech is the Dharma conch.

original: de la gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i 'bras bu ni bdag gis shes so //üîΩbdag gi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i 'bras bu ni bdag gis shes so // bdag gi shes pa'o //
translated: The result of the increase of the practice of the counteragent is the abandonment of the excessive movements and the movements of separation, etc.

original: bdag sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bdag sgom par byed do //
translated: The excessive movements are the thoughts such as: I know, I am knowing, I will know.

original: bdag gi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhag par g-yo ba dang / 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas lhag par g-yo ba dang / 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams spangs pa ste /
translated: The movements of separation are the thoughts such as: I am meditating, I am meditating on that, I will meditate.

original: ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar byed pa'i phyir lhag par g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar byed pa'i phyir lhag par g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: The excessive movements are so called because they cause one to rise up from samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang 'gal bar byed pa'i phyir 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang 'gal bar byed pa'i phyir 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: The movements of separation are so called because they cause one to separate from samadhi.üîΩ One should understand that the excessive movements and the movements of separation are taught by the terms:

original: de dag gis 'phangs pa rnams dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sbyor ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang nyes dmigs kyis bstan par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: de dag gis 'phangs pa rnams dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sbyor ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang nyes dmigs kyis bstan par rig par bya'o//
translated: impulsion,manifestation, application, grasping, and disadvantage.üîΩ Impulsion is the belief in the reality of the perishable constituents of mind and body.

original: de la 'phangs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gnas te /
analyzed: de la 'phangs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la gnas te /
translated: Manifestation is the belief in the reality of the self.

original: sngon gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa ste /
translated: It is projected by former adherence to persons and things.

original: gang gi phyir de 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen pas kun nas bslang ba'i g-yo ba'i lhag par g-yo ba dang 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen pas kun nas bslang ba'i g-yo ba'i lhag par g-yo ba dang 'bral bar g-yo ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is produced by the adherence to a self, to a sentient being, to a life, to a nourisher, to a man, to a human being, to a personality, to an individual, to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which are preceded by the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par bsam pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par bsam pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: It is a formation because it is a false imagination.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par brtags pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par brtags pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said to be an imagination.

original: gzhan go bar bya ba la rnam par dpyod pas sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan go bar bya ba la rnam par dpyod pas sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is a composition because it is an analysis of the communication to others.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said to be an analysis.

original: yang dang yang so sor rtog pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang so sor rtog pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / 'dzin pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Because of repeated discrimination, because of the acceptance of self, and because of grasping, there is grasping.

original: gang gi phyir rtag par 'dzin pa rnams dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams dang / nor du 'dzin pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag par 'dzin pa rnams dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams dang / nor du 'dzin pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the grasping of permanence, the grasping of self, and the grasping of wealth.

original: sems 'dogs pa'i gnas yin pas nyes dmigs te /
analyzed: sems 'dogs pa'i gnas yin pas nyes dmigs te /
translated: Because of the basis of the designation of mind, there is danger.

original: gang gi phyir rten gyi gnas rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rten gyi gnas rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the basis of the support.

original: de lhag par g-yo ba dang / 'bral bar g-yo ba rnam pa de lta bu de dag spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lhag par g-yo ba dang / 'bral bar g-yo ba rnam pa de lta bu de dag spangs pa yin te /
translated: He is free from those movements and those kinds of movements of separation.

original: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad dang bral ba yin @185a * //üîΩno zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad dang bral ba yin @185a * // no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of all of those.

original: 'di ni re zhig nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result from the point of view of the abandonment of the defilement-hindrance.

original: de bya ba'i cha ma yin pa'i las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis smad pa /
analyzed: de bya ba'i cha ma yin pa'i las yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis smad pa /
translated: The Buddha has condemned the action which is not a part of one‚Äôs duty.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo //
translated: He completely abandons all that is associated with the afflictions.üîΩHe undertakes and abides by those actions that are proper, that are in accord with the bodhisattva path, and that are praised by the TathƒÅgatas.

original: las gang dag bya bar 'os pa byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa de dag yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o
analyzed: las gang dag bya bar 'os pa byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa de dag yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam par spangs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o
translated: This is from the perspective of the complete abandonment of the affliction of action.

original: // de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis bya ba'i cha ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyis smad pa'i phyir ston pa la gus pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis bya ba'i cha ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ste / sangs rgyas kyis smad pa'i phyir ston pa la gus pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Those actions are also not to be done in two ways:üîΩbecause they are condemned by the Buddha, they are disrespectful to the Teacher;

original: kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and because they are associated with the afflictions, they are fearful due to their misdeeds.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis na bya bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis na bya bar 'os pa ste /
translated: They are proper to do in two ways:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are in accord with the bodhisattva path, they are respectful to the Teacher;üîΩand because they are free of the afflictions, they are free of fear due to their misdeeds.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa'i phyir ston pa la gus pas so //üîΩde de bas kyang ji lta ji ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa'i phyir ston pa la gus pas so // de de bas kyang ji lta ji ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: and because he sees the benefit of being free from sin and because he has reverence for the teacher who is praised by the Tathagata.üîΩAnd as he cultivates the path of the factors of enlightenment, he becomes one who has a gentle mind.

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams bsgoms pa de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bcu pa phrag bzhis 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi yongs su ston te /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams bsgoms pa de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bcu pa phrag bzhis 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi yongs su ston te /
translated: This passage in four tetrads shows the four kinds of result.

original: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po dang / de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba dang / de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po dang / de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba dang / de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa'o //
translated: The four causes are: intense aspiration for the attainment of the special result; gratitude to the teacher who teaches that path; the undertaking of effort in the means for attaining it; and the development of the potential that is the basis for that attainment.

original: de la ji lta ji ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa ni /
analyzed: de la ji lta ji ltar thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa ni /
translated: As he cultivates the path of the factors of enlightenment, he becomes one who has a gentle mind.

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas bsgom pa ste /
translated: He cultivates it with a view to all sentient beings.

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As previously explained.

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs pa thams cad la lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs pa thams cad la lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The limbs of the path are all the factors of enlightenment.

original: de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa drag pos so //
analyzed: de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang / chags pa dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa drag pos so //
translated: He has a gentle mind in this way, that is, through intense aspiration, attachment, joy, and faith.

original: 'jam pa'i sems nyid de yang rgyu gsum gyis ston te /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i sems nyid de yang rgyu gsum gyis ston te /
translated: This gentleness of mind is shown through three causes.

original: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir mnyan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs @185b pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir mnyan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs @185b pa'o //
translated: The distinctive feature of his ease is that he has a mind that is ready to listen.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir las su rung ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir las su rung ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The distinctive feature of his mastery of concentration is that he has a mind that is workable.

original: nyes pa rnam par 'bri zhing spong ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam par 'bri zhing spong ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special antidote that eliminates and abandons faults is stated as: ‚Äúbecause he has a mind that generates benefit and happiness.‚Äù

original: nyes pa de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that fault should be understood as sixfold:

original: chos bstan pa'i dus na zang zing dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa'am klan ka tshol ba la nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i dus na zang zing dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa'am klan ka tshol ba la nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: When teaching the Dharma, there is the fault of affliction in regard to material things, or the fault of affliction in regard to seeking for an opportunity to criticize.

original: de'i gnyen por yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is stated as: ‚Äúhe has a mind that is not completely afflicted.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ye shes kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ye shes kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: The fault is the contentment with generosity, etc., with few desires, etc., and with knowledge.

original: de'i gnyen por gong nas gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gong nas gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: The antidote to that is stated as: ‚Äúhe has a mind that seeks ever higher distinctions,‚Äù

original: ye shes kyi khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and ‚Äúhe has a mind that desires the distinction of knowledge.‚Äù

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa na skyo ba ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa na skyo ba ni nyes pa ste /
translated: When bringing sentient beings to maturity, discouragement is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúHe has a mind that completely protects all migrating beings.‚Äù

original: bla mas lung phog pa na rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: bla mas lung phog pa na rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: When receiving instructions from a guru, holding one‚Äôs own view as supreme is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por bla ma la gus pa dang mthun pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bla ma la gus pa dang mthun pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúHe has a mind that is respectful to the guru and in accord with him.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa na brtson pa 'dor ba ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa na brtson pa 'dor ba ni nyes pa ste /
translated: When practicing, giving up striving is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por ji skad thos pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ji skad thos pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúHe has a mind that practices the Dharma as it has been heard.‚Äù

original: de lta bu ni re zhig 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Such a person is one who has a gentle mind.

original: ji skad thos pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bcu pa 'dis ni 'bras bu khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po nyid yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad thos pa'i chos sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bcu pa 'dis ni 'bras bu khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa drag po nyid yang dag par bstan to //
translated: This tenth verse shows that he has the intention to practice the Dharma as he has heard it.

original: de ni de byas pa gzo ba nyid yin zhes bya ba bcu pa gnyis pas de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: de ni de byas pa gzo ba nyid yin zhes bya ba bcu pa gnyis pas de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba nyid ston to //
translated: He is grateful to the teacher for that, the second tenth shows his gratitude to the teacher who taught him.

original: de la de byas pa gzo ba nyid yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la de byas pa gzo ba nyid yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There, he is grateful to the teacher for that means

original: lan du phan 'dogs par zhugs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs par zhugs pa nyid yin no //
translated: he is engaged in repaying the teacher's kindness.

original: byas pa gzo ba nyid de yang rnam pa dgus ston te /
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba nyid de yang rnam pa dgus ston te /
translated: That gratitude is shown in nine ways.

original: ston pa'i dbang du byas nas phan gdags pa yid la byed pa ni gang gi phyir byas pa tshor ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i dbang du byas nas phan gdags pa yid la byed pa ni gang gi phyir byas pa tshor ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With regard to the teacher, he thinks of repaying his kindness, because he says, I feel his kindness.

original: chos mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas sems srung ba ni gang gi phyir des pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas sems srung ba ni gang gi phyir des pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With regard to the Dharma, he protects his thought, because he says, I am gentle.

original: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas ji skad bstan @186a * //üîΩpa bzhin du sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir 'grogs na bde ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas ji skad bstan @186a * // pa bzhin du sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir 'grogs na bde ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In terms of the enjoyment of the Dharma, he teaches the Dharma as it is, and he is patient with the disputes that arise when the Dharma is taught.üîΩHe is patient with the disputes that arise when the Dharma is taught.

original: nyes pa gleng ba dang dris pas 'khrug pa bzod par byed pa ni gang gi phyir drang ba dang mnyan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gleng ba dang dris pas 'khrug pa bzod par byed pa ni gang gi phyir drang ba dang mnyan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is patient with the disputes that arise when the Dharma is taught.

original: zang zing la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩsbyin bdag rnams rang gi nyes pa yang dag par mi 'chab pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan mi brjod pa ni gang gi phyir thibs po med par spyod pa dang sgyu med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas / sbyin bdag rnams rang gi nyes pa yang dag par mi 'chab pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan mi brjod pa ni gang gi phyir thibs po med par spyod pa dang sgyu med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In terms of the enjoyment of material things,üîΩhe does not conceal the faults of benefactors, and he does not praise their unreal good qualities.

original: rang gi yon tan gyi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas khengs par mi 'gyur ba ni gang gi phyir nga rgyal med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yon tan gyi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas khengs par mi 'gyur ba ni gang gi phyir nga rgyal med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In terms of his own good qualities, he is not proud.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig brjod pa ni gang gi phyir bka' blo bde ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig brjod pa ni gang gi phyir bka' blo bde ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúbecause he is easy to admonish‚Äù is from the perspective of instruction.

original: gdams ngag gi dbang du byas nas ma nor bar 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir mthun par 'dzin pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag gi dbang du byas nas ma nor bar 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir mthun par 'dzin pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúbecause he is receptive to advice‚Äù is from the perspective of the precepts.

original: de ltar na de ston pa la lan du phan 'dogs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ston pa la lan du phan 'dogs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is engaged in repaying the kindness of the teacher who instructs him in this way.

original: de de ltar dul ba dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba na gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de ltar dul ba dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba na gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúhe is endowed with self-discipline‚Äù means that he is endowed with the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de ltar zhib dang ldan zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu gong ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhib dang ldan zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu gong ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúhe is endowed with tranquility‚Äù means that he is endowed with the higher fruits of that.

original: de ltar dul ba dang zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu 'og ma rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar dul ba dang zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu 'og ma rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúhe is endowed with self-discipline, tranquility, and gentleness‚Äù means that he is endowed with the lower fruits of that.

original: de dag ni gnyi gas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gnyi gas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distinguished by both.

original: de ltar bcu pa gnyis pas de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcu pa gnyis pas de ston pa'i ston pa la byas pa gzo ba nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the gratitude to the Teacher who teaches that, with the second quarter,

original: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bcu pa gsum pas de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba bcu pa gsum pas de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ston to //
translated: the third quarter teaches the application to the means of that, i.e., the very exertion of effort, with the words, ‚Äúhe is endowed with uninterrupted effort.‚Äù

original: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus mi nyams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with uninterrupted effort‚Äù means that his effort does not decline.

original: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus de yang rnam pa dgus yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa'i brtson 'grus de yang rnam pa dgus yang dag par ston te /
translated: Moreover, that uninterrupted effort is shown in nine aspects.

original: brtson 'grus de mtshungs pa nyid du 'jug pa ni gang gi phyir yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus de mtshungs pa nyid du 'jug pa ni gang gi phyir yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The engagement of that effort in equality is taught by the words, ‚Äúbecause he is endowed with effort that is not thoroughly afflicted.‚Äù

original: yongs su nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThoroughly afflicted‚Äù means

original: ha cang brtun pa dang / ha cang g-yel ba gnyis kyis dub pa dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang brtun pa dang / ha cang g-yel ba gnyis kyis dub pa dang bcas pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: that it is accompanied by fatigue due to both excessive exertion and excessive relaxation, and it is accompanied by secondary afflictions.

original: rang gi theg pa las mi g-yo ba nyid ni gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi theg pa las mi g-yo ba nyid ni gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He does not waver from his own vehicle, because he has irreversible striving.

original: shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa @186b nyid ni gang gi phyir shin tu rgyas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa @186b nyid ni gang gi phyir shin tu rgyas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He has a vast scope, because he has expansive striving.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don bya ba'i smon lam yongs su 'dzin pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don bya ba'i smon lam yongs su 'dzin pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He holds the vow to benefit countless beings, because he has infinite striving.

original: rtag tu gus pas 'jug pa nyid ni gang gi phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gus pas 'jug pa nyid ni gang gi phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He always acts with devotion, because he has purified striving.

original: de las gzhan pa'i brtson 'grus zil gyis gnon pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i brtson 'grus zil gyis gnon pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He surpasses all other strivings, because he has incomparable striving.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyis rgyun mi chod pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyis rgyun mi chod pa nyid ni gang gi phyir mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fact that he is not interrupted by all the arising of demons and afflictions is stated by the fact that he has unassailable effort.

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fact that he is a true gatherer is stated by the fact that he has effort that ripens all sentient beings.

original: the tshom gcod pa dang phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang shin tu ldan pa nyid ni gang gi phyir tshul dang tshul ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa dang phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang shin tu ldan pa nyid ni gang gi phyir tshul dang tshul ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fact that he is endowed with the cutting of doubts and the defeating of adversaries is stated by the fact that he has effort that distinguishes what is correct and incorrect.

original: de ltar bcu pa gsum pas de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsam pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcu pa gsum pas de'i thabs la sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsam pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the third of the ten groups shows the effort that is applied to the means for that.

original: de de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bcu pa bzhi pas de sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa ston to //
analyzed: de de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bcu pa bzhi pas de sngon du 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa ston to //
translated: and that is also the purification of the element of thought.

original: khams brtas pa byang chub kyi bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig dang po yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: khams brtas pa byang chub kyi bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig dang po yongs su bstan to //
translated: The increase of the element is shown by the fourth quarter, which is based on the thought of enlightenment.

original: de'i lam sgrub pa'i bsam pa ni gang gi phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang mi 'bral lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lam sgrub pa'i bsam pa ni gang gi phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang mi 'bral lo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The thought of the practice of the path is the thought of the superior resolve, which is indicated by the words: ‚Äúhe does not lose the element of superior resolve.‚Äù

original: khyad par rtogs par bya ba la nges pa shin tu gsal ba 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir mos pa'i khams shin tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs par bya ba la nges pa shin tu gsal ba 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir mos pa'i khams shin tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of a very clear certainty in the realization of the distinction is indicated by the words: ‚Äúhe becomes very pure in his devotion.‚Äù

original: rgyu de las byung ba'i gnyen po 'phel ba ni gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba yang kun du skye'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba'i gnyen po 'phel ba ni gang gi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba yang kun du skye'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The increase of the counteragent that arises from that cause is indicated by the words: ‚Äúhe also produces the increase of the roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'bri ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi dri ma'i nag nog dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'bri ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi dri ma'i nag nog dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The decrease of adverse factors is stated as follows: ‚ÄúBecause one becomes free from the stains of worldly defilements.‚Äù

original: sa de'i gsang ba la the tshom za ba ldog pa ni gang gi phyir the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur yang rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa de'i gsang ba la the tshom za ba ldog pa ni gang gi phyir the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur yang rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The cessation of doubt about the secrets of that stage is stated as follows: ‚ÄúBecause doubt, uncertainty, and skepticism are also interrupted.‚Äù

original: de log na the tshom gyi gnas gzhan la yang mos @187a * //üîΩpa ni gang gi phyir som nyi med pa mngon du 'gyur ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de log na the tshom gyi gnas gzhan la yang mos @187a * // pa ni gang gi phyir som nyi med pa mngon du 'gyur ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: When that is ceased, there is no more interest in other objects of doubt.üîΩThe attainment of the special bliss of meditative concentration is stated as follows: ‚ÄúBecause the absence of doubt manifests and is perfected.‚Äù

original: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special ease is stated as follows: ‚ÄúBecause joy and pliancy are also accomplished.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi don yongs su smin par byed nus pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don yongs su smin par byed nus pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And because of that, the blessings of the Tathagatas are also directly perceived.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam pa'i dbang du byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: With regard to the intention of accomplishing immeasurable concentrations in order to purify the obstructions to omniscience, it is said:

original: sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And immeasurable mental intentions are also accomplished.üîΩAnd with regard to the purification of the equality of intention, superior intention, and aspiration, it is said:

original: de de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa mnyam pa nyid du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni yongs su dag pa de'i sa pa de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa mnyam pa nyid du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni yongs su dag pa de'i sa pa de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And that is purified to a greater degree, and is purified equally with other Bodhisattvas on that same ground of purity.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram rgyan du byas pa'i dpes ni lung gis khong du chud par byed pas rtogs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dus byas pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram rgyan du byas pa'i dpes ni lung gis khong du chud par byed pas rtogs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dus byas pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The example of gold fashioned into ornaments shows that the gnosis of realization is fully formed through the process of being brought to realization by the scriptures.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pas rgyan du byas pa ni de ma yin pa'i gser gyi sa le sbram rgyan du ma byas pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pas rgyan du byas pa ni de ma yin pa'i gser gyi sa le sbram rgyan du ma byas pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes
translated: O children of the buddhas, it is like this: the finest gold fashioned into ornaments by a skilled goldsmith cannot be surpassed by any other pieces of unadorned gold.

original: gsungs pa'o // nor bu rin po che 'od 'byung ba'i dpes ni chos kyi sgo du ma'i don la 'jug pas rtogs pa'i ye shes chos la snang ba nor bu rin po che lta bu lung gi snang ba rab tu gtong ba de 'od lta bu'i ye shes rgyas pa dangüîΩldan par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // nor bu rin po che 'od 'byung ba'i dpes ni chos kyi sgo du ma'i don la 'jug pas rtogs pa'i ye shes chos la snang ba nor bu rin po che lta bu lung gi snang ba rab tu gtong ba de 'od lta bu'i ye shes rgyas pa dangüîΩldan par yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of the precious jewel that emits light shows that the gnosis of realization, which is like a precious jewel that illuminates the Dharma by engaging with the meaning of the many Dharma doors, is endowed with the light-like gnosis that fully emits the light of the scriptures.

original: de dang ldan pas sa 'di 'od 'phro ba can no zhes nges pa'i tshig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas sa 'di 'od 'phro ba can no zhes nges pa'i tshig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is endowed with that.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che 'od 'byung ba 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa can snang ba rab tu gtong ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rin po che'i rnam pa 'od yongs su maüîΩdag pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na nor bu rin po che 'od 'byung ba 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa can snang ba rab tu gtong ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rin po che'i rnam pa 'od yongs su ma dag pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this: for example, a precious gem that emits light, which has a pure orb of light rays, and emits radiance, is not outshone by other kinds of gems with impure light.

original: de la 'od 'byung ba ni 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'od 'byung ba ni 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, emitting light means being endowed with light.

original: 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa can ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa can ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having a pure orb of light rays means having a stainless orb of light.üîΩIt is skilled in completely destroying the perishable collection view of sentient beings and is foremost.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs @187b la lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa la mkhas pa dang / gtso bo yin zhing zhes bya ba la mkhas pa ni 'dir byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs @187b la lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa la mkhas pa dang / gtso bo yin zhing zhes bya ba la mkhas pa ni 'dir byed pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, skill should be understood as activity.

original: gtso bo ni mthu'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni mthu'o //
translated: Foremost means powerful.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du ci rigs su khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma bzhin du ci rigs su khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before, as appropriate.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The explanation of the fourth ground of the noble ones in the Ten Grounds is complete.

original: sa lnga pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fifth ground should be understood as presented in three parts:

original: nga rgyal gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: the antidote to pride, the special practice of the path of nonabiding, and the presentation of its result.

original: de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu po yid la bya ba phyir mi ldog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu po yid la bya ba phyir mi ldog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the distinction of pride is the ten mental contemplations of the equality of the mind that is pure of the intention, together with the nonreturner.

original: sngar ni chos rtogs pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por bstan gyi /üîΩsa 'di la ni sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: sngar ni chos rtogs pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por bstan gyi / sa 'di la ni sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa /
translated: Previously, the antidote to the pride of realizing the Dharma was taught.

original: tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po ston to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po ston to //
translated: Here, on this ground, the antidote to the pride of the different continuums of the mind that is pure is taught.

original: de la rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The thought of sameness of mind with regard to purity is the thought of sameness of mind with regard to purity.

original: de yang rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: And that is to be known as tenfold according to the distinctions of purity.

original: rnam par dag pa bcu ni sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa dag dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur ba de'i bye brag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bcu ni sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa dag dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur ba de'i bye brag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: The ten purities are to be known according to the distinctions of the Buddha natures and how they become Buddha natures.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the Buddha natures?

original: dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are the powers, etc. in the three times.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
translated: For, O Son of the Conqueror, the Bodhisattva who has completed the path on the fourth Bodhisattva stage enters the fifth Bodhisattva stage.

original: de rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
translated: He enters it with ten thoughts of sameness of mind with regard to purity.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The purity of the intention to attain the powers, etc. of the Buddhas of the three times is called the equality of intention.

original: de ltar dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa de dag bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum gyi stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa de dag bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the powers, etc. of the Buddhas of the three times,

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis ji @188a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis ji @188a * //
translated: he teaches how morality, concentration, wisdom, and the maturation of sentient beings

original: ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'gyur ba de dag ston to //
analyzed: ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'gyur ba de dag ston to //
translated: become the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas na tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, in terms of morality, the purity of intention toward pure morality is taught.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du byas na sems rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du byas na sems rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: In terms of meditative stabilization, it is said to be the sameness of thought in the purification of the mind.

original: / shes rab kyi dbang du byas na lta ba dang som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa sel ba rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: / shes rab kyi dbang du byas na lta ba dang som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa sel ba rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: In terms of wisdom, it is said to be the sameness of thought in the purification of the elimination of views, doubt, uncertainty, and regret; the sameness of thought in the purification of the knowledge of the path and not the path;

original: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the sameness of thought in the purification of the knowledge of the path; and the sameness of thought in the purification of the destruction by the higher and higher of all the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la lam ni spor bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la lam ni spor bar shes pa'o //
translated: Here, the path is known as the ‚Äúpath of application.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa la ni yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa la ni yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
translated: The destruction by the higher and higher of all the factors of enlightenment is taught in order to abandon just the mental.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas na sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas na sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In terms of bringing sentient beings to full maturity, it is called ‚Äúthe sameness of intention with regard to the purification of bringing all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lam gyi yan lag byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag nyid yongs su sbyangs pa shin tu byas pa'i phyir dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir yang de'i gong du lam gyi khyad par tshol zhing /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lam gyi yan lag byang chub kyi phyogs pa de dag nyid yongs su sbyangs pa shin tu byas pa'i phyir dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir yang de'i gong du lam gyi khyad par tshol zhing /
translated: ‚Äú O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who has attained the fifth bodhisattva stage, because he has thoroughly completed the purification of those very factors of enlightenment that are branches of the path and because he has thoroughly purified his superior intention, he seeks a special path beyond that.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di la yongs su sbyang ba shin tu byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs pa bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba 'di la yongs su sbyang ba shin tu byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs pa bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúbecause he has thoroughly completed the purification‚Äù means that on the fourth stage he has cultivated the factors of enlightenment.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid na bsam pa'i khams rnam par dag pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid na bsam pa'i khams rnam par dag pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Because of the thorough purification of the superior intention refers to the purification of the element of intention, etc.

original: lam gyi khyad par tshol zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: lam gyi khyad par tshol zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The search for the distinctive path refers to the distinctive practice of the non-abiding path.

original: de'i nga rgyal kun du gzhom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pas rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid de mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal kun du gzhom pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pas rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid de mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the complete destruction of pride.

original: yid la byed pa phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By entering into suchness, the intention of the mind is the same in regard to purity. Because of the accomplishment of that, the mental activity becomes irreversible.

original: rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid de ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du de la sems kyi bsam pa 'jog pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs @188b pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid de ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du de la sems kyi bsam pa 'jog pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs @188b pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention of the mind is the same in regard to purity, because the mind is placed in that just as it is. Therefore, it is said that one enters into suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa de yang rgyu brgyad kyis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa de yang rgyu brgyad kyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: That entry into suchness is demonstrated by eight causes.

original: byang chub kyi sems goms par byas pa ni gang gi phyir smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩtheg pa las mi g-yo ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje dang byams pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa bas stobs bskyed pa ni gang gi phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems goms par byas pa ni gang gi phyir smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // theg pa las mi g-yo ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje dang byams pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // dge ba'i rtsa bas stobs bskyed pa ni gang gi phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the power of the generation of the vow indicates the cultivation of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of compassion and the power of the vow indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: brtson pa ma bor ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ma bor ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir gong ma gong ma'i sa'i snang ba la blta ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir gong ma gong ma'i sa'i snang ba la blta ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the power of the roots of virtue indicates the stability of the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe phrase

original: mthu'i khyad par bla thabs thob pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩdran pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis so so rang gi mthu'i khyad par thob pa ni /
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par bla thabs thob pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa'o // dran pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis so so rang gi mthu'i khyad par thob pa ni /
translated: The special attainment of power is mentioned in the line, ‚Äúbecause he has taken up the blessing of the Tathagatas.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dran pa dang blo gros dang rtogs pa'i blo'i stobs skyed pa'i phyir yod la bya ba phyir mi ldog par gyur nas zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa dang blo gros dang rtogs pa'i blo'i stobs skyed pa'i phyir yod la bya ba phyir mi ldog par gyur nas zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The special attainment of his own power through the three kinds of superior wisdom, memory, etc., is mentioned in the line, ‚Äúbecause he has generated the power of memory, understanding, and realization.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rtogs pa'i sgras bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni rtogs pa'i sgras bye brag tu byas so //
translated: The wisdom born of meditation is called ‚Äúrealization‚Äù because it is unobstructed with regard to its object.

original: de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par ni shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / sems can la snying rtse nas rtsol ba'i khyad par dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par ni shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / sems can la snying rtse nas rtsol ba'i khyad par dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: The distinctive feature of the path of nonabiding is shown by two aspects: the distinctive feature of the knowledge of the knowable, and the distinctive feature of the effort of compassion for sentient beings.

original: de gnyis kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
translated: By these two, one does not abide in samsara or in nirvana.

original: shes pa rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: This knowledge of the knowable should be understood as twofold:

original: bden pa bzhi rab tu shes pa'i phyir bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi rab tu shes pa'i phyir bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The establishment of the reality of the four noble truths is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //üîΩ'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because he knows thus, he knows in accordance with reality that this is the noble truth of suffering.üîΩThis is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: bden @189a * //
analyzed: bden @189a * //
translated: He knows it as it really is.

original: pa bcu la mkhas pa'i phyir sems can yongs su dgrol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩde kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: pa bcu la mkhas pa'i phyir sems can yongs su dgrol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa ni gang gi phyir / de kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: Because of being skilled in the ten truths, the method of liberating sentient beings is set forth.üîΩHe is skilled in conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /üîΩmtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin /üîΩrnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin / rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in ultimate truth.üîΩHe is skilled in the truth of characteristics.üîΩHe is skilled in the truth of distinctions.

original: phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of differentiation.

original: dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of things.

original: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of arising.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: lam shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is skilled in the truth of the knowledge of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor bsgrub pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor bsgrub pa nas /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi states:üîΩThe bodhisattva who is skilled in the four noble truths is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation, and skilled in the fourfold noble truth of path.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la bden pa'i chos nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /üîΩ'bras bu dang rgyu'i bye brag gi bden pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa la mkhas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o // de la bden pa'i chos nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bye brag gi bden pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: He is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of cessation, and skilled in the fourfold noble truth of path in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the path.

original: gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid do //üîΩsems can rnam par dgrol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa yang gdul bya'i bye brag gis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i chos nyid do // sems can rnam par dgrol ba'i thabs rnam par gzhag pa yang gdul bya'i bye brag gis rig par bya ste /
translated: He is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of cessation, and skilled in the fourfold noble truth of path in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of path.üîΩHe is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of cessation, and skilled in the fourfold noble truth of path in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of path.

original: gdul bya dag ni rnam pa bdun no //üîΩnyan thos kyi gdul bya ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gdul bya dag ni rnam pa bdun no // nyan thos kyi gdul bya ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: He is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of cessation, and skilled in the fourfold noble truth of path in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of path.

original: yongs su ma smin pa de'i don du kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa de'i don du kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mkhas so //
translated: He is skilled in the fourfold noble truth of suffering in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of suffering, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of origination in terms of the differentiation of the characteristics of the truth of origination, skilled in the fourfold noble truth of cessation in terms of the differentiation of the

original: yongs su smin pa de'i don du don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas so //üîΩchos nyid zab mo nyid la kun du rmongs pa de'i don du mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa de'i don du don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas so // chos nyid zab mo nyid la kun du rmongs pa de'i don du mtshan nyid kyi bden pa la mkhas so //
translated: For the sake of that complete maturation, there is skill in ultimate reality.üîΩFor the sake of the confusion about the profound reality, there is skill in the reality of characteristics.

original: dgongs pa zab mo nyid la kun du rmongs pa de'i don du rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nyid la kun du rmongs pa de'i don du rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa la mkhas so //
translated: For the sake of the confusion about the profound intention, there is skill in the reality of differentiation.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa de'i don du phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa de'i don du phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa la mkhas so //
translated: For the sake of the lack of proper mental attention, there is skill in the reality of analysis.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba de'i don du dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba de'i don du dngos po'i bden pa la mkhas /
translated: For the sake of the lack of right view, there is skill in the reality of things.

original: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas ;
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i bden pa la mkhas ;
translated: Skill in the reality of arising.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa la mkhas /
translated: Skill in the reality of the knowledge of extinction and non-arising.

original: lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa la mkhas te /
analyzed: lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa la mkhas te /
translated: Skill in the reality of the engagement of the knowledge of the path.

original: dngos po'i bden pa la sogs pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: dngos po'i bden pa la sogs pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
translated: The reality of things and so on include the truth of suffering and so on.

original: theg pa chen pos gdul bya bdun pa de'i don du byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @189b go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba sgrub pa nas /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos gdul bya bdun pa de'i don du byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @189b go rims thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba sgrub pa nas /
translated: For the sake of the seventh kind of candidate, the one to be trained by the universal vehicle, he establishes the ten skills in the truths, from the establishment of the order of the stages of the bodhisattva's stages,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bden pa'i bar la mkhas pa bcu pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bden pa'i bar la mkhas pa bcu pa ste /
translated: up to the origination of the transcendent wisdom of the transcendent lords.

original: gang gi phyir des sems can gzhan dag gi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des sems can gzhan dag gi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par byed pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the conventional truth, because he satisfies the expectations of other beings in accordance with their thoughts.

original: bgrod pa theg pa gcig pu la yang dag par gzhol bas don dam pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //üîΩrang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bgrod pa theg pa gcig pu la yang dag par gzhol bas don dam pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so // rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the ultimate truth, because he is intent on the single vehicle which is the goal.üîΩHe knows the truth of characteristics, because he understands the specific and general characteristics.

original: chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the truth of differentiation, because he understands the presentation of the differentiation of phenomena.

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pas phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands the truth of the realization of the aggregates, elements, and sense-media by means of the analysis of their realization.

original: lus dang sems la nod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus dang sems la nod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands the truth of the object by means of the pleasant experience of body and mind.

original: 'gro bar mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'gro bar mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands the truth of arising by means of the realization of the connection with the life-cycle.

original: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad shin tu zhi bas zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands the truth of cessation and non-production by means of the complete pacification of all the sicknesses of the defilements.

original: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyi go rims mtshams sbyar bas sgrub pa nas /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so // rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyi go rims mtshams sbyar bas sgrub pa nas /
translated: He understands the truth of the entry into the knowledge of the path by means of the accomplishment of non-duality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes te /
translated: He understands the truth of the connection with the sequence of all the bodhisattva stages, up to the truth of the arising of the knowledge of the tathƒÅgatas, by means of the complete understanding of all the aspects.

original: de yang mos pas shes pa'i stobs bskyed pas shes kyi /
analyzed: de yang mos pas shes pa'i stobs bskyed pas shes kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is said that one knows by the power of generating the knowledge of faith,

original: ma lus par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but not by knowing everything without exception.

original: de la sa gzhan gyi go rims ni rang gi sa rnams la mtshams sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sa gzhan gyi go rims ni rang gi sa rnams la mtshams sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the order of the other stages should be understood as connecting with one's own stages.

original: skye ba thams cad du lus dang sems la sdug bsngal nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes te /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du lus dang sems la sdug bsngal nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes te /
translated: In all births, one fully knows the truth of things through the experience of suffering in body and mind,
