original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, Whatever feeling there is, that is suffering here.

original: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni lam gcig tu bgrod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas zhes bya ba ni lam gcig tu bgrod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By accomplishing the non-dual, it is said, because it is the path that goes in one direction.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By fully comprehending all aspects, it is said, because of being skilled in the five sciences.

original: mos pa'i shes pa'i stobs bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan la dmigs @190a * //
analyzed: mos pa'i shes pa'i stobs bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan la dmigs @190a * //
translated: By the power of generating the knowledge of faith, it is said, because one focuses on the reflection.

original: pa'i shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: pa'i shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is in order to generate the power of knowledge of that.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i shes pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i shes pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: It is not by means of the knowledge that focuses on the fully established need.

original: de ltar shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the pure wisdom with respect to the object of knowledge,

original: 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pas snying brtse ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pas snying brtse ba'i phyir /
translated: through knowing that all conditioned things are false and so on,

original: sems can la snying brtse bas rtsol ba ston te /
analyzed: sems can la snying brtse bas rtsol ba ston te /
translated: he teaches the exertion of compassion for sentient beings.üîΩBecause in that way, the mind that is accomplished through expertise in the truths correctly knows that all conditioned things are false, deceptive,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bden pa la mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa dang / bslu ba'i chos can dang / dku byed pa dang / byis pa 'drid par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bden pa la mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa dang / bslu ba'i chos can dang / dku byed pa dang / byis pa 'drid par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: and deceptive to the childish,

original: de de bas kyang shas cher sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de de bas kyang shas cher sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: he has even greater compassion for sentient beings.

original: byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The light of great love also shines forth.

original: de la kun brtags pa rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas brdzun pa'o //
translated: Here, it is false because it lacks the characteristics of permanence, etc.

original: rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas bslu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas bslu ba'i chos can no //
translated: It is deceptive because it is the basis for the adherence to permanence, etc.

original: dar ba'i mtha' ni rgud pa yin pas dku byed pa'o //
analyzed: dar ba'i mtha' ni rgud pa yin pas dku byed pa'o //
translated: It is a cheat because the end of prosperity is misfortune.

original: phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po 'phrogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po 'phrogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid pa'o //
translated: It is a fraud for the childish because fools are attracted by perfection.

original: de ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas brdzun nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pas brdzun nyid de /
translated: Thus, it is false because it lacks the characteristics of permanence, etc.

original: mtshan nyid dang rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas slu ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang rtag pa la sogs par mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas slu ba'i chos can te /
translated: It is deceptive because it is the basis for the adherence to the characteristics of permanence, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / dar ba'i mtha' ni rgud pa yin pas dku byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / dar ba'i mtha' ni rgud pa yin pas dku byed pa ste /
translated: It is a cheat because the end of prosperity is misfortune.

original: nyis dmigs dang phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po phrogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid pa ste /
analyzed: nyis dmigs dang phun sum tshogs pas skye bo blun po phrogs pa'i phyir byis pa 'drid pa ste /
translated: It is a fraud for the childish because fools are attracted by perfection.

original: gnas kyi tshig de dag gi don rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi tshig de dag gi don rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of these words of the station should be understood.

original: byis pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: byis pa ni de la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The childish are the station of attachment to that.

original: snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po'i snang bas ni snying brtse ba de'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po'i snang bas ni snying brtse ba de'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The light of great compassion and great love shows the distinction of that mercy.

original: sa snga ma las snying rje khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: sa snga ma las snying rje khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is great compassion because compassion is superior to the previous stage.

original: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byams pa chen po'i snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir byams pa chen po'i snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the light of great love because it is endowed with the knowledge of the means of protection through the distinction of the practice of the non-abiding path.

original: de de ltar ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa thob ste zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa thob ste zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan ma thag pa'o //
translated: Having attained the power of wisdom in that way means as it has just been taught.

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po'i snang bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po'i snang bas so //
translated: Along with the view of all sentient beings means through the light of great compassion and great love.

original: sangs rgyas kyi @190b ye shes mngon par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi @190b ye shes mngon par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because they aspire to the knowledge of a buddha indicates that they are motivated by compassion.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la so sor rtog ste zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po de ji ltar 'byung ba de yongs su ston te /
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la so sor rtog ste zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po de ji ltar 'byung ba de yongs su ston te /
translated: The phrase they discern the past and future of all conditioned entities indicates the manner in which great compassion arises.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston to //üîΩrten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtag pas sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa ni sngon gyi mtha' ma rig pa dang sred pa las byung ba'i sems can 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su zhugs pa phung po'i gnas las
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston to // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtag pas sdug bsngal la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa ni sngon gyi mtha' ma rig pa dang sred pa las byung ba'i sems can 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi rjes su zhugs pa phung po'i gnas las
translated: This is shown by means of two aspects.

original: ma bskyod pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag med pa /üîΩsrog med pa /
analyzed: ma bskyod pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag med pa / srog med pa /
translated: The phrase they discern dependent origination indicates the manner in which great compassion arises by means of the aspect of suffering. That is, they discern the truth of suffering as it truly is in relation to the stream of cyclic existence that is caused by ignorance and craving and that is made up of the heaps of suffering. This stream of cyclic existence is unmoved from the abodes of the heaps.üîΩIt is devoid of a self,üîΩdevoid of a vital principle,

original: gang zag med pa /
analyzed: gang zag med pa /
translated: and devoid of a person.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ji ltar 'grub pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ji ltar 'grub pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows perfectly as it is how the self and what pertains to the self are not established.

original: ma 'ongs pa med pa la rmongs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa de nyid ji ltar rgyun chad pa dang / mthar 'gyur ba dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa dang / yod pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa med pa la rmongs pa dang mngon par 'dod pa de nyid ji ltar rgyun chad pa dang / mthar 'gyur ba dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa dang / yod pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: He knows perfectly as it is how the non-existence of the future is confused and desired, and how that is not interrupted, does not end, does not go forth, and does not exist.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' ma rig pa dang sred pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' ma rig pa dang sred pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Here, the distinction of the prior limit arising from ignorance and craving means that it is not a bodhisattva.

original: de dag ni thabs mkhas pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni thabs mkhas pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That is because it arises from skillful means.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa smos pas ni srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa smos pas ni srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By mentioning ignorance and craving, it is because they are the roots of the branches of existence.

original: de las byung ba la sogs pas sems can rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag thob pa srid pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba la sogs pas sems can rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag thob pa srid pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The three types of sentient beings indicated by ‚Äúarising from that‚Äù and so on are those who seek desire, those who seek perverted celibacy, and those who seek existence up to the peak of existence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag med pa nyid ni don dam par de la yang bdag med pa dang / de yang bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag med pa nyid ni don dam par de la yang bdag med pa dang / de yang bdag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mass of suffering is devoid of self, because ultimately it is devoid of self and it is not a self.

original: de ltar bdag med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar bdag med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is thus devoid of self,

original: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis gnas pa dang / yang dang yang 'gro bar 'gro bas sems can gyi rgyun la rtag pa dang chad pa med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir de la srog dang gang zag tu 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis gnas pa dang / yang dang yang 'gro bar 'gro bas sems can gyi rgyun la rtag pa dang chad pa med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir de la srog dang gang zag tu 'dogs par byed de /
translated: the designation of life and person is made in order to teach that the continuum of sentient beings is neither permanent nor annihilated, because it endures by the power of the life faculty and because it goes to cyclic existence again and again.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir /üîΩsrog med pa /
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir / srog med pa /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to that,

original: gang zag med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said to be devoid of life and devoid of person.

original: za ba po dang bza' bar 'dogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: za ba po dang bza' bar 'dogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the imputation of the experiencer and the experienced,

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: he said, ‚Äúfree from ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: rgyu gang @191a * //
analyzed: rgyu gang @191a * //
translated: By what cause?

original: gis sngon gyi mtha' las sems can ci 'dra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal ci 'dra ba 'byung ba de so sor brtags nas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma rig pa dang sred pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar 'gag pa 'jig rten pa'i 'gog pa
analyzed: gis sngon gyi mtha' las sems can ci 'dra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal ci 'dra ba 'byung ba de so sor brtags nas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma rig pa dang sred pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar 'gag pa 'jig rten pa'i 'gog pa
translated: Having examined the kind of suffering that arises for sentient beings in the past, he sees that it is this very ignorance and craving that are the causes of future suffering.üîΩHe sees that the world does not know how to stop them,

original: las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / sdug bsngal de las nges par 'byung ba'i lam med pa ni de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las khyad par du 'phags pa dang / sdug bsngal de las nges par 'byung ba'i lam med pa ni de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that there is no path to deliverance from that suffering.

original: yod pa ni de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa ni de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: The existent is so because it is known as it truly is.

original: de ltar so sor rtog go //
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog go //
translated: Thus he examines.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog pa rnam pa 'di gcig gis snying rje de sdug bsngal yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog pa rnam pa 'di gcig gis snying rje de sdug bsngal yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: This one mode of reflection on dependent origination shows how compassion is focused on suffering as it truly is.

original: da ni dus ring po nas 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la so sor rtog pa rnam pa gnyis pas sdug bsngal bzod brlag pa la dmigs pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: da ni dus ring po nas 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs la so sor rtog pa rnam pa gnyis pas sdug bsngal bzod brlag pa la dmigs pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: Now, by means of two modes of reflection on the various sufferings that have been experienced over a long time, he shows how compassion is focused on the suffering of the world.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For, he thinks,

original: kye ma byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag ni mi shes pa rmongs pa dag ste /üîΩde dag gi lus grangs med pa 'gags la /
analyzed: kye ma byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag ni mi shes pa rmongs pa dag ste / de dag gi lus grangs med pa 'gags la /
translated: Alas! These foolish ordinary beings are ignorant and confused.

original: 'gag par 'gyur zhing 'gag bzhin te /
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur zhing 'gag bzhin te /
translated: Their bodies are countless, have ceased, are ceasing, and are in the process of ceasing.

original: de ltar 'chi yang lus la yid 'byung ba mi skyed cing sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor je bas je 'phel du byed ;üîΩ'khor ba'i rgyud la mi ldog /
analyzed: de ltar 'chi yang lus la yid 'byung ba mi skyed cing sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor je bas je 'phel du byed ; 'khor ba'i rgyud la mi ldog /
translated: Even though they die in this way, they do not develop disgust for the body, and they increase the machine of suffering.

original: phung po'i gnas mi 'dor /
analyzed: phung po'i gnas mi 'dor /
translated: They do not turn away from the continuum of cyclic existence.üîΩThey do not abandon the abode of the aggregates.

original: khams kyi sprul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khams kyi sprul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become weary of the emanations of the realms.

original: nga rgyal dang lta ba'i zug rdu mi 'byin /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lta ba'i zug rdu mi 'byin /
translated: They do not pull out the thorns of pride and views.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar bzhi par mi byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar bzhi par mi byed /
translated: They do not extinguish the blazing flames of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
translated: They do not dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: sred pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems stobs bcu'i ded dbon yongs su mi tshol zhing bdud kyi bsam pa thibs po'i rjes su song ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems stobs bcu'i ded dbon yongs su mi tshol zhing bdud kyi bsam pa thibs po'i rjes su song ste /
translated: They do not dry up the ocean of craving. They do not seek out the captain of the ten powers. They follow the thick intentions of MƒÅra.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas yongs su g-yengs shing /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas yongs su g-yengs shing /
translated: They are distracted by the churning of the sea monster of various nonvirtuous thoughts in the ocean of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: rton pa med kyang yid 'byung bar mi byed la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rton pa med kyang yid 'byung bar mi byed la 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not rely on anything, but they do not become disgusted.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po nyams su myong ba ngo mtshar che zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po nyams su myong ba ngo mtshar che zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is amazing that they experience the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, anxiety, and distress.

original: de la dus ring po nas 'brel pa dang sna tshogs @191b kyis snying rje sdug bsngal bzod brlag pa la dmigs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la dus ring po nas 'brel pa dang sna tshogs @191b kyis snying rje sdug bsngal bzod brlag pa la dmigs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, the long-term relationship and the various sufferings of compassion are fully explained.

original: lus grangs med pa 'gags zhes bya bas ni yun ring po nas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus grangs med pa 'gags zhes bya bas ni yun ring po nas 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase countless bodies have ceased indicates the long-term relationship.

original: sna tshogs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is there a variety?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / de 'gog pa dang lam dang bral bas sdug bsngal ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir dang / na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang /üîΩde 'gog pa dang bral ba dang / de'i lam dang bral bas sdug bsngal ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / de 'gog pa dang lam dang bral bas sdug bsngal ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir dang / na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / de 'gog pa dang bral ba dang / de'i lam dang bral bas sdug bsngal ba nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he discerns the suffering of birth, its origin, its cessation, and the path, and because he discerns the suffering of sickness, aging, and death, their origin, their cessation, and the path.

original: de la lus ni rkyen gyi kha na las te 'grub pas sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor te /
analyzed: de la lus ni rkyen gyi kha na las te 'grub pas sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor te /
translated: The body is a machine of suffering, since it is produced by the power of conditions.

original: tshig des skye ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su ston to //
analyzed: tshig des skye ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su ston to //
translated: This phrase indicates the suffering of birth.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyud las mi ldog ces bya ba ni kun 'byung ba ste srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyud las mi ldog ces bya ba ni kun 'byung ba ste srid pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot turning away from the stream of cyclic existence‚Äù indicates its origin, i.e., becoming.

original: phung po'i gnas mi 'dor zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'gog pa dang lam dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i gnas mi 'dor zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'gog pa dang lam dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot abandoning the abode of the aggregates‚Äù indicates the absence of cessation and the path.

original: khams kyi sbrul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams kyi sbrul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot becoming disenchanted with the snakes of the elements‚Äù indicates the absence of the cessation of suffering.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúnot becoming disenchanted with the snakes of the elements‚Äù indicates the absence of the cessation of suffering.

original: rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: the suffering of old age, sickness and death.

original: de mi mnyam pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlog pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa rnams dang / nye bar spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / srid pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams ni nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: de mi mnyam pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams dang / 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa rnams dang / nye bar spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / srid pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams ni nga rgyal dang /
translated: Because they arise from inequality.

original: lta ba'i zug ngu mi 'byin /
analyzed: lta ba'i zug ngu mi 'byin /
translated: Those who are engaged in false celibacy, those who are engaged in the search for sensual pleasure and who indulge in sensual pleasures, those who are engaged in the search for existence, do not cry out with the pain of pride and false view.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar ba zhi bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar ba zhi bar mi byed /
translated: They do not extinguish the blazing flames of passion, hatred and folly.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
translated: They do not dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: srid pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems zhes bya ba'i tshig rnams dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: They do not dry up the ocean of existence.

original: de'i kun 'byung ba yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de'i kun 'byung ba yongs su ston to //
translated: Thus, in due order, he shows the origin of suffering.

original: zhi ba'i phyogs su phyin par byed pa stobs bcu'i ded dbon yongs su mi tshol zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni de 'gog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyogs su phyin par byed pa stobs bcu'i ded dbon yongs su mi tshol zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni de 'gog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: He does not seek out the captain of the ten powers who will take him to the other shore of peace.

original: bdud kyi thibs po zhes bya ba'i phyir rgol ba'i lam du 'gro ba'i tshig gis ni lam dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs po zhes bya ba'i phyir rgol ba'i lam du 'gro ba'i tshig gis ni lam dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe path of the mƒÅras‚Äù indicates the absence of a path.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas zhes bya ba la khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas zhes bya ba la khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rtog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgitated by the crocodiles of various conceptual thoughts‚Äù means that the mind and mental factors of the three realms should be understood as conceptual thoughts.

original: 'di man chad ni byams pa chen po'i snang ba ji ltar 'byung ba de rab tu ston te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni byams pa chen po'i snang ba ji ltar 'byung ba de rab tu ston te /
translated: From here on, it shows how the light of great love arises.

original: gang gi phyir sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa mgon med @192a * //üîΩpa ; dpung gnyen med pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa mgon med @192a * // pa ; dpung gnyen med pa /
translated: Because sentient beings are thus tormented by suffering, they are without a protector,üîΩwithout a refuge,

original: skyabs med pa /üîΩgnas med pa /üîΩgzhi med pa /
analyzed: skyabs med pa / gnas med pa / gzhi med pa /
translated: without a support,üîΩwithout a basis,

original: rten med pa /
analyzed: rten med pa /
translated: without a foundation,üîΩblind,

original: long par gyur pa /
analyzed: long par gyur pa /
translated: and

original: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang / spris yog pa mun pas zil gyis gnon pa de dag gi don du gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba rnams ji lta bus sems can de dag shin tu rnam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur ba
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang / spris yog pa mun pas zil gyis gnon pa de dag gi don du gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba rnams ji lta bus sems can de dag shin tu rnam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur ba
translated: For the sake of those who are overcome by the darkness of the eggshell of ignorance, the shell of the egg of ignorance, and the darkness of the shell of the egg of ignorance, I will gather the accumulations of merit and wisdom alone, without a second, in such a way that those beings will attain complete purity,

original: nas / stobs bcu'i stobs kyi ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyi mtha' thug pa thob par 'gyur ba rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nas / stobs bcu'i stobs kyi ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyi mtha' thug pa thob par 'gyur ba rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: up to attaining the limit of the wisdom of the ten powers without attachment.

original: de la de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag ces bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag ces bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'o //
translated: In this regard, thus tormented by suffering is as stated.

original: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni de las yongs su thar bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgon med pa zhes bya ba ni de las yongs su thar bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Helpless is because there is no one to completely liberate them from that.

original: mgon med pa de yang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang ma gyur pa la dpung gnyen med pa /
analyzed: mgon med pa de yang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang ma gyur pa la dpung gnyen med pa /
translated: And that helplessness is the absence of a protector for those who are suffering and those who are not suffering.

original: skyabs med pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyabs med pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are of two kinds: those who have no refuge and those who have a refuge.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
translated: They are without a basis because they are separated from reliance on holy persons.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang bral ba'i phyir gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang bral ba'i phyir gzhi med pa'o //
translated: They are without a foundation because they are separated from listening to the holy Dharma.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir rten med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir rten med pa'o //
translated: They are without a support because they are separated from proper mental attention.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir long bar gyur pa'o //üîΩde dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyug ma dang / glo bur ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dag dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir long bar gyur pa'o // de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyug ma dang / glo bur ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dag dang ldan pas /
translated: They are blind because they are separated from right view.

original: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang / phris yog pa mun pas zil gyis non pa de dag gi don du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang / phris yog pa mun pas zil gyis non pa de dag gi don du zhes bya'o //
translated: They are enveloped in the eggshell of ignorance, and they are overcome by the darkness of the womb of ignorance.

original: gcig pu gnyis su med ces rgya cher 'byung ba ni rtsol ba'i khyad par de ston to //
analyzed: gcig pu gnyis su med ces rgya cher 'byung ba ni rtsol ba'i khyad par de ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalone, without a companion‚Äù shows the distinctive effort.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom‚Äù is stated in order to demonstrate the causes of high status and definite goodness.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving become extremely pure‚Äù is stated in order to distinguish it from the purity of the mundane path.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs zhes bya ba ni de'i dgras bdud pham pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs zhes bya ba ni de'i dgras bdud pham pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe power of the ten powers‚Äù is stated because it defeats the enemy, i.e., the demon.

original: ye shes chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rnam par dag pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe culmination of the unobstructed knowledge‚Äù is stated in order to distinguish it from the purity of the disciples.

original: de de ltar shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes pas mngon par sgrub pa'i blos sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don @192b spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang de dag kun sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de de ltar shin tu brtags pa'i ye shes pas mngon par sgrub pa'i blos sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don @192b spyod pa dang / don mthun pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang de dag kun sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, with a mind that is established in this kind of extremely discerning knowledge, whatever roots of virtue he creates, whether by generosity, kind words, actions that benefit others, or by practicing what one preaches, he dedicates them all to the protection of all sentient beings.

original: rtsom zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba de la shin tu brtags pa shes pas mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu so sor brtags pa'i shes pas dbang byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba de la shin tu brtags pa shes pas mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu so sor brtags pa'i shes pas dbang byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúrealization‚Äù means that one has mastery over the knowledge that is gained through thorough investigation.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las mngon par gdon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las mngon par gdon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto protect all sentient beings‚Äù means to rescue them from suffering.

original: yongs su bskyab pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /üîΩmi dge ba la gnas pa rnams dge ba la dgod par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su bskyab pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste / mi dge ba la gnas pa rnams dge ba la dgod par 'dod pa ni /
translated: That protection should be understood as having nine forms:

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The desire to establish those who are engaged in nonvirtuous actions in virtue is the wish to benefit all sentient beings.

original: dge ba la gnas pa rnams de'i 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la bde bar 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la gnas pa rnams de'i 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la bde bar 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The desire to cause those who are engaged in virtuous actions to obtain the results of those actions is the wish to make all sentient beings happy.

original: phongs pa rnams la yo byad kyis sdud pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams la yo byad kyis sdud pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la snying brtse ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The desire to gather to oneself those who are in need is the compassion for all sentient beings.

original: nad dang gzhan gyis gtang ba'i nad dang / 'dres pa rnams la de zhi bar bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la brtse ba med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nad dang gzhan gyis gtang ba'i nad dang / 'dres pa rnams la de zhi bar bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la brtse ba med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of mercy are: mercy for those who are sick, mercy for those who are not sick, mercy for those who are sick and not sick, and mercy for those who are not sick and not not sick. üîΩThe four kinds of compassion are: compassion for those who are bound in cyclic existence, compassion for those who are not bound in cyclic existence, compassion for those who are bound and not bound, and compassion for those who are not bound and not not bound. üîΩThe four kinds of sympathy are: sympathy for those who are not established in the true doctrine, sympathy for those who are established in the true doctrine, sympathy for those who are and are not established in the true doctrine, and sympathy for those who are neither established nor not established in the true doctrine. üîΩThe four kinds of commiseration are: commiseration for those who are not converted, commiseration for those who are converted, commiseration for those who are and are not converted, and commiseration for those who are neither converted nor not converted. üîΩThe four kinds of mercy are: mercy for those who are sick, mercy for those who are not sick, mercy for those who are sick and not sick, and mercy for those who are not sick and not not sick.

original: 'khor bar bcings pa rnams de las thar bar bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba zhes gsungs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩmu stegs can rnams dam pa'i chos la gzud pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad grang ba zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩdogs pa can rnams nges pa bskyed pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad dad par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar bcings pa rnams de las thar bar bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba zhes gsungs pa rnam pa bzhi ste / mu stegs can rnams dam pa'i chos la gzud pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad grang ba zhes gsungs pa'o // dogs pa can rnams nges pa bskyed pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad dad par bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of compassion are: compassion for those who are bound in cyclic existence, compassion for those who are not bound in cyclic existence, compassion for those who are bound and not bound, and compassion for those who are not bound and not not bound. üîΩThe four kinds of sympathy are: sympathy for those who are not established in the true doctrine, sympathy for those who are established in the true doctrine, sympathy for those who are and are not established in the true doctrine, and sympathy for those who are neither established nor not established in the true doctrine.

original: dogs pa med pa rnams bslab pa gsum la gzud pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩsems can thams cad gdul ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa rnams bslab pa gsum la gzud pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩsems can thams cad gdul ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of commiseration are: commiseration for those who are not converted, commiseration for those who are converted, commiseration for those who are and are not converted, and commiseration for those who are neither converted nor not converted.

original: der btsud pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i phyir rtsom ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: der btsud pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob par bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i phyir rtsom ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause he is engaged in the complete nirvana of all sentient beings‚Äù is stated.

original: de la sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i tshig dgu po de dag las /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i tshig dgu po de dag las /
translated: Among those nine phrases about protection from suffering,

original: dang po gnyis ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi don to //
translated: the first two are for the sake of other lives.

original: lhag ma rnams ni tshe 'di'i don to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni tshe 'di'i don to //
translated: The remaining ones are for the sake of this life.

original: 'di man chad ni mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu ste /üîΩyon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems @193a * //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi 'bras bu ste / yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems @193a * //
translated: From here on is the special result of accomplishing the path of non-abiding.

original: can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / de dang mthun par 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in terms of four topics: the special establishment of the possession of good qualities, the special establishment of accomplishment, the special establishment of the ripening of sentient beings, and the special establishment of the accomplishment of worldly knowledge in accordance with that.

original: de la yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The distinctive feature of the possession of good qualities should be understood as the distinctive feature of the possession of learning, morality, and knowledge.

original: thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par can no //
analyzed: thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par can no //
translated: The distinctive feature of the possession of learning is the distinctive feature of the wisdom born of learning, reflection, and meditation.

original: shes rab kyi khyad par de yang ji ltar yongs su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi khyad par de yang ji ltar yongs su bstan zhe na /
translated: How is the distinctive feature of wisdom taught?

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa shin tu spyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bas kyang shas cher brjed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis dran pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa shin tu spyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bas kyang shas cher brjed par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis dran pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Because the bodhisattva who is on this fifth bodhisattva stage, Difficult to Conquer, is even more endowed with mindfulness by the nature of non-forgetfulness.

original: shin tu nges pa'i shes pas blo gros dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: shin tu nges pa'i shes pas blo gros dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He is endowed with intelligence by the wisdom of very certain knowledge.

original: mdo'i tshul dgongs te gsungs pa khong du chud par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshul dgongs te gsungs pa khong du chud par rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with realization by the realization of the intention of the way of the s≈´tras.

original: de la dran pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de la dran pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Among them, one who is mindful is superior in the wisdom born of listening.

original: blo gros dang ldan pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: One who is intelligent is superior in the wisdom born of reflection.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: One who is realized is superior in the wisdom born of meditation.

original: rnam grangs gzhan dun dran pa dang ldan pas ni thos pa 'dzin pa khyad par du 'phags /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan dun dran pa dang ldan pas ni thos pa 'dzin pa khyad par du 'phags /
translated: Another enumeration: One who is mindful is superior in retaining what is heard.

original: blo gros dang ldan pas ni chos nyid zab mo khyad par du 'phags /
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan pas ni chos nyid zab mo khyad par du 'phags /
translated: One who is intelligent is superior in the profound reality of phenomena.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni dgongs pa zab mo khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni dgongs pa zab mo khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: One who is realized is superior in the profound intention.

original: tshig 'di dag go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig 'di dag go rims bzhin no //
translated: These are in order.

original: 'di ni chos la mkhas pa dang / don la mkhas pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la mkhas pa dang / don la mkhas pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is a summary of the expertise in the teachings and the expertise in the meaning.

original: tshul khrims yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni bzod pa dang nges pa'i khyad par dang / tshul khrims las mi 'da' ba'i khyad par dang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni bzod pa dang nges pa'i khyad par dang / tshul khrims las mi 'da' ba'i khyad par dang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The distinctive feature of the possession of morality is to be known as twofold: the distinctive feature of patience and of certainty, and the distinctive feature of not transgressing morality.

original: gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan rjes su bsrungs pas ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan rjes su bsrungs pas ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Because he protects himself and others, he has a sense of shame.

original: sngom pa'i cho ga mi 'dor bas brtun pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sngom pa'i cho ga mi 'dor bas brtun pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he does not abandon the rite of restraint, he is conscientious.

original: shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa lngas yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: shes pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa lngas yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The distinctive feature of the possession of knowledge is the distinctive feature of the possession of five kinds of knowledge.

original: shes pa rnam pa lnga la rgyu med pa dang / mi 'dra ba rgyur lta ba'i gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa lnga la rgyu med pa dang / mi 'dra ba rgyur lta ba'i gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of dependent origination is the antidote to the view that cause and effect are either causeless or of a different nature.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pas rnam par dpyad @193b pas blo dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pas rnam par dpyad @193b pas blo dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he analyzes with skill in the possible and impossible, he is intelligent.

original: bdud kyi las kyi gnyen por rtog pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi gnyen por rtog pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of conceptualization is the antidote to the works of Mara.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis mi bkri ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyis mi bkri ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels and the perfections, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels and the perfections.

original: nag po bsten pa'i gnyen por lhad bcug pa shes shing /
analyzed: nag po bsten pa'i gnyen por lhad bcug pa shes shing /
translated: In order to counteract the attainment of a bad refuge, he has the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels and the perfections.üîΩBecause he has the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels and the perfections, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels and the perfections.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the perfections, he has the knowledge of the power of the perfections.üîΩBecause he has the knowledge of the power of the perfections, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the perfections.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the spiritual levels, he has the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels.

original: don gyi tshig dang / don ma yin pa'i tshig dang ; 'dres pa'i tshig la mkhas pa ni gang gi phyir don dang don ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i tshig la mkhas pas shes rab dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshig dang / don ma yin pa'i tshig dang ; 'dres pa'i tshig la mkhas pa ni gang gi phyir don dang don ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i tshig la mkhas pas shes rab dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the spiritual levels.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the superknowledges, he has the knowledge of the power of the superknowledges.üîΩBecause he has the knowledge of the power of the superknowledges, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the superknowledges.

original: skyabs ngan pa bsgrub pa'i gnyen por mthu shes pa ni gang gi phyir /üîΩbsgom pa sgrub pa la mkhas pas mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa thob pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs ngan pa bsgrub pa'i gnyen por mthu shes pa ni gang gi phyir / bsgom pa sgrub pa la mkhas pas mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa thob pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In order to counteract the non-attainment of the means of unification, he has the knowledge of the power of the means of unification.üîΩBecause he has the knowledge of the power of the means of unification, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the means of unification.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the maturation of sentient beings, he has the knowledge of the power of the maturation of sentient beings.üîΩBecause he has the knowledge of the power of the maturation of sentient beings, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the maturation of sentient beings.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the means of unification, he has the knowledge of the power of the means of unification.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pas thabs la mkhas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba shes pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par 'jug pas thabs la mkhas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has the knowledge of the power of the means of unification, he is endowed with the knowledge of the power of the means of unification.üîΩIn order to counteract the non-attainment of the maturation of sentient beings, he has the

original: de la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni sgrub pa rnam pa bcu'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni sgrub pa rnam pa bcu'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
translated: The special practice should be known as the special practice of the ten practices.

original: sgrub pa rnam pa bcu la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pas ngoms mi shes pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam pa bcu la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pas ngoms mi shes pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special practice of the cause of the higher realms is the insatiable accumulation of the collection of merit.

original: nges par legs pa'i rgyu sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i rgyu sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special practice of the cause of definite goodness is the uninterrupted effort of the accumulation of the collection of wisdom.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yongs su mi skyo bar sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i tshogs bsags pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yongs su mi skyo bar sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i tshogs bsags pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special practice of not being discouraged in the ripening of sentient beings is the attitude of not being discouraged through the accumulation of the collection of great love and compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yongs su tshol bas snyom las med par yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yongs su tshol bas snyom las med par yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the realization of the qualities of a Buddha is that, because of seeking the powers, fearlessnesses, and unshared qualities of a Buddha, one is diligent in seeking without laziness.

original: zhing yongs su dag par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrubs pas legs par mngon par bsgrub pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrubs pas legs par mngon par bsgrub pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the realization of a pure realm is that, because of accomplishing the adornment of a Buddha realm, one has the mental activity of accomplishing it well.

original: de'i rgyan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos po dang / ye shes gyi khyad zhugs pa thob pa'i sems can gyi gnas dang / sangs rgyas @194a * //üîΩkyi chos rnams kyis spud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos po dang / ye shes gyi khyad zhugs pa thob pa'i sems can gyi gnas dang / sangs rgyas @194a * //üîΩkyi chos rnams kyis spud pa'o //
translated: Its adornment is the state of being without defilement, the abode of beings who have attained the excellence of special intuition, and the enrichment of the Buddha qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas pa mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yang dag par bsgrubs pas dge ba sna tshogs bya ba la brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas pa mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yang dag par bsgrubs pas dge ba sna tshogs bya ba la brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the practice of abiding in the Buddha qualities is that, since he has accomplished the major and minor marks, he is diligent in performing various virtues.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan yongs su tshol bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par shin tu mngon par brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la gnas par bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang thugs kyi rgyan yongs su tshol bas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par shin tu mngon par brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the practice of abiding in the Buddha qualities is that, since he seeks the adornments of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagata, he is always and uninterruptedly very diligent.

original: chos la gus pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang chos smra ba thams cad la rim gro byed pas bsnyen bkur dang sri zhu chen po'i dang tshul can yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gus pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang chos smra ba thams cad la rim gro byed pas bsnyen bkur dang sri zhu chen po'i dang tshul can yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The practice of respect for the Dharma is that, since he serves all the bodhisattvas and Dharma preachers, he is one who has the manner of great reverence and service.

original: ched du bsam ste srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa chen pos 'jig rten du mtshams sbyor bar 'jug pas smon lam shin tu btab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsam ste srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pa chen pos 'jig rten du mtshams sbyor bar 'jug pas smon lam shin tu btab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The practice of deliberately taking up existence is that, because of great skill in means, he enters into the womb of the world, and so is endowed with a mind that has made extremely firm aspirations.

original: theg pa chung dus rnam par g-yengs pa med pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pas nyin mtshan du sems can gzhan yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chung dus rnam par g-yengs pa med pa'i sgrub pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pas nyin mtshan du sems can gzhan yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The practice of being undistracted by the Lesser Vehicle is that, because he is intent on bringing all sentient beings to maturity, he is constantly occupied with the welfare of other sentient beings, day and night.

original: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir de de ltar mngon par brtson pas sbyin pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir de de ltar mngon par brtson pas sbyin pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The difference in bringing sentient beings to maturity through the four principles for attracting a following is that, because he is intent in this way, he brings sentient beings to maturity through generosity.

original: snyan par smra ba dang / do na spyod pa dang don mthun pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / do na spyod pa dang don mthun pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He brings them to maturity through pleasant speech, through helpful activity, and through harmony of behavior.

original: rang gi rigs la chags pa rnams la sprul pa rnams kyis skal ba 'dra bar mthun par 'jug pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir gzugs kyi lus kun du bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩthe tshom za ba rnams la rigs pa yongs su brjod pa ni gang gi phyir chos bshad pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbyang chub la thabs 'khrul pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rigs la chags pa rnams la sprul pa rnams kyis skal ba 'dra bar mthun par 'jug pa ni / gang gi phyir gzugs kyi lus kun du bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o // the tshom za ba rnams la rigs pa yongs su brjod pa ni gang gi phyir chos bshad pa zhes gsungs pa'o // byang chub la thabs 'khrul pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩtheg pa chen pos yongs su skyo ba rnams ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid smos pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pa zhes gsungs pa'o // theg pa chen pos yongs su skyo ba rnams ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid smos pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For those who are free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.üîΩ For those who are not free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.üîΩ For those who are free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.üîΩ For those who are not free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.üîΩ For those who are free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.

original: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba rnams la ni gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i nyes pa bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba rnams la ni gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i nyes pa bstan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For those who are not free from desire, the emanations enter in a way that is similar to their fortune.

original: theg @194b pa chen po la mi 'jug pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: theg @194b pa chen po la mi 'jug pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir /
translated: For those

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi phan yon yongs su bsnyad pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi phan yon yongs su bsnyad pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs wisdom is said to be the benefit.

original: blo chung ba mthu la mos pa rnams la gcig tu gyur nas kyang rnam pa du mar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: blo chung ba mthu la mos pa rnams la gcig tu gyur nas kyang rnam pa du mar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par bsgrubs pas /
translated: For those of little intelligence who are devoted to power, he manifests a single form as many forms, and so on, and accomplishes the great miraculous transformation.

original: nye bar spyad pa sna tshogs kyi bya ba sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar spyad pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes gsungs
analyzed: nye bar spyad pa sna tshogs kyi bya ba sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par bsgrubs pas nye bar spyad pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes gsungs
translated: He engages in the activity of various enjoyments, because he engages in the activity of enjoyment by accomplishing the great miraculous transformation.üîΩThus, he brings beings to maturity.

original: pa'o // de de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa de'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par brtson pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa de'o //
translated: Thus, he is intent on bringing beings to maturity, as explained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su smin par byed nus pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su song ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su smin par byed nus pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase whose mind is in accord with the pristine awareness of the buddhas is intended to show the special ability to ripen the pristine awareness of the buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba phyir mi ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang dag la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba phyir mi ldog pa yin te zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang dag la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase who is irreversible in the application of the roots of virtue refers to the qualities in which one is engaged.

original: khyad par can gyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi chos yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩFrom here on, the text should be understood as describing the special qualities of the bodhisattva's spiritual powers, which are in accord with the spiritual ripening of sentient beings and the attainment of mundane knowledge.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.

original: 'di man chad ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / mthun pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / mthun pa 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i khyad par du rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.

original: gnod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gang gi phyir de sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gang gi phyir de sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.üîΩThe phrase who is intent on seeking the special qualities refers to the desire for those special qualities.

original: 'jig rten ni yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag mngon par bsgrub bo zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de dag mngon par bsgrub bo zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The world is established in the letters, treatises, calculation, mathematics, and rhetoric.

original: de la yi ge la sogs pa ni gnod pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por mngon par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge la sogs pa ni gnod pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por mngon par bsgrub ste /
translated: The letters, etc. are established as antidotes to four kinds of harm.

original: gnod pa rnam pa bzhi la don dang bya ba brjed pa'i gnod pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa rnam pa bzhi la don dang bya ba brjed pa'i gnod pa ste /
translated: The four kinds of harm are: the harm of forgetting the meaning and the activity;

original: byin pa dang blangs pa ste /
analyzed: byin pa dang blangs pa ste /
translated: the harm of not taking up and not putting down;

original: gzhag pa dang thos pa dang / bsam pa'i don dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por yi ge'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa dang thos pa dang / bsam pa'i don dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por yi ge'o //
translated: the harm of not remembering what is heard and contemplated; and the harm of not knowing what is to be done and what is not to be done. The antidote to these is the letters.

original: lta ba ngan pa dang blo chung ba'i gnod pa de gnyis gtan tshigs dang / sgra'i bstan bcos gnyis kyis gsal ba'i phyir bstan bcos so //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa dang blo chung ba'i gnod pa de gnyis gtan tshigs dang / sgra'i bstan bcos gnyis kyis gsal ba'i phyir bstan bcos so //
translated: The two harms of bad views and small-mindedness are clarified by the two treatises of logic and grammar.

original: yongs su blangs pa'i nor ma sbas pa de'i gnyen por rgya'o //üîΩ'du ba dang 'god pa la @195a * //
analyzed: yongs su blangs pa'i nor ma sbas pa de'i gnyen por rgya'o //üîΩ'du ba dang 'god pa la @195a * //
translated: The antidote to the harm of not hiding one's wealth is calculation.üîΩThe antidote to the harm of not knowing how to gather and distribute is mathematics.

original: rmongs pa de'i gnyen por rtsis dang shod thabs te /
analyzed: rmongs pa de'i gnyen por rtsis dang shod thabs te /
translated: The antidote to that delusion is the science of calculation and the science of grammar.

original: de la rtsis ni gnyis gnyis bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtsis ni gnyis gnyis bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, calculation is the science of two, two, four, and so on.

original: shod thabs ni gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: shod thabs ni gzhag pa'o //
translated: Grammar is the science of the rules of composition.

original: nor bsgyur ba'i dpyad ni dbul ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: nor bsgyur ba'i dpyad ni dbul ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The science of alchemy is the antidote to the harm of poverty.

original: gso ba'i dpyad rnams ni khams mi mnyam pa dang / sems can dang / dug dang / rgyu las byung ba'i nad kyi gnod pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gso ba'i dpyad rnams ni khams mi mnyam pa dang / sems can dang / dug dang / rgyu las byung ba'i nad kyi gnod pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The science of medicine is the antidote to the harm of disease arising from imbalance of the elements, harm from sentient beings, harm from poison, and harm from natural disasters.

original: gang gi phyir nor bsgyur ba'i dpyad dang / gso ba'i dpyad skem pa dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po'i gdon bsal ba dang / dug dang / ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nor bsgyur ba'i dpyad dang / gso ba'i dpyad skem pa dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po'i gdon bsal ba dang / dug dang / ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because the science of alchemy and the science of medicine are taught as the removal of emaciation, forgetfulness, harm from elemental spirits, poison, and zombie spells.

original: de la skem pa dang brjed byed ni khams mi mnyam pa'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: de la skem pa dang brjed byed ni khams mi mnyam pa'i gnod pa'o //
translated: Among them, emaciation and forgetfulness are the harm of imbalance of the elements.

original: 'byung po'i gdon ni sems can gyi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon ni sems can gyi gnod pa'o //
translated: Harm from elemental spirits is the harm of sentient beings.

original: dug sbyor ba ni dug gi gnod pa'o //
analyzed: dug sbyor ba ni dug gi gnod pa'o //
translated: Poison spells are the harm of poison.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i gnad kyi gnod pa ni ro langs kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i gnad kyi gnod pa ni ro langs kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The remedy for the harm of the elements is the practice of the zombie.

original: snyan dngags dang / gar thabs dang / gtam rgyud dang / rol mo dang sngon byung bas rab tu dga' bar bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: snyan dngags dang / gar thabs dang / gtam rgyud dang / rol mo dang sngon byung bas rab tu dga' bar bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The remedy for the harm of mental unhappiness is the delight in poetry, dance, drama, music, and stories.

original: grong dang grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / sman dang nags tshal mngon par sgrub pa ni gnas la mngon par mi dga' ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / sman dang nags tshal mngon par sgrub pa ni gnas la mngon par mi dga' ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The remedy for the harm of not enjoying one's dwelling is the creation of towns, cities, parks, waterfalls, lakes, ponds, flowers, fruits, medicinal herbs, and forests.

original: gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dha ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / rin po che'i 'byung khungs bstan pa ni gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang chad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dha ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / rin po che'i 'byung khungs bstan pa ni gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang chad pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The remedy for the harm of killing, binding, punishing, and so on is the teaching of the sources of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, and coral.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang ; gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gcan gzan gyi la nye dang / bya'i la nye dang / rmi ltas kyi ltas ston pa shes pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad kyi mtshan dang spyod tshul gyi sbyor ba ni mthong ba dang /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang ; gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gcan gzan gyi la nye dang / bya'i la nye dang / rmi ltas kyi ltas ston pa shes pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad kyi mtshan dang spyod tshul gyi sbyor ba ni mthong ba dang /
translated: the knowledge of the moon, the sun, the planets, the stars, the constellations, earthquakes, the cries of beasts, birds, and omens in dreams, and the knowledge of the signs and behavior of all the major and minor parts of the body.

original: rnam par smin pas thob pa'i yan lag gi nyes pa las gyur pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pas thob pa'i yan lag gi nyes pa las gyur pa'i rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnod pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to the harm of the afflictions that arise from the faults of the ripened parts.

original: zla ba la sogs pa rmi lam yan chad dang / gza' la sogs pa'i ltas mthong bas mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa rmi lam yan chad dang / gza' la sogs pa'i ltas mthong bas mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one will know the results of desirable and undesirable actions from seeing the signs of the moon, etc., in dreams, and from seeing the signs of the planets, etc.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag thams @195b cad kyi mtshan gyis kyang mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag thams @195b cad kyi mtshan gyis kyang mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because one will know the results of desirable and undesirable actions from the signs of all the major and minor parts of the body.

original: sdom pa'i mchog dang gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang gzugs med pa'i gnas rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: sdom pa'i mchog dang gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang gzugs med pa'i gnas rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The supreme vows, the meditative states, the superknowledges, the immeasurables, and the formless states are the antidotes to the five secondary afflictions.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five secondary afflictions are:

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / skyabs ngan pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / log pa'i bsod nams la sbyor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / log pa'i thar pa la sbyor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / skyabs ngan pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / log pa'i bsod nams la sbyor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / log pa'i thar pa la sbyor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the secondary affliction of immorality, the secondary affliction of attachment to sense objects, the secondary affliction of taking refuge in inferior conditions, the secondary affliction of engaging in false merit, and the secondary affliction of engaging in false liberation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa de yang rgyu bzhi dang ldan par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa de yang rgyu bzhi dang ldan par yongs su ston te /
translated: That mundane knowledge is also fully taught to have four causes:

original: gnod pa gzhan gyis gnod pa bya ba med pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa gzhan gyis gnod pa bya ba med pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The absence of harm from others is because of that.

original: gzhan yang gang rnam par tho 'tshams pa med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang rnam par tho 'tshams pa med pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The purity of the cause is stated as:üîΩthe generation of the happiness that is irreproachable,üîΩthe generation of the happiness that is irreproachable is stated as:

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyed pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba de dag ces gsungs pa'o //
