analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyed pa ni gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba de dag ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: for the benefit and happiness of all beings.üîΩThe purity of the means is stated as:üîΩthe means of the bodhisattva who is endowed with compassion.

original: 'byung bar byed par rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir snying rje dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed par rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir snying rje dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The purity of the objective is stated as:üîΩthe objective of the bodhisattva who is endowed with skill in means.üîΩThe purity of the basis is stated as:üîΩthe basis of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the perfections.üîΩThe purity of the application is stated as:üîΩthe application of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the aids to enlightenment.

original: dgos pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde de bas kyang shas cher thos pa'i rnam pa'i gzungs thob pa'i chos smra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi gzungs thob pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde de bas kyang shas cher thos pa'i rnam pa'i gzungs thob pa'i chos smra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi gzungs thob pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The purity of the support is stated as:üîΩthe support of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the immeasurables.üîΩThe purity of the entry is stated as:üîΩthe entry of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the doors to liberation.üîΩThe purity of the field is stated as:üîΩthe field of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the superknowledges.üîΩThe purity of the accomplishment is stated as:üîΩthe accomplishment of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the superknowledges.üîΩThe purity of the activity is stated as:üîΩthe activity of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the modes of the arts.üîΩThe purity of the absence of contention is stated as:üîΩthe absence of contention of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the world.üîΩThe purity of the absence of confusion is stated as:üîΩthe absence of confusion of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the ripening of karma.üîΩThe purity of the absence of dejection is stated as:üîΩthe absence of dejection of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the faculties.üîΩThe purity of the absence of pride is stated as:üîΩthe absence of pride of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the path that goes everywhere.üîΩThe purity of the absence of doubt is stated as:üîΩthe absence of doubt of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the four forms of logical reasoning.üîΩThe purity of the absence of confusion is stated as:üîΩthe absence of confusion of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the knowledge of the past and future.üîΩThe purity of the absence of contention is stated as:üîΩthe absence of

original: rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams bya bar shin tu dga' ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la yang mngon par dga' la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams bya bar shin tu dga' ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la yang mngon par dga' la /
translated: And because of the joy in the equality of mental attitude toward purity, and the joy in the transcendent wisdom,

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa la yang mngon par phyogs par bya ba dang / thos pa'i gzungs thob par shin tu dga' ba'i phyir sa 'di ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa la yang mngon par phyogs par bya ba dang / thos pa'i gzungs thob par shin tu dga' ba'i phyir sa 'di ni shin tu sbyang dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the joy in the attainment of the retention of what is heard, this stage is known as Difficult to Conquer.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram spug gis phyis pa'i dpes ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pas sa ye shes ches byang bar yongs su ston te /
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram spug gis phyis pa'i dpes ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang ldan pas sa ye shes ches byang bar yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of gold washed in fire shows the purification of wisdom by the accomplishment of mundane knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid spug gis phyis na /üîΩde bas kyang ches rab tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu @196a * //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid spug gis phyis na / de bas kyang ches rab tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu @196a * //
translated: That same refined gold, when washed in fire,

original: 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: becomes even purer, more cleansed, and brighter.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang ches rab tu byang ba dang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang ches rab tu byang ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas who are on this bodhisattva ground, Difficult to Master, are examined with wisdom and skillful means, and they become even more purified.

original: yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu 'od gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu 'od gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O children of the buddhas, in the same way, the roots of virtue of bodhisattvas on this bodhisattva level, Ground of Heroic Progress, are even more purified, more refined, and more radiant, through their examination with wisdom and skillful means.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpes ni lung la brten pa'i shes pa rab tu 'phel bas sa snga ma'i shes pa las mchog tu gyur pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpes ni lung la brten pa'i shes pa rab tu 'phel bas sa snga ma'i shes pa las mchog tu gyur pa yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of the orbs of the sun, moon, and so forth shows how, through the increase of the knowledge based on the scriptures, the knowledge of this level is superior to that of the previous level.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O children of the buddhas, it is like this.

original: dper na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi gzhal med khang gi 'od snang ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang rgyu skar rnams kyi gzhal med khang gi 'od snang ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: The light of the palaces of the sun, moon, planets, stars, and constellations cannot be outshone by the orbs of the wind.

original: rlung dmar dang thun mong ma yin no //üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis
analyzed: rlung dmar dang thun mong ma yin no // kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa shin tu sbyang dka' ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis
translated: It is not shared with the storm winds.üîΩO children of the victors, in the same way, the roots of virtue of bodhisattvas on this bodhisattva level, Hard to Master, which are investigated with wisdom and skill in means, cannot be overcome by all the

original: mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are not shared with the whole world.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: The Ten Levels Sutra says:

original: sa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifth bodhisattva level is complete.

original: // / nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gsum po gang dag kho nas sa lnga pa rnam par gzhag pa de dag nyid kyis drug pa yang rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: // / nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa gsum po gang dag kho nas sa lnga pa rnam par gzhag pa de dag nyid kyis drug pa yang rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The sixth ground is to be understood as being set forth by the very same three topics by which the fifth ground is set forth: the presentation of the antidote to the specific pride, the presentation of the specific practice of the nonabiding path, and the presentation of its result.

original: khyad par du na sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa la ni gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa'i chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par dag pa la rgyud tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan gyi ;
analyzed: khyad par du na sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa la ni gang zag la mngon par zhen pas 'phangs pa'i chos khong du chud pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / rnam par dag pa la rgyud tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bstan gyi ;
translated: In particular, on the fourth and fifth grounds, the antidote to the pride of thinking one has understood the teachings that is projected by clinging to the person and the pride of thinking one has attained the different levels of purity is taught.

original: sa 'di la ni chos la mngon par zhen pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po chos mnyam pa nyid bcu ston te /
analyzed: sa 'di la ni chos la mngon par zhen pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po chos mnyam pa nyid bcu ston te /
translated: But on this ground, the antidote to the pride of thinking that the afflictions and the purities are different, which is based on clinging to the teachings, is taught: the ten equalities of phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs @196b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs @196b pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious Ones, when the bodhisattva has completed the path on the fifth bodhisattva ground, he enters the sixth bodhisattva ground.

original: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
translated: He enters it through ten kinds of sameness of phenomena.üîΩWhat are these ten?

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pas mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pas mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the same in being signless.

original: de la skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of all phenomena in being signless is the sameness of the twelve sense sources in being devoid of an imagined nature.

original: de yang mtshan ma tha dad pa'i gnyen por rnam pa dgur dbye ste /
analyzed: de yang mtshan ma tha dad pa'i gnyen por rnam pa dgur dbye ste /
translated: This is divided into nine aspects as an antidote to the nine signs.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams kyi mtshan ma rnam pa dgu la /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams kyi mtshan ma rnam pa dgu la /
translated: The twelve sense sources have nine signs.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of intrinsic identity is that all phenomena are the same in being without intrinsic identity.

original: skad cig gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mnyam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mnyam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of arising from one instant to the next is that all phenomena are the same in not arising.

original: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig nas gcig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of arising from one birth to the next is that all phenomena are the same in not being born.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dpen par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dpen par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of defilement is that all phenomena are the same in being isolated.

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzod ma nas rnam par dag par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad gzod ma nas rnam par dag par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of purification is that all phenomena are the same in being primordially pure.

original: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad spros pa med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad spros pa med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of conventional designations is that all phenomena are the same in being free of elaborations.

original: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of birth and death is that all phenomena are the same in that they are not to be adopted or rejected.

original: gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bur mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of clinging to the individual is that all phenomena are the same in being like illusions, dreams, optical illusions, echoes, the moon in the water, reflections, and magical incarnations.

original: dar ba dang rgud pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dar ba dang rgud pa'i mtshan ma ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The sign of prosperity and decline is that all phenomena are the same in being neither things nor nonthings.

original: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rab tu rtog pa na rno zhing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pas byi dor byed /
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rab tu rtog pa na rno zhing rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pas byi dor byed /
translated: When they thoroughly understand the nature of all phenomena in that way, they polish it with sharp, suitable patience.

original: rjes su mthun par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par byed de /
translated: They make it suitable.üîΩThey do not make it unsuitable.

original: mi mthun par mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob ste /üîΩde tsam gyis mi skye ba'i chos @197a * //
analyzed: mi mthun par mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob ste / de tsam gyis mi skye ba'i chos @197a * //
translated: They attain the sixth bodhisattva stage, The Manifest.üîΩBut they have not attained the entrance to the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: la bzod pa'i sgo rjes su thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rno ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal cha phra ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: la bzod pa'i sgo rjes su thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la rno ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal cha phra ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: In this passage, ‚Äúsharp‚Äù is the antidote to subtle pride.

original: sa snga ma gnyis ni rags pa dang / 'bring gi gnyen po bzod pa chung du dang 'bring gis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: sa snga ma gnyis ni rags pa dang / 'bring gi gnyen po bzod pa chung du dang 'bring gis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The first two stages are distinguished by lesser and middling patience, which are antidotes to coarse and middling pride.

original: rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni de ma thob bo zhes bya ba'i tshig gis na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i sgo dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni de ma thob bo zhes bya ba'i tshig gis na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i sgo dang mthun pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSuitable‚Äù means that they are suitable for the entrance to the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena, as indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthey have not attained it.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yin par shes par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yin par shes par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: byi dor byed ces bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byi dor byed ces bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: To polish means to remove the stains that are its counteragents.

original: rjes su mthun par byed ces bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par byed ces bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To conform means to be devoted to sameness.

original: mi mthun par mi byed ces bya ba ni de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun par mi byed ces bya ba ni de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To not oppose means to be free from conceptualization in regard to that.

original: 'di yan chad ni re zhig nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po yongs su ston to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni re zhig nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po yongs su ston to //
translated: From here on, the text teaches the antidote to the specific pride.

original: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rtog pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rtog pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'gro ba ste /
translated: When he thus investigates the nature of all dharmas, means progressing to a higher stage.

original: 'di nas bzung nas sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'di nas bzung nas sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: From here on, he takes up the specific compassion for the past, future, and present, together with the view of all sentient beings.

original: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i phyir shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba cha phra ba'i rnam pa thams cad la so sor rtog pa'i phyir shes bya la ye shes rnam par dag pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of his regard for sentient beings and his discernment of all the aspects of the subtle dependent origination, his gnosis is pure with respect to objects of knowledge.

original: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par yongs su ston to //
translated: He demonstrates the distinctive practice of the nonabiding path because he does not abide in cyclic existence or in nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang shas cher snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bya ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang shas cher snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / snying rje chen po la dbang bya ba dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of his great compassion, which is even greater than before, and because of his mastery of great compassion and his perfection of great compassion,

original: 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'o //
translated: he observes the origination and destruction of the world.

original: de'i 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe /
translated: When he observes the origination and destruction of the world,

original: 'di snyam du sems te 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: he thinks: ‚ÄúAll the designations of the world that occur

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: It arises from the manifest clinging to a self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: If one were free from the manifest clinging to a self, it would not arise.

original: de la 'jig rten du 'dogs su 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar 'byung ba gang yin pa dag la 'jig rten zhes 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten du 'dogs su 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lngar 'byung ba gang yin pa dag la 'jig rten zhes 'dogs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the designation of the world as ‚Äúarising‚Äù refers to the designation of the five types of beings as the world.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / mtshan nyid @197b rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgo gsum nas yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / mtshan nyid @197b rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / sgo gsum nas yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o //
translated: That dependent origination should be understood in terms of its proof, its refutation, the establishment of its characteristics, the establishment of the ultimate truth, the establishment of the conventional truth, and its examination from three perspectives.

original: sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it established?

original: thog ma kho nar re zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar re zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: First, one should prove that dependent origination is devoid of a self.

original: de ni 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung la /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung la /
translated: That arises from the manifest clinging to the self of all worldly beings.

original: de dang bral nas 'byung ba med par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de dang bral nas 'byung ba med par sgrub bo //
translated: It is established that when free from that, it does not arise.

original: bdag don dam par yod du zin na ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yang don dam pa'i ye shes yin pas /
analyzed: bdag don dam par yod du zin na ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yang don dam pa'i ye shes yin pas /
translated: If the self existed ultimately, then the manifest clinging to the self would be ultimate wisdom.

original: de las 'jig rten 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las 'jig rten 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the world would not arise from that,üîΩand when free from that, it would not arise again.

original: de dang bral nas yang 'byung ba med par mi 'gyur ba zhig na bzlog pa nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: de dang bral nas yang 'byung ba med par mi 'gyur ba zhig na bzlog pa nyid du gyur te /
translated: But it is the opposite of that.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Because all the designations of the world that occur do so from the manifest clinging to the self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba na 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: When free from the manifest clinging to the self, they do not occur.

original: don 'di yongs su ston to //
analyzed: don 'di yongs su ston to //
translated: This meaning is taught.

original: brgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: brgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is the response to the objection presented?

original: bdag med du zin na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung zhes rgol bar gyur pa la lan 'debs pa ni byis pa'i blo can du gyur pas bdag tu mngon par zhen to zhes ston te /üîΩgang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag med du zin na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ji ltar 'byung zhes rgol bar gyur pa la lan 'debs pa ni byis pa'i blo can du gyur pas bdag tu mngon par zhen to zhes ston te / gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When one has understood selflessness, how can the manifest clinging to a self arise? The response to this objection is that the manifest clinging to a self arises because of the presence of a childish mind.üîΩBecause of that, one thinks, The manifest clinging to a self arises because of the presence of a childish mind.

original: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is said: The manifest clinging to a self arises because of the presence of a childish mind.

original: de'i 'og tu bdag med du zin kyang tshul gang gis na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'jig rten 'byung ba yod pa de ston to //üîΩmi shes pa'i rab rib kyis sgrib pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa can zhes bya ba de lta bu ni brgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag med du zin kyang tshul gang gis na bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'jig rten 'byung ba yod pa de ston to // mi shes pa'i rab rib kyis sgrib pa yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa can zhes bya ba de lta bu ni brgal ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: After that, it is shown by what method the world arises from the manifest clinging to a self, even though one has understood selflessness. üîΩThe statement those who are obscured by the cataract of nescience and who desire existence and nonexistence is the presentation of the response to the objection.

original: de la mi shes pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa la mngon par 'dod pa smos pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa la mngon par 'dod pa smos pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement nescience, permanence, and annihilation is made because nescience and craving are the roots of the members of existence.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba lam log par zhugs pa /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba lam log par zhugs pa /
translated: The non-virtuous karma that is the opposite of that is the karma of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten unvirtuous actions are killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.üîΩThe ten unvirtuous actions are the opposite of the ten virtues.

original: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang sogs te zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa smos pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu yongs su bstan @198a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de dag ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang sogs te zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa smos pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu yongs su bstan @198a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.

original: lam log par zhugs pa ni thar pa dang mi mthun par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam log par zhugs pa ni thar pa dang mi mthun par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.üîΩThe ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.üîΩThe ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.

original: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni bye brag ste /
translated: The ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma rtogs pa'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma rtogs pa'i don te /
translated: The ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.üîΩThe ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being without malice, and having right views.üîΩThe ten virtues are the opposite of the ten unvirtuous actions.

original: de dag ni srid pa 'dzin kyang log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni srid pa 'dzin kyang log pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin no //
translated: The ten virtues are not killing, not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, not slandering, not speaking harshly, not engaging in idle talk, being without covetousness, being

original: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid pa dang / mngon par 'grub pas 'byung bar 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyi sa bon zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid pa dang / mngon par 'grub pas 'byung bar 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The seed of the mind, which is infused by those formative forces, is accompanied by the outflows and accompanied by appropriation. It is the source of the future birth and aging and death, which is the nature of existence.

original: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i rlan dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa dang / lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba rab tu 'phel bas /
analyzed: las kyi zhing gi gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / srid pa'i rlan dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis brlan pa dang / lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba rab tu 'phel bas /
translated: The seed of the mind is the field for the karma, the darkness of ignorance, the moisture of craving, the swelling of the pride of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the spreading of the net of views.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu 'byung ste /
translated: The sprout of name-and-form arises from that.

original: byung nas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: byung nas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: Having arisen, it grows.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu rnam par 'phel nas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu rnam par 'phel nas /
translated: When the sprout of name-and-form grows,

original: dbang po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the five faculties arise.

original: dbang po lnga byung nas phan tshun 'dus pas reg par 'gyur ro //üîΩreg pa 'dus pas tshor ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga byung nas phan tshun 'dus pas reg par 'gyur ro // reg pa 'dus pas tshor ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When the five faculties arise, they come together and contact occurs.üîΩWhen there is contact, feeling arises.

original: tshor nas de'i 'og tu mngon par dga' bas sred pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor nas de'i 'og tu mngon par dga' bas sred pa 'byung ngo //
translated: After feeling, there is craving due to attraction.

original: sred pas ni len pa rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: sred pas ni len pa rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Craving causes appropriation to increase.

original: len pa rnam par 'phel bas srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa rnam par 'phel bas srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because appropriation increases, becoming occurs.

original: srid pa byung nas phung po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa byung nas phung po lnga 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When becoming occurs, the five aggregates occur.

original: phung po lnga byung nas 'gro ba lngar rim gyis dengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga byung nas 'gro ba lngar rim gyis dengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the five aggregates occur, one gradually goes to the five destinies.

original: dengs nas bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dengs nas bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone, one is separated.

original: dengs shing bral nas rims nad kyis yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dengs shing bral nas rims nad kyis yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone and been separated, one is tormented by illness.

original: rims nad kyis yongs su gdungs pa las mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur yang de dag la su yang 'byung bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: rims nad kyis yongs su gdungs pa las mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur yang de dag la su yang 'byung bar byed pa med do //
translated: From being tormented by illness, all sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and strife occur, but none of them occurs because of any agent.

original: rang bzhin dang bsal ba med par 'jig par 'gyur yang de dag la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bsal ba med par 'jig par 'gyur yang de dag la /
translated: They are destroyed without any intrinsic nature or distinction, but none of them is destroyed because of any agent.

original: 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lugs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtog go zhes bya ba de la sems kyi sa bon ni skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lugs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtog go zhes bya ba de la sems kyi sa bon ni skye ba dang rga shi'i rang bzhin yang srid
translated: The seed of mind is the cause of birth and aging and death, because it is the seed of birth and aging and death.

original: pa dang bar ma do'i srid pa 'byung bas bsdus pa la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir de la nye bar song ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dang bar ma do'i srid pa 'byung bas bsdus pa la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir de la nye bar song ba yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the intermediate existence, because it is the seed of the intermediate existence.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams ni las @198b kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams ni las @198b kyi zhing ngo //
translated: The formative forces of merit, etc., are the field of karma.

original: gong du smos pa'i mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa'o //
translated: The ignorance mentioned above is the darkness of ignorance.

original: yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa ni srid pa'i rlan to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la mngon par 'dod pa ni srid pa'i rlan to //
translated: The desire for existence and nonexistence is the moisture of existence.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i nga'o snyam du de ltar sems pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i nga'o snyam du de ltar sems pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù that occurs in this way is pride.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúWill I exist in the future?

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems pa la sogs pa ni lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam du sems pa la sogs pa ni lta bar gyur pa'i dra ba'o //
translated: The net of views is the thought that the aggregates will not arise, and so on.üîΩ

original: rang bzhin dang bsal ba med par 'jig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid dang blo sngon du gtong ba med pa'o //üîΩde lta bu ni brgal ba'i lan yin no //üîΩmtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩbrgal ba'i lan dang bcas pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par bsgrubs nas mtshan nyid gang gis gnas shing 'byung ba de rnam par 'jog ste /üîΩde 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bsal ba med par 'jig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid dang blo sngon du gtong ba med pa'o // de lta bu ni brgal ba'i lan yin no // mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na / brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la bdag med par bsgrubs nas mtshan nyid gang gis gnas shing 'byung ba de rnam par 'jog ste / de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The net of views is the thought that the self is a creator, that it is a knower, that it is permanent, that it is impermanent, that it is both permanent and impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite, that it exists, that it does not exist, that it both exists and does not exist, or that it neither exists nor does not exist.üîΩThe net of views is the thought that the self is a creator, that it is a knower, that it is permanent, that it is impermanent, that it is both permanent and impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite, that it exists, that it does not exist, that it both exists and does not exist, or that it neither exists nor does not exist.

original: bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa'o //üîΩma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa'o // ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The net of views is the thought that the self is a creator, that it is a knower, that it is permanent, that it is impermanent, that it is both permanent and impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite, that it exists, that it does not exist, that it both exists and does not exist, or that it neither exists nor does not exist.üîΩThe net of views is the thought that the self is a creator, that it is a knower, that it is permanent, that it is impermanent, that it is both permanent and impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite, that it exists, that it does not exist, that it both exists and does not exist, or that it neither exists nor does not exist.

original: 'du byed la brten pa'i sems dang po ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la brten pa'i sems dang po ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The net of views is the thought that the self is a creator, that it is a knower, that it is permanent, that it is impermanent, that it is both permanent and impermanent, that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, that it is finite, that it is infinite, that it is both finite and infinite, that it is neither finite nor infinite, that it exists, that it does not exist, that it

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The four aggregates that arise simultaneously with consciousness and are appropriated by it are called name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The development of name-and-form is the six sense bases.

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The contact of the three‚Äîsense faculty, object, and consciousness‚Äîis contaminated.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling arises simultaneously with contact.

original: tshor ba la chags pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la chags pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is attachment to feeling.

original: sred pa rnam par 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa rnam par 'phel ba ni len pa'o //
translated: The development of craving is grasping.

original: len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: The contaminated action that arises from grasping is becoming.

original: las kyi rgyu mthun pa ni skye ba ste phung po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu mthun pa ni skye ba ste phung po 'byung ba'o //
translated: The cause of action is birth, the arising of the aggregates.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: The maturation of the aggregates is aging.

original: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rgas nas phung po 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the aggregates through aging is death.

original: 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tshe myos shing chags par gyur nas sems yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: 'chi zhing 'bral ba'i tshe myos shing chags par gyur nas sems yongs su gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: At the time of death and separation, one is confused and attached, and the mind is tormented, which is sorrow.

original: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu brjod pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The words that arise from sorrow are lamentations.

original: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i nyams su bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The impairment of the five senses is suffering.

original: yid kyi lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi lta ba'i nyams su bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The impairment of the mind is sorrow.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba mang po 'byung ba ni 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: The arising of much suffering and sorrow is despair.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi ljon pa byed pa po med pa 'ba' zhig po 'di mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi ljon pa byed pa po med pa 'ba' zhig po 'di mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: Thus, this tree of suffering, which is devoid of a creator, comes into existence.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩbyed @199a * //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / byed @199a * //
translated: He thinks:üîΩThe creator is the one who acts.

original: pa po la mngon par zhen pas bya ba rnams mngon par gyur to //
analyzed: pa po la mngon par zhen pas bya ba rnams mngon par gyur to //
translated: Because of attachment to the creator, actions come into existence.

original: gong na byed pa po med pa de na don dam par bya ba yang mi dmigs so snyam mo zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: gong na byed pa po med pa de na don dam par bya ba yang mi dmigs so snyam mo zhes bya ba de la /
translated: When there is no creator above that, then ultimately action is not perceived.

original: ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs su ston to //
analyzed: ma rig pas byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs su ston to //
translated: The maturation of the action created by ignorance is the volitions, which are shown to be name-and-form.

original: de'i 'og tu de la rnam par shes pa brten pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig byung bar yongs su bstan pas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs gcig la gcig brten pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de la rnam par shes pa brten pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig byung bar yongs su bstan pas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs gcig la gcig brten pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Then, by showing that consciousness is supported by that and that name-and-form arise together with consciousness, he shows that consciousness and name-and-form support each other.

original: gang na byed pa po med pa de na don dam par bya ba yang mi dmigs so snyam mo zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag bdag nyid kyis bya ba med par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: gang na byed pa po med pa de na don dam par bya ba yang mi dmigs so snyam mo zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag bdag nyid kyis bya ba med par yongs su ston te /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúWhere there is no agent, there ultimately no action is perceived,‚Äù thus showing that these members of existence are not produced by themselves.

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag rjes su 'brel pas /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag rjes su 'brel pas /
translated: This is the connection between the members of existence.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o / // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: This should be understood as the investigation of dependent origination.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is the ultimate truth presented?

original: ji ltar de yongs su shes pas grol bar 'gyur ba de yongs su brtags pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de yongs su shes pas grol bar 'gyur ba de yongs su brtags pa ste /
translated: He investigates how one is liberated by fully understanding that.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Thus, this triple world is mind only.

original: khams gsum pa ni sems gyur pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni sems gyur pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the triple world is merely a transformation of mind.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is the conventional truth established?

original: ji ltar yongs su rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su rtogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the entrance into the ultimate truth by way of thorough understanding.

original: de yang rnam pa drug tu yongs su brtag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug tu yongs su brtag par rig par bya ste /
translated: And that is to be understood as a sixfold analysis:

original: 'dis gang kun nas nyon mongs pa shes nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa dang / rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes dmigs bsdus par yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes pa spang bar yongs su brtag pa dang /
analyzed: 'dis gang kun nas nyon mongs pa shes nas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa dang / rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes dmigs bsdus par yongs su brtag pa dang / nyes pa spang bar yongs su brtag pa dang /
translated: the analysis of the basis of affliction, the analysis of the cause, the analysis of the summary of the faults, the analysis of the abandonment of faults,

original: yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brtag pa dang / zab pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o//
analyzed: yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brtag pa dang / zab pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa'o//
translated: the analysis of the cause of the absence of regret, and the analysis of profundity.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams bdag dang bral ba'i sems tsam la brten pas sems gcig la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yongs su brtag pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams bdag dang bral ba'i sems tsam la brten pas sems gcig la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The investigation of the basis of the afflictions is that the members of existence are based on mind only, which is devoid of self, because they are based on one mind.

original: gang gi phyir srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de @199b dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de @199b dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go //
translated: Because the twelve members of existence that the TathƒÅgata has distinguished and taught are all based on one mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhi gang la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems skyes pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi gang la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems skyes pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is associated with desire is consciousness.

original: gzhi ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: gzhi ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The basis is the formative forces.

original: 'du byed la kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The confusion about the formative forces is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa de ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sems dang lhan cig skyes pa de ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The mind that is born together with ignorance is name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel ba ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The development of name-and-form is the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi cha dang mthun pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi cha dang mthun pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: The factor that is in conformity with the six sense spheres is contact.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Contact is the cause of feeling.

original: tshor ba la mi ngoms pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la mi ngoms pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the cause of craving.

original: sred pas g-yen spyo nas sdud cing yongs su mi gtong ba ni len pa'o //üîΩsrid pa'i yan lag 'di dag 'byung ba ni srid pa'o //üîΩsrid pa 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //üîΩskye ba yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: sred pas g-yen spyo nas sdud cing yongs su mi gtong ba ni len pa'o // srid pa'i yan lag 'di dag 'byung ba ni srid pa'o // srid pa 'byung ba ni skye ba'o // skye ba yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: Craving is the cause of grasping.üîΩGrasping is the cause of becoming.üîΩBecoming is the cause of birth.

original: rga ba yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'chi ba'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rga ba yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'chi ba'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Birth is the cause of old age and death.

original: 'di ni bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pas /
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pas /
translated: This is the way the twelve members of dependent origination are established in terms of the two truths.

original: sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su brtag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su brtag par rig pa'o //
translated: This is the way to understand the investigation of dependent origination in terms of a single moment of consciousness.

original: rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The investigation of causes is twofold:

original: rang gi bya ba byed pas yan lag gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyur yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba byed pas yan lag gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyur yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The investigation of the cause of another member is the investigation of the cause of the activity of another member.

original: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Ignorance is active in two ways:

original: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to be confused about their objects, and it produces the cause for the actualization of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: The formative forces are active in two ways:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: they cause the actualization of future results of evolution, and they produce the cause for the actualization of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is active in two ways:

original: srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor bar yang byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor bar yang byed pa dang / ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes the linking of one existence to another, and it produces the cause for the actualization of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Name-and-form is active in two ways:

original: phan tshun rtog par yang byed pa dang / skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rtog par yang byed pa dang / skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: and they also cause the imagination of what is unreal.

original: skye mched drug kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /üîΩrang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston pa dang / reg pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug kyang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te / rang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston pa dang / reg pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres also function in two ways:

original: reg pa @200a * //
analyzed: reg pa @200a * //
translated: they reveal the differentiation of their own objects and they also cause the origination of contact.üîΩContact

original: yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: also functions in two ways:

original: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed pa dang / tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la reg par yang byed pa dang / tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes contact with the object and it also causes the origination of feeling.

original: tshor ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Feeling also functions in two ways:

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba myong bar byed pa dang / sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba myong bar byed pa dang / sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes the experience of what is pleasant, unpleasant, and free from these two, and it also causes the origination of craving.

original: sred pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Craving also functions in two ways:

original: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la kun du chags par yang byed pa dang / len pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la kun du chags par yang byed pa dang / len pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: It causes the occurrence of attachment to things that are desirable, and it produces the cause for the establishment of grasping.

original: len pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: len pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Grasping also functions in two ways:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'brel par yang byed pa dang / srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'brel par yang byed pa dang / srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes the occurrence of the connection with affliction, and it produces the cause for the establishment of becoming.

original: srid pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Becoming also functions in two ways:

original: srid pa'i rgyu gzhan yang gnas par byed pa dang / skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu gzhan yang gnas par byed pa dang / skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes the continuation of the cause of becoming, and it produces the cause for the establishment of birth.

original: skye ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Birth also functions in two ways:

original: phung po 'byung bar yang byed pa dang / rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po 'byung bar yang byed pa dang / rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: it causes the occurrence of the aggregates, and it produces the cause for the establishment of aging.

original: rga ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rga ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Aging also functions in two ways:

original: dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed pa dang / 'chi ba dang phrad pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed pa dang / 'chi ba dang phrad pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o //
translated: It also causes the faculties to change and it produces the cause for the attainment of death.

original: 'chi ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba yang bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Death also functions in two ways:

original: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed pa dang yongs su mi shes pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed 'jig par yang byed pa dang yongs su mi shes pas rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: it causes the destruction of the formative forces and it produces the cause for the continuity of nescience.

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause for other lives.

original: yongs su mi shes pa ni 'du byed zhig nas tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa ni 'du byed zhig nas tshe rabs gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nescience is the cause for other lives after the destruction of the formative forces.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rang gi rigs rgyu'i dngos por rkyen du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir bdag rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni 'du byed rnams ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen can nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rang gi rigs rgyu'i dngos por rkyen du yongs su brtag pa'i phyir bdag rgyu nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni 'du byed rnams ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen can nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Since ignorance and so on are determined as conditions in the nature of a cause for their own species, how is it that the formative forces are conditioned by nescience?

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ston pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ston pa ste /
translated: The continuity and the teaching.

original: gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic forces,‚Äù the condition of ignorance is the uninterrupted and continuous cause of the karmic forces.

original: ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Ignorance has two aspects: the aspect of a seed and the aspect of a result.

original: de la sa bon @200b gyi gnas skabs kyis ni 'du byed rgyun mi 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de la sa bon @200b gyi gnas skabs kyis ni 'du byed rgyun mi 'chad par byed de /
translated: The aspect of a seed causes the karmic forces to be uninterrupted,

original: de ma spangs par mi spongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma spangs par mi spongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without eliminating ignorance, the karmic forces cannot be eliminated.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis ni ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis ni ston par byed de /
translated: The aspect of a result causes the teaching of the truth of suffering,

original: de skyes pas de skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di gnyis kyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skyes pas de skye ba'i phyir ro // 'di gnyis kyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: because when ignorance is born, the truth of suffering is born.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba zhes bya ba don rnam pa gnyis kyis de'i rkyen nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba zhes bya ba don rnam pa gnyis kyis de'i rkyen nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: These two aspects completely reveal the two meanings of the condition of ignorance: ‚ÄúBecause this exists, that comes to be‚Äù and ‚ÄúFrom the birth of this, that is born.‚Äù

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi rgyus don rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩyan lag snga ma med na yan lag phyi ma mi 'byung bar yongs su brtags pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag rgyur yongs su brtag ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi rgyus don rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // yan lag snga ma med na yan lag phyi ma mi 'byung bar yongs su brtags pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir bdag rgyur yongs su brtag ste /
translated: The remaining members are conditions in two ways, by the cause that is a member of its own class.üîΩThe self is imagined to be the cause because the later members do not occur if the earlier members are absent.

original: yan lag snga ma med par yan lag phyi ma mi 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma med par yan lag phyi ma mi 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The later members do not occur if the earlier members are absent.

original: ma rig pa med par 'du byed rnams rtag tu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa med par 'du byed rnams rtag tu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If ignorance were not to exist, the formative forces would not be found to exist.

original: gal te 'gyur na ni ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na ni ma rig pa 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to exist, ignorance would not be the condition of the formative forces.

original: gang dag gang med par mi 'byung ba de dag de las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gang med par mi 'byung ba de dag de las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That which does not occur if something does not exist is not different from it.üîΩFor example:

original: dper na / gang las brten te gang 'byung ba //üîΩde ni de nyid ma yin la //
analyzed: dper na / gang las brten te gang 'byung ba // de ni de nyid ma yin la //
translated: That which originates in dependence on something

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: is neither the same as nor different from it.

original: de bas chad min rtag ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas chad min rtag ma yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: rang gi rigs su 'dus pa'i rkyen du yongs su brtags pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad sngar smos pa ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / bya ba rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs su 'dus pa'i rkyen du yongs su brtags pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad sngar smos pa ma rig pa ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / bya ba rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The investigation of the conditions that are included in one‚Äôs own class is as stated previously: ‚ÄúIgnorance is the state of the seed, the state of the result, and the two kinds of activity.‚Äù

original: 'du byed la sogs pa la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the formations, etc.üîΩThe investigation of the inclusion of the three paths of suffering and the cause of suffering is as follows:

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'i lam gsum gyi nyes dmigs bsdus pas yongs su brtag pa ni /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'i lam gsum gyi nyes dmigs bsdus pas yongs su brtag pa ni /
translated: Because of the path of the afflictions, craving and grasping are the continuity of the path.üîΩBecause of the path of karma, the formations and becoming are the continuity of the path.üîΩThe rest are the continuity of the path of suffering.üîΩThe investigation of the inclusion of the three paths of the origin of suffering is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir de lam rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lam rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Because of the path of the afflictions, craving and grasping are the continuity of the path.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Because of the path of karma, the formations and becoming are the continuity of the path.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu rnam par phye ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu rnam par phye ba'o //
translated: The rest are the continuity of the path of suffering.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags na lam rgyun yang 'chad do zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags na lam rgyun yang 'chad do zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: If the prior limit and the later limit are stopped, the continuum of the path is also stopped.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags pas da ltar byung ba yang med de /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags pas da ltar byung ba yang med de /
translated: If the prior limit and the later limit are stopped, the present is also not.

original: de bas na de ma smos te /üîΩde ltar lam 'di gsum ni bdag med pa dang / @201a * //
analyzed: de bas na de ma smos te / de ltar lam 'di gsum ni bdag med pa dang / @201a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba 'byung zhing 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba 'byung zhing 'jig pa ste /
translated: Thus, these three paths are devoid of self and what belongs to a self, and they arise and perish.

original: rang bzhin gyis mdung khyim lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mdung khyim lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are like a revolving door.üîΩThe investigation of the abandonment of faults is the complete investigation of the three faults in the one who advocates dependent origination.

original: de la nyes pa yongs su spangs par brtag pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la nyes pa rnam pa gsum yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: de la nyes pa yongs su spangs par brtag pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba la nyes pa rnam pa gsum yongs su rtog ste /
translated: What are the three faults?

original: rgyu bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa dang / byed pa po med pas las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / 'bras bu ma bskyed par 'gags pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bye brag med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi lus cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa dang / byed pa po med pas las bdag gir bya ba med par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa dang / 'bras bu ma bskyed par 'gags pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of the simultaneous actualization of all bodies, because the cause is not specified; the fault of the absence of an experiencer of the result of action, because there is no agent; and the fault of the destruction of action, because it ceases without having generated a result.

original: nyes pa rnam pa de gsum yang sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pas skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa de gsum yang sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pas skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su spong ste /
translated: These three faults are completely eliminated because the experience of the result of action is distinguished as to be experienced after rebirth, etc., in dependence on the specific cause of the prior limit, etc.

original: gang gi phyir yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa'o //
translated: That which is called the formations conditioned by ignorance is the dependence on the prior limit.

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o //
translated: That which is called consciousness up to feeling is the dependence on the present.

original: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i ltos pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i ltos pa ste /
translated: That which is called craving up to becoming is the dependence on the future limit.

original: de yan chad du yang de dag rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yan chad du yang de dag rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: and they go forth from that.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba de ni ltos pa rgyun chad pa ste zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i phyir sngar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba de ni ltos pa rgyun chad pa ste zhes gsungs pa'o // de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i phyir sngar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When ignorance ceases, the formative forces cease. This is the cessation of the causal process.

original: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i sngon gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i sngon gyi mtha'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe formative forces are conditioned by ignorance‚Äù refers to the causal process in the past. The causal process in the present is referred to as the causal process in the future in relation to the future.

original: ltos pa'i don rgyu'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i don rgyu'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of causal process should be understood as the meaning of cause.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúConsciousness is conditioned by the formative forces up to the statement, ‚ÄúFeeling is conditioned by sensation‚Äù refers to the causal process in the present.

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o zhes bya ba ni don gang la tshe rabs snga ma'i las gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag 'dir 'bras bu skyes zinüîΩpas phyi ma la 'bras bur bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o zhes bya ba ni don gang la tshe rabs snga ma'i las gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag 'dir 'bras bu skyes zinüîΩpas phyi ma la 'bras bur bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of causal process should be understood as the meaning of result.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúWith ignorance as condition, the formative forces‚Äù refers to the causal process in the past. The meaning of causal process should be understood as the meaning of cause.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúConsciousness is conditioned by the formative forces up to the statement, ‚ÄúFeeling is conditioned by sensation‚Äù refers to the causal process in the present. The meaning of causal process should be understood as the meaning of result.

original: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i ltos pa ste zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par gcig tu nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i ltos pa ste zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par gcig tu nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From craving up to becoming is the dependence of the future, because it is certain that there will be a single rebirth.

original: de phan chad du yang de dag rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ltos pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
