analyzed: de phan chad du yang de dag rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni ltos pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, they occur again, because there is a dependence on the production of another rebirth.

original: 'di ci zhig yongs su ston zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig yongs su ston zhe na /
translated: What is this teaching?

original: byas par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu bskyed zin pa dang / gnyen po rnyed pas spangs zin pa dang / @201b rgyu gsum gyis yang srid pa'i las rnam par smin pa mi skyed par ston te /
analyzed: byas par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu bskyed zin pa dang / gnyen po rnyed pas spangs zin pa dang / @201b rgyu gsum gyis yang srid pa'i las rnam par smin pa mi skyed par ston te /
translated: It teaches that the action of rebirth does not produce its results because of three causes: it has been done, it has produced its result, and it has been abandoned through the acquisition of its antidote.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya bas ni byas pa nyid dang 'bras bu ma rnyed pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya bas ni byas pa nyid dang 'bras bu ma rnyed pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions‚Äù teaches that it has been done and that its result has not been obtained.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas ni byas pa nyid dang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas ni byas pa nyid dang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa nyid ston to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by consciousness, there is name and form‚Äù teaches that it has been done and that its result has been obtained.

original: srid pa la sogs pas ma spangs par ston to //
analyzed: srid pa la sogs pas ma spangs par ston to //
translated: It shows that they are not abandoned by the realms and so on.

original: sred pa dang len pa zad na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed byas kyang srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa zad na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed byas kyang srid pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If craving and grasping are exhausted, then even though formations are conditioned by ignorance, existence will not occur.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir la la ni byas pa la ni ma byas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir la la ni byas pa la ni ma byas /
translated: Because some are not done, some are done,

original: la la ni 'bras bu bskyed zin /
analyzed: la la ni 'bras bu bskyed zin /
translated: some have already produced results,

original: la la ni ma bskyed /
analyzed: la la ni ma bskyed /
translated: some have not produced results,

original: la la ni spangs /
analyzed: la la ni spangs /
translated: some are abandoned,

original: la la ni ma spangs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: la la ni ma spangs pa de'i phyir /
translated: and some are not abandoned.

original: lus thams cad cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus thams cad cig car mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the error of all bodies being simultaneously actualized does not occur.

original: las thams cad skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: las thams cad skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: All karma is not experienced as soon as it arises,

original: myong bar mi 'gyur bar cig car du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong bar mi 'gyur bar cig car du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor is it not experienced.

original: gang gi phyir ma byas pa rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma byas pa rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is not done does not ripen,

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la las de'i rnam par smin pa med pas las bdag gir bya ba med pa'i nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la las de'i rnam par smin pa med pas las bdag gir bya ba med pa'i nyes pa med de /
translated: the error of karma not belonging to a self does not occur, because the ripening of that karma does not exist in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not done in another‚Äôs mental continuum.

original: rgyu gsum po med na gdon mi za bar 'bras bu bskyed pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa yang med de /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po med na gdon mi za bar 'bras bu bskyed pas las rnams chud za ba'i nyes pa yang med de /
translated: If the three causes do not exist, then there is no fault of the destruction of karma, since karma would not generate an effect.

original: de ltar nyes pa rnam pa gsum po yongs su spangs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa rnam pa gsum po yongs su spangs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the three faults are completely avoided.üîΩThe aspects of subtle and gross suffering

original: de la yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa la /
analyzed: de la yid mi 'byung ba dang / yid 'byung ba'i rgyur yongs su brtag pa la /
translated: are respectively the causes of non-discernment and discernment.

original: sdug bsngal cha phra ba nyid kyi rnam pa ni yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal cha phra ba nyid kyi rnam pa ni yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The aspect of subtle suffering is the cause of non-discernment.

original: tshor ba gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung /
translated: Any feeling whatsoever

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is suffering here.

original: sdug bsngal nyid rags pa'i rnam pa ni yid las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid rags pa'i rnam pa ni yid las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The aspect of gross suffering is the cause of discernment.

original: gang gi phyir yang srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi rgyus sdug bsngal nyid gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi rgyus sdug bsngal nyid gsum 'byung ste /
translated: Because the three kinds of suffering arise from the cause of the twelve members of existence.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations,‚Äù up to ‚ÄúConditioned by the six sense spheres, there is contact,‚Äù is the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúContact and feeling‚Äù is the suffering of suffering.

original: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma de dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma de dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: The remaining limbs of existence are the suffering of change.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni sdug bsngal ba gsum gyi rgyun 'chad pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la zab pa nyid yongs su @202a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni sdug bsngal ba gsum gyi rgyun 'chad pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o // de la zab pa nyid yongs su @202a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease‚Äù is the cessation of the continuum of the three sufferings.

original: brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four types of profundity are as follows.

original: rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i srid pa'i yan lag rnams gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The limbs of existence that arise from one‚Äôs own continuum are not created by another and are not created by oneself because they arise from conditions.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes‚Äù means that karmic processes arise from causes and conditions.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the rest.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba ni 'du byed rnams med pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba ni 'du byed rnams med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen ignorance ceases, karmic processes cease‚Äù means that karmic processes do not exist.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The same is true of the rest.

original: bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it does not endure at the time of action, it is not a creator.

original: skye ba tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir gnyi gas ma byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: skye ba tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir gnyi gas ma byas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Since it is related to mere arising, it is not created by both.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes‚Äù is related to arising.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the rest.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni 'jig rten dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni 'jig rten dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen ignorance ceases, karmic processes cease‚Äù is related to the world.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The same is true of the rest.

original: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it accords with the way of existence,

original: rgyu med pa las 'byung ba'ang ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las 'byung ba'ang ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It does not arise without a cause.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations,‚Äù is a hypothetical construction that describes the way things occur in the world.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the remaining links.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni zad pa'i rjes su mthun par yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba de ni zad pa'i rjes su mthun par yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúWhen ignorance ceases, karmic formations cease,‚Äù is a hypothetical construction that describes the way things cease.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The same is true of the remaining links.

original: rgyu med pa yin du zin na ni 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba gnyi ga rgyu med pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin du zin na ni 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba gnyi ga rgyu med pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: If they were without a cause, both the occurrence and non-occurrence of the links would arise without a cause.

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pas 'byung bar 'gyur gyi mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de dag la yod de de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pas 'byung bar 'gyur gyi mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de dag la yod de de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Since there would be no cause for certainty, it would follow that they would occur and not occur. But this is unacceptable.

original: de bas na rgyu yod pa las srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu yod pa las srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the occurrence of the links of existence is due to a cause.

original: gzhan du na srid pa'i rjes su mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na srid pa'i rjes su mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be consistent with existence.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog pa 'di ni mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pas bstan te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog pa 'di ni mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pas bstan te /
translated: This discernment of dependent origination in ten aspects is taught by way of the thorough investigation of the principles of the truths.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par so sor rtog ste /üîΩ'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba dang / rang gi @202b las ma 'dres pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / lam gsum gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par so sor rtog ste / 'di ltar srid pa'i yan lag rjes su 'brel pa dang / sems gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba dang / rang gi @202b las ma 'dres pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / lam gsum gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang /
translated: Because one discerns dependent origination in forward and reverse orders,

original: da ltar byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' ba'i ltos pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' ba'i ltos pa dang / sdug bsngal gsum kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: one discerns the connection of the members of cyclic existence, the perfect inclusion of a single mind, the non-mixture of one‚Äôs own karma, the non-difference of the three times, the continuity of the three paths, the dependence of the past, present, and future, the origin of the three kinds of suffering, and the arising from causes and conditions.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa dang med pas zad par so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa dang med pas zad par so sor rtog pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One discerns the connection of arising and disintegration, and the exhaustion of non-existence.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan gnyis kyis te /
translated: Moreover, this discernment should be understood as twofold:

original: snying rje dang mthun par yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rtog pas 'di so sor rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang mthun par yongs su rtog pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rtog pas 'di so sor rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: discernment in accordance with compassion and discernment of all aspects.

original: de la snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Discernment in accordance with compassion is fourfold:

original: kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log pa dang / gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba dang / rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba dang / thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log pa dang / gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba dang / rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba dang / thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: discernment of the search for liberation in another, discernment of the search for liberation in another mode, discernment of the search for liberation in another place, and discernment of the search for liberation in another time.

original: kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is discernment of the search for liberation in another?üîΩIt is discernment of the search for liberation in another person.

original: ji ltar gang la kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log de la so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gang la kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log de la so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: What is discernment of the search for liberation in another mode?

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la srid pa thams cad 'byung gi / de dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la srid pa thams cad 'byung gi / de dang bral na 'byung ba yang med par mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: It is discernment of the search for liberation in another mode, i.e. in the mode of the absence of self.

original: kun du rmongs pa dang gang gi phyir /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa dang gang gi phyir /
translated: What is discernment of the search for liberation in another place?üîΩIt is discernment of the search for liberation in another place, i.e. in the realm of the Dharma.üîΩWhat is discernment of the search for liberation in another time?üîΩIt is discernment of the search for liberation in another time, i.e. in the future.

original: de 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When he observes the origination and destruction of the world, he thinks as follows:

original: 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll the designations of the world that occur do so from the manifest clinging to a self.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang bral na /
translated: If one were free from the manifest clinging to a self,

original: 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: there would be no origination.‚Äù

original: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ni phyin ci log go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe foolish are attached to a self‚Äù is a perversion.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log ni gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la kun du rmongs pa dang / phyin ci log ni gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdelusion regarding the characteristics of the members of existence‚Äù is a perversion.

original: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe foolish are attached to a self‚Äù is a perversion.

original: gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does one seek liberation from another?

original: kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las thar pa yongs su btsal bar bya ba'i rig pa las /
analyzed: kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams las thar pa yongs su btsal bar bya ba'i rig pa las /
translated: The knowledge that liberation is to be sought in the store-consciousness and the actual consciousnesses.

original: de ltar kun du rmongs shing phyin ci log tu gyur pa de dag gzhan du bdag las yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: de ltar kun du rmongs shing phyin ci log tu gyur pa de dag gzhan du bdag las yongs su tshol te /
translated: Thus, those who are confused and mistaken seek the self elsewhere.

original: de'i gnyen por 'di ltar khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam pa ste /üîΩ@203a * // srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'di ltar khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam pa ste / @203a * // srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: The antidote to that is the statement: ‚ÄúThis threefold world is mind only.‚Äù

original: sems gcig la gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems gcig la gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The twelve members of existence that the Tathagata has distinguished and taught are all based on a single mind.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is there a search by another method?

original: mi 'dra ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of non-corresponding causes:

original: rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug dang / brtul zhugs drag po'i rgyud dang rgyu med pas tshol ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / dbang phyug dang / brtul zhugs drag po'i rgyud dang rgyu med pas tshol ba ste /
translated: causes of nature, causes of power, and causes of intense austerity, and causelessness.

original: de ltar yongs su btsal bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su btsal bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not search in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: srid pa'i yan lag rnams ni las rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir te gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag rnams ni las rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir te gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis su nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because ignorance is subsumed in two actions:

original: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to be confused about their objects and it produces the cause of the formation of karma.üîΩArisen from the cause of its own type means that because of ignorance, formations exist.

original: rang gi rigs kyi rgyu las byung ba ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi rgyu las byung ba ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because of the condition of ignorance, formations are uninterrupted and supported.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they arise from the cause of affliction and karma.

original: bde ba'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa dang ; sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa dang ; sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It does not arise from a cause of happiness, because there is no interruption of the path of the afflictions, since there is ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: There is no interruption of the path of karma, since there is volitional action and becoming.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad ces gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad ces gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is no interruption of the path of suffering, since there are the remaining members.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i bar dang / phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bar gyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i bar dang / phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bar gyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: The two, the prior limit and the subsequent limit, are the middle that arises from a cause, since it is said:

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i ltos pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthe condition of ignorance is volitional action‚Äù is the prior limit.

original: gzhan du ni sems can sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni sems can sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would not be the variety of sentient beings.

original: thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is there the search for another liberation?

original: thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'brel pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las @203b rab tu skye ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'brel pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las @203b rab tu skye ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang /
translated: If they were to arise from causes and conditions related to the suffering of formations, they would be related to the arising of afflictions,

original: 'brel pa srid pa'i rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: 'brel pa srid pa'i rjes su mthun pa /
translated: and they would be compatible with existence.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa las thar pa yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa las thar pa yongs su tshol te /
translated: They would seek liberation from formless existence.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'brel pa'i gzugs med pa'i srid pa las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'brel pa'i gzugs med pa'i srid pa las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Because they would seek liberation from formless existence related to the suffering of formations,

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it would say, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are formations,‚Äù and so on.

original: skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the six sense bases is the suffering of conditioned states.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las rab tu skye ba de yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las rab tu skye ba de yang de bzhin te /
translated: And the arising of that which is fully generated from causes and conditions is also like that.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are volitions‚Äù means that volitions arise from causes and conditions.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The same is true of the remaining links.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang 'brel pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang 'brel pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: And the connection with the arising of the afflictions is also like that.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are volitions‚Äù means that they are connected with birth.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The same is true of the remaining links.

original: srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i thar pa yongs su tshol ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i thar pa yongs su tshol ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: And the arising of existence in the forward order is also like that.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù is the hypothetical origination of cyclic existence.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest are also like that.

original: de ltar na snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtags pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtog pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtags pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so sor rtog pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the discernment of dependent origination through the hypothesis of compassion,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ston to //
translated: he teaches the hypothesis of all aspects.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Therein, the hypothesis of all aspects is ninefold:üîΩthe hypothesis of the differentiation of defilement and purification, because of the defilement and purification of both those who have the conceit of self and those who do not;

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang mngon par ma zhen pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rab tu dbye bar yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang mngon par ma zhen pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rab tu dbye bar yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the hypothesis of the differentiation of defilement and purification, because of the defilement and purification of both those who have the conceit of self and those who do not;üîΩthe hypothesis of the differentiation of defilement and purification, because of the defilement and purification of both those who have the conceit of self and those who do not;

original: 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa la rnam par lta ba'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When he observes the origination and destruction of the world, he thinks as follows:

original: 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'dogs pa 'byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll the designations of the world that occur do so from the manifest clinging to a self.

original: mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med do zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang bral na 'byung ba yang med do zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one is free from manifest clinging, there is no origination.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ci la brten te 'byung zhes rten yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ci la brten te 'byung zhes rten yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the basis of dependent origination?‚Äù He investigates the basis. He thinks as follows:

original: khams gsum pa 'di @204a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di @204a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThis triple world

original: ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: ni sems tsam ste /
translated: is mind only.

original: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go snyam mo zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phye ste bka' stsal pa de dag thams cad kyang sems gcig la gnas pa dag go snyam mo zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the twelve members of existence that the Tathagata has distinguished and taught are based on a single mind.‚Äù

original: srid pa'i yan lag rnams las rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir thabs yongs su brtag pa ni de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag rnams las rnam pa gnyis su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir thabs yongs su brtag pa ni de la ma rig pa ni bya ba gnyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: Ignorance is situated in two actions:

original: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang dmigs pa la rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it causes beings to be confused about their objects and it produces the formative forces.

original: srid pa'i yan lag rnams g-yo ba med pa'i phyir /üîΩrkyen gyi mtshan nyid yongs su brtag pa ni de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag rnams g-yo ba med pa'i phyir / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yongs su brtag pa ni de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thorough investigation of the characteristics of conditions is because the members of existence are devoid of movement.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, the formative forces,‚ÄùüîΩmeans that the formative forces are produced by the condition of ignorance, that they are not produced without ignorance, and that ignorance is the cause of the formative forces.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / rton pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, the formative forces,‚Äù means that the formative forces are produced by the condition of ignorance, that they are not produced without ignorance, and that ignorance is the cause of the formative forces.

original: lam gsum gyi sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden par 'gyur ba'i phyir bden pa la 'jug pa yongs su rtog pa ni de la ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: lam gsum gyi sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden par 'gyur ba'i phyir bden pa la 'jug pa yongs su rtog pa ni de la ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Since the three paths are the truth of suffering and the truth of origination, the investigation of the engagement with the truths is as follows: Ignorance, craving, and grasping are the uninterrupted path of the afflictions.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Formation and becoming are the uninterrupted path of karma.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad ces gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad ces gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rest are the uninterrupted path of suffering.

original: sngon dang mtha'i bar dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su smin par bya ba'i khyad par gyi phyir nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i gnas la 'jug par yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sngon dang mtha'i bar dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su smin par bya ba'i khyad par gyi phyir nus pa dang / mi nus pa'i gnas la 'jug par yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The investigation of engagement with the possible and the impossible is in order to ripen those who are not ripened and to distinguish those who are ripened.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni sngon gyi mtha'i ltos pa'o //
translated: The condition of ignorance giving rise to formation is the dependence on the prior limit.

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni de ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni de ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o //
translated: From consciousness up to feeling is the dependence on the present.

original: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa ste zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha'i ltos pa ste zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From craving up to becoming is the dependence of the future.

original: sdug bsngal nyid cha phra ba yongs su mi shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la 'jug pa yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid cha phra ba yongs su mi shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la 'jug pa yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The investigation of the conceited and the un-conceited entering into the subtle aspect of the truth of suffering, which is not fully understood, and the pride of claiming to fully understand it, is as follows: Because of ignorance as condition, there are karmic processes, and so on up to:

original: skye mched drug gi bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gsungs pa @204b la sogs pa'o //üîΩmtha'i bar yang rgyu rkyen las byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gsungs pa @204b la sogs pa'o // mtha'i bar yang rgyu rkyen las byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: The six sense spheres are the suffering of the karmic process.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang skye ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang skye ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The investigation of the beginninglessness of the world, because the world arises from causes and conditions, and because the future world is connected with birth, is as follows:üîΩBecause of ignorance as condition, there are karmic processes, and so on up to:üîΩThe six sense spheres are the suffering of the karmic process.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù means that karmic formations arise from causes and conditions.üîΩThe same is true of the remaining members.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù means that they are related to birth.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The same is true of the remaining members.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa rnams kyis srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa rnams kyis srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yongs su brtag pa ni /
translated: The diversity of the members should be understood in terms of the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù means that they are related to the process of becoming.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The same is true of the remaining members.

original: de ltar mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the distinctive practice of the non-abiding path,

original: gnyen po'i khyad par thob pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa dang gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / nus pa'i khyad par thob pa dang /üîΩrnam pa lngas de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i khyad par thob pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par dang / sgrub pa dang gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / nus pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / rnam pa lngas de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par yongs su ston te /
translated: distinctive attainment of the antidote, distinctive weakening of counteragents, distinctive attainment of practice and stability, distinctive attainment of concentration, distinctive attainment of intention, distinctive attainment of power and distinctive attainment of the result.

original: de la gnyen po'i khyad par ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: de la gnyen po'i khyad par ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
translated: The distinctive attainment of the antidote is the three doors of perfect liberation.

original: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba dang / chos la bdag med par mthong ba dang / de gnyi ga'i bya ba med pas byed pa po med par mthong ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba dang / chos la bdag med par mthong ba dang / de gnyi ga'i bya ba med pas byed pa po med par mthong ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su ston te /
translated: The door of liberation of emptiness is shown by three aspects: seeing the selflessness of the person, seeing the selflessness of phenomena and seeing the absence of an agent because neither of those two has action.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog cing bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / byed pa po dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog cing bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / byed pa po dang /
translated: Because one thus discerns dependent origination in ten aspects, and discerns it as selfless, lifeless, without personality, empty of intrinsic nature, without agent,

original: tshor ba po med par so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshor ba po med par so sor rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: and without feeler,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: then the door of liberation called emptiness arises.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang gang zag med pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang gang zag med pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, seeing the selflessness of the person is called ‚Äúselfless, lifeless, and without personality.‚Äù

original: chos la bdag med par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Seeing the selflessness of phenomena is called ‚Äúempty of intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: gang zag dang chos de gnyis ka yang g-yo ba med de /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos de gnyis ka yang g-yo ba med de /
translated: Neither the person nor phenomena move.

original: @205a * // bya ba med pas byed pa po med par mthong ba ni byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @205a * // bya ba med pas byed pa po med par mthong ba ni byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no activity, one sees that there is no agent, because it is said that there is no agent and no experiencer.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa dang / gnyen po rnyed pa dang / mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su ston te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa dang / gnyen po rnyed pa dang / mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su ston te /
translated: The signless is taught by three aspects: the mere decrease of the counteragent, the attainment of the antidote, and the non-occurrence of signs.

original: gang gi phyir de srid pa'i yan lag de dag gi rang bzhin 'gags shing rnam par thar pa las shin tu nye bar gnas pas chos kyi mtshan ma gang yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de srid pa'i yan lag de dag gi rang bzhin 'gags shing rnam par thar pa las shin tu nye bar gnas pas chos kyi mtshan ma gang yang mi skye ste /
translated: Because of that, any sign of phenomena does not arise, since the nature of those limbs of existence is ceased and one is well-established in liberation.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the door of liberation of the signless arises.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin 'gag ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin 'gag ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the mere decrease of the counteragent is taught by ‚Äúthe nature of the limbs of existence is ceased.‚Äù

original: gnyen po rnyed pa ni rnam par thar pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po rnyed pa ni rnam par thar pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attainment of the antidote is stated in the line, ‚Äúthe liberation is very near at hand.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba ni chos kyi mtshan ma gang yang mi skye zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba ni chos kyi mtshan ma gang yang mi skye zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-occurrence of signs is stated in the line, ‚Äúno sign of any dharma arises.‚Äù

original: smon pa med pa ni gnas dang / rang bzhin dang / khyad par dang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni gnas dang / rang bzhin dang / khyad par dang rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The wishless is to be understood in terms of three things: its basis, its nature, and its distinction.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la zhugs pas snying rje chen po sngon du gtong zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ma gtogs par 'dod pa gang yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la zhugs pas snying rje chen po sngon du gtong zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ma gtogs par 'dod pa gang yang mi skye ste /
translated: Because he has thus entered emptiness and signlessness, he does not give rise to any wishes except for great compassion and the maturation of sentient beings.

original: de ltar de'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the gateway to the wishless liberation is born in him.‚Äù

original: de la stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa'i gnas kyi smon pa med pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa'i gnas kyi smon pa med pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The basis of the wishless is the emptiness and signlessness of the three aspects of the object, the three aspects of the subject, and the three aspects of the result.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la 'jug pa ni gnas so //
translated: The entry into emptiness and signlessness is the station.

original: mngon par 'dod pa mi skye ba ni rang bzhin te smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon par 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa mi skye ba ni rang bzhin te smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon par 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-arising of desire is the nature, since the nature of wishlessness is the absence of desire.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du gtong zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa khyad par can te nyan thos kyi smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang mngon par 'dod pa med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du gtong zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa khyad par can te nyan thos kyi smon pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang mngon par 'dod pa med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The special desire is the maturation of beings through the preeminence of great compassion, for although the nature of the Sravakas wishlessness is also the absence of desire,

original: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mngon par 'dod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mngon par 'dod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: it is devoid of the desire for the maturation of beings.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'i khyad par ni 'du shes rnam pa gsum dang bral ba ste /
translated: The special degeneration of the resistances is freedom from the three kinds of discriminations.

original: gang gi phyir de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag bsgoms pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / byed pa po dang tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang bral ba @205b dang ; yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral bas zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag bsgoms pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / byed pa po dang tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang bral ba @205b dang ; yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral bas zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because he cultivates these three doors of liberation, he is free from the discriminations of self and other, free from the discriminations of an agent and a feeler, and free from the discriminations of existence and nonexistence.

original: de yang sa lnga pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams dang / sa bzhi pa las lhag par g-yo ba la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / sa drug pa 'di la chos mnyam pa nyid rnams dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sa lnga pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnams dang / sa bzhi pa las lhag par g-yo ba la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / sa drug pa 'di la chos mnyam pa nyid rnams dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be understood as the equality of mental attitudes on the fifth stage, freedom from the movement of pride, etc. on the fourth stage, and the equality of dharmas on this sixth stage.

original: de la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The distinctive attainment is twofold:

original: go cha'i sgrub pa dang skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa dang skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: the attainment of armor and the attainment of activity.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa 'dus byas la nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par yongs su shes pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / skye ba'i tshogs pa spong ba sems can gyi don byed pa khyad par can te /üîΩgang gi phyir de byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma grub pa rnams yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa 'dus byas la nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par yongs su shes pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / skye ba'i tshogs pa spong ba sems can gyi don byed pa khyad par can te / gang gi phyir de byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma grub pa rnams yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po sngon du btang ste /
translated: The armor practice is the special benefit for sentient beings, because it is the abandonment of the fetters of karma and afflictions and the collection of births, through the complete understanding that conditioned things are flawed by many faults.

original: de bas kyang shas cher shin tu brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher shin tu brtson par byed do //
translated: For that reason, he exerts himself even more, in order to perfect the factors of enlightenment that are not yet perfected, and he is motivated by great compassion.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: kun du sbyor ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
translated: Conditioned things arise from the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: bral ba las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bral ba las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Conditioned things do not arise from a separation of causes and conditions.

original: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
translated: Conditioned things arise from a collection of causes and conditions.

original: ma tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Conditioned things do not arise from a non-collection of causes and conditions.

original: de ltas bdag gis 'dus byas pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa de lta bu 'di shes par byas la kun du sbyor ba 'di dang tshogs pa 'di'i rgyun gcad par yang mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltas bdag gis 'dus byas pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa de lta bu 'di shes par byas la kun du sbyor ba 'di dang tshogs pa 'di'i rgyun gcad par yang mi bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, having understood that conditioned things are flawed with many faults, I will not cut off the continuum of this attachment and this collection.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba thob par yang mi bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi ba thob par yang mi bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: But in order to ripen sentient beings, I will not attain the pacification of conditioned things.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen pos nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par so sor rtog pa dang / spong ba'i gnyen pos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis med pa so sor rtog par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa'i sgrub pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen pos nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags par so sor rtog pa dang / spong ba'i gnyen pos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis med pa so sor rtog par rig par bya ste /
translated: The accomplishment of the person‚Äôs activity should be understood as the discernment of the faults of many faults through the antidote of complete rejection and the discernment of the intrinsic unreality of general and specific characteristics through the antidote of abandonment.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags shing rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes ma 'gags par so sor rtog pa na zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags shing rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes ma 'gags par so sor rtog pa na zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O sons of the victors, when they thus discern conditioned states to be flawed by many faults, to be devoid of any intrinsically real essence, and to be unborn and unceasing, then they are said to be ‚Äúabiding in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la gnas pa'i khyad par ni ye shes dang / snying rje'i khyad par dang ldan pas mi gnas pa'i lam la brten nas chags pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur ba yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i khyad par ni ye shes dang / snying rje'i khyad par dang ldan pas mi gnas pa'i lam la brten nas chags pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur ba yin pa dang /
translated: The distinctive feature of their abiding is that, by possessing the distinctive features of gnosis and compassion, they are abiding in the perfection of wisdom, which is the actualization of non-abiding gnosis based on the path of non-abiding.

original: 'dus byas dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin par rig @206a * //üîΩpar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin par rig @206a * // par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that they have realized the sameness of conditioned states and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de dang mi 'grogs shing mi gnas te /
analyzed: de dang mi 'grogs shing mi gnas te /
translated: They do not associate with or abide in conditioned states.

original: de'i tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because their accumulations are not yet complete.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs yongs su mi gtong bas chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs yongs su mi gtong bas chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of accomplishing great compassion and not abandoning the mass of sentient beings, the bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom that is not attached is called ‚Äúfacing the wisdom of non-attachment.‚Äù It is the stage of the perfection of wisdom that is actualized by the method of illumination.

original: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang bar gyur nas byang chub kyi yan lag sdud pa'i rkyen rnams kyang nye bar bsgrubs la 'dus byas dang 'grogs par yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang bar gyur nas byang chub kyi yan lag sdud pa'i rkyen rnams kyang nye bar bsgrubs la 'dus byas dang 'grogs par yang mi gnas so //
translated: Having attained that kind of wisdom and the stage of the perfection of wisdom, having become illuminated, the bodhisattva also accomplishes the conditions that gather the factors of enlightenment, but does not remain in association with conditioned things.

original: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang so sor rtog la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang so sor rtog la /
translated: He also individually discerns that conditioned things are naturally peaceful.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: But because the factors of enlightenment are not complete,

original: de la yang mi gnas te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he does not remain there.

original: de la chags pa med pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is not attached to that is to be known as the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir snang ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir snang ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not fully accomplished, it is said to be in the manner of appearance.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The distinctive meditative absorption is the meditative absorption of emptiness, together with its retinue, in ten aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di la 'jug pa stong pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di la 'jug pa stong pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bhumi called The Manifest, for him the meditative absorption called the entrance into emptiness arises.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa stong pa nyid dang / mngon par sgrub pa stong pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa stong pa nyid dang / mngon par sgrub pa stong pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the meditative absorption of the emptiness of essence, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the great, the emptiness of the endowed, the emptiness of accomplishment, the emptiness of non-discrimination just as it is,

original: lta ba dang bcas pa stong pa nyid dang / bral ba dang ma bral ba stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta ba dang bcas pa stong pa nyid dang / bral ba dang ma bral ba stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The concentrations called ‚Äúemptiness with observation‚Äù and ‚Äúemptiness without observation‚Äù arise.

original: de dag la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag de la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag de la mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: One hundred thousand concentrations of the door of emptiness manifest to him.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag mngon du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sa ya dag mngon du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, one hundred thousand concentrations of the door of signlessness and one hundred thousand concentrations of the door of wishlessness manifest.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de yang rgyu bzhis rnam lar gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin de yang rgyu bzhis rnam lar gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: That concentration of emptiness should be known as being established by four causes.

original: dmigs pas ni bzhi pa ma gtogs pa lnga po dag ste /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pas 'jug pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pas ni bzhi pa ma gtogs pa lnga po dag ste / gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pas 'jug pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: By object, it is the five, excluding the fourth.üîΩThe concentration of emptiness is engaged by the object of the selflessness of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The concentration of the emptiness of nature is engaged by the object of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la 'dzin pa stong pa nyid la @206b dmigs pas don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa stong pa nyid la @206b dmigs pas don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the objective support of the emptiness of the apprehending subject, it is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pas chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pas chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the objective support of the store-consciousness which is the basis of that, it is the emptiness of the great.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pas mtshungs par ldan pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pas mtshungs par ldan pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the objective support of the actual consciousnesses, it is the emptiness of the associated.

original: bag yod pa yongs su 'dzin pas bzhi pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa yongs su 'dzin pas bzhi pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The fourth is determined by the possession of heedfulness.

original: shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir bsgoms pas chog mi shes pas dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir bsgoms pas chog mi shes pas dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the extreme cultivation of that, it is the emptiness of the supreme, because of the dissatisfaction with the cultivation of the emptiness of the apprehended object.

original: khyad par zhugs pa thob pas ni bdun pa ste /üîΩyon tan khyad par zhugs pas thob par byed pas mngon par sgrub pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: khyad par zhugs pa thob pas ni bdun pa ste / yon tan khyad par zhugs pas thob par byed pas mngon par sgrub pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The seventh is by the attainment of the entry into the special.üîΩSince it is the attainment of the special qualities, it is the emptiness of accomplishment, i.e. the meditative concentration of the non-discrimination of the pure.üîΩThe remaining ones are by the cause, i.e. the meditative concentration of the emptiness of the pure non-discrimination, since it is the cause of the purification of the obscuration of the knowable.

original: rgyu nyid kyis ni lhag ma rnams te shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis ni lhag ma rnams te shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the objective support of the emptiness of the apprehending subject.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pas lta ba dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pas lta ba dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of emptiness with appearance is the cause for the maturation of sentient beings.üîΩThe concentration of emptiness of separation and non-separation is the cause for the voluntary appropriation of existence.

original: bsams bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pas bral ba dang / ma bral ba stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa de lta bu de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pas bral ba dang / ma bral ba stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa de lta bu de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: That appropriation of existence is not associated with defilement,

original: srid pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: srid pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: and it is not devoid of the characteristics of existence.

original: de'i phyir bral ba dang ma bral bas rab tu phye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bral ba dang ma bral bas rab tu phye'o //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished by separation and non-separation.

original: de la bsam pa'i khyad par ni brtan pa'i phyir mi phyed pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i khyad par ni brtan pa'i phyir mi phyed pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: Among them, the distinction of intention is the unshakable intention, because it is firm.üîΩBecause of that, the bodhisattva on this Manifest bodhisattva stage has an intention that is even more unshakable.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bas kyang shes cher mi phyed pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bas kyang shes cher mi phyed pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The distinction of complete purity is the complete purity of the objective support.

original: mi phyed pa'i bsam pa nyid de yang don rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i bsam pa nyid de yang don rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste ;
translated: This undivided intention itself should be known as having nine topics.

original: dmigs pa la mos pa nges pa ni gang gi phyir nges pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mos pa nges pa ni gang gi phyir nges pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The certainty of conviction in the object is what is called the definite intention.

original: 'khrug pa la mi brjed pa ni gang gi phyir dge ba'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa la mi brjed pa ni gang gi phyir dge ba'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The non-forgetfulness of agitation is what is called the virtuous intention.

original: gsang ba'i gnas la mi skrag pa ni gang gi phyir zab pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas la mi skrag pa ni gang gi phyir zab pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The non-fear of the secret place is what is called the profound intention.

original: theg pa las mi g-yo ba ni gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa las mi g-yo ba ni gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The non-wavering from the vehicle is what is called the irreversible intention.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni gang gi phyir rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni gang gi phyir rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The undertaking of effort is what is called the uninterrupted intention.

original: ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims gyi dri ma dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir dri ma med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces @207a * //
analyzed: ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims gyi dri ma dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir dri ma med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces @207a * //
translated: The freedom from the stains of stinginess and immorality is what is called the stainless intention.

original: gsungs pa'o // sems can gyi don byed pa ni gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // sems can gyi don byed pa ni gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is the intention of infinite aspiration, because of which it is said.

original: rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes la mngon par dad pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes la mngon par dad pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The desire for the highest liberation is the intention of faith in intuition, because of which it is said.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The application to the evolutionary development of beings is the intention endowed with means and insight, because of which it is said.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub la shin tu song ba yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas ring du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub la shin tu song ba yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas ring du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the bodhisattvas‚Äô intentions, which are well advanced toward the enlightenment of the transcendent lords.

original: de la nus pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste nus pa rnam pa dgu la phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yinüîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nus pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste nus pa rnam pa dgu la phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The special ability is to be known as ninefold: The ability to defeat opponents is as follows: ‚ÄúHe is energetic because he is irreversible by any opponent.‚Äù

original: the tshom gcod pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes kyi sa la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes kyi sa la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ability to cut off doubts is as follows: ‚ÄúHe is engaged in the stage of direct intuition.‚Äù

original: theg pa las mi g-yo ba'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams las log pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa las mi g-yo ba'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams las log pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ability not to waver from the vehicle is as follows: ‚ÄúHe is turned away from the stages of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha.‚Äù

original: gsang ba'i gnas la mos pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon du phyogs par gcig tu nges pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas la mos pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon du phyogs par gcig tu nges pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ability to believe in the secret abode is as follows: ‚ÄúHe is definitely intent on the intuition of Buddhahood.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi 'dor ba'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir bdud dang nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyen po brtan pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'dor ba'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir bdud dang nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o // nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyen po brtan pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of not losing is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause he is not carried away by any of the demons and afflictions that arise.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la shin tu gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la shin tu gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In terms of the purification of the obscurations of the afflictions, the power of the firm antidote is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause he is well established in the light of the bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom.

original: gnyen po shin tu rgyas pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kun du spyad pa rnams shin tu yongs su bsgom pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po shin tu rgyas pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kun du spyad pa rnams shin tu yongs su bsgom pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The power of the extensive antidote is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause he is well cultivated in the practices of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa rnams dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa rnams dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
