translated: The power of bringing sentient beings to full maturity is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause he is endowed with the analysis of method and wisdom.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag @207b pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag @207b pa'i nus pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The power of the purification of the obscurations to omniscience is that

original: byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par bsgrubs pas rnam par rgyas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par bsgrubs pas rnam par rgyas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: by accomplishing the factors of enlightenment, it is expanded.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa de chos de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par mi byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ches shas che zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa de chos de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par mi byed pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ches shas che zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this Manifest bodhisattva stage, because he does not act in accordance with those dharmas as they really are, is even more established in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe second sharp subsequent forbearance has arisen.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon po gnyis pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de la chos de dag ces bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis bsdus pa bstan ma thag pa rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa rnon po gnyis pa skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de la chos de dag ces bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par gyis bsdus pa bstan ma thag pa rnams so //
translated: In that regard, those dharmas are the immediately preceding ones included in the special power.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa de la sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa de la sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this Manifest bodhisattva stage sees many buddhas.

original: de dag las chos bstan pa nyan to //
analyzed: de dag las chos bstan pa nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma teachings from them.

original: thos nas kyang ji lta ba bzhin du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi snang bas rab tu sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi gzungs thob par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: thos nas kyang ji lta ba bzhin du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi snang bas rab tu sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi gzungs thob par yongs su ston te /
translated: This shows the attainment of the retention of meaning,

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it shows the cause of that retention.

original: / gzungs de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la brten pa'i lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas kyi snang ba la sbyor bas thob bo //
analyzed: / gzungs de ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la brten pa'i lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas kyi snang ba la sbyor bas thob bo //
translated: That retention is attained by application to the light of serenity and insight based on the special meditative concentration.üîΩAnd they retain it through practice,

original: nan tan gyis kyang 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas don de la reg pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan gyis kyang 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas don de la reg pa'o //
translated: because they attain the object by being freed from the obscurations to that retention.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram bee d'uryas phyis pa'i dpes ni sa 'di la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'phel bar gyur nas ches 'od gsal ba yongs su ston te /
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram bee d'uryas phyis pa'i dpes ni sa 'di la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'phel bar gyur nas ches 'od gsal ba yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of the gold ore and the lapis lazuli shows that on this spiritual level, transcendent wisdom increases and becomes very radiant.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid bee d'uryas phyis nas de bas kyang shas cher rab tu byang zhing shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid bee d'uryas phyis nas de bas kyang shas cher rab tu byang zhing shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, it is like this: for example, that very refined gold, when polished with lapis lazuli, becomes even more refined and very radiant.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa de dag kyang /
translated: O Sons of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the Bodhisattva who abides in this Manifest Bodhisattva Ground, when analyzed by means of wisdom and skillful means,

original: de bas shas cher rab tu byang zhing shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩchags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas shas cher rab tu byang zhing shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o // chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: become even more refined and very radiant.üîΩThe ground is called Manifest because it is the ground of the direct realization of the perfection of wisdom, which is the direct realization of non-apprehending wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The phrase when analyzed by means of wisdom and skillful means means that it is analyzed by means of the wisdom that is included in the path of non-abiding.

original: zla ba'i 'od kyi dpes ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dpes bstan pas snga ma'i ye shes @208a * //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od kyi dpes ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dpes bstan pas snga ma'i ye shes @208a * //
translated: The example of the light of the moon illustrates the light mandala.üîΩ

original: pas rgya che ba'i phyir bye brag ston te /
analyzed: pas rgya che ba'i phyir bye brag ston te /
translated: The example of the light of the moon shows that the wisdom of this ground is superior to the wisdom of the previous grounds by means of the example of the orb of light.

original: 'od chung ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'od chung ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The orb of light is the lesser light.

original: che ba ni 'od de /
analyzed: che ba ni 'od de /
translated: The greater light is the light itself.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, it is like this.

original: zla ba'i 'od de ni sems can gyi lus rnams kyang sim par byed la /
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od de ni sems can gyi lus rnams kyang sim par byed la /
translated: The light of the moon refreshes the bodies of sentient beings

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no//
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no//
translated: and is not overpowered by the four orbs of wind.üîΩO children of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva ground, The Manifest,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rnams kyang rab
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rnams kyang rab
translated: completely pacify the blazing afflictions of many quintillions of sentient beings

original: tu zhi bar byed cing /
analyzed: tu zhi bar byed cing /
translated: and are not overpowered by the four orbs of wind.

original: bdud bzhi'i lam gyi spyod ba ngan pa dag gis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la bdud bzhi'i lam gyi spyod pa ngan pa rnams ni bdud kyis 'jug par byed pa dag yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i lam gyi spyod ba ngan pa dag gis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la bdud bzhi'i lam gyi spyod pa ngan pa rnams ni bdud kyis 'jug par byed pa dag yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The bad conduct of the path of the four demons should be understood as the activities of the demons.

original: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma'i tshul gyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni snga ma'i tshul gyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as appropriate according to the previous method.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / bam po bcu pa /
translated: This completes the explanation of the sixth ground of the noble ones, The Manifest.üîΩThe seventh ground is presented in three parts: the explanation of the name of the ground, the analysis of the qualities of the ground, and the explanation of the name of the perfection.

original: sa bdun pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / zung du 'brel pa'i lam 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa dang ;
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / zung du 'brel pa'i lam 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa dang ;
translated: The explanation of the name of the groundüîΩThe ground is called Gone Afar because it is very farüîΩfrom the two obscurations.

original: sa snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as being established by five things: by the former and later stages, by the establishment of its result, and by the establishment of its distinctive attributes.

original: de la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po ni thabs dang shes rab kyis yang dag par skyed pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po dag ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po ni thabs dang shes rab kyis yang dag par skyed pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po dag ste /
translated: The remedy for delight in the absence of manifest activity is the distinctive composition of another path, which is generated by means of wisdom and skillful means.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa gnon te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa gnon te /
translated: O sons of the victors, when the bodhisattva has completed the path on the sixth bodhisattva stage, he ascends to the seventh bodhisattva stage.

original: de thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcus gnon to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcus gnon to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: By means of the ten distinctive attributes of the composition of another path, which is accomplished by means of the wisdom of skillful means, he ascends.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid la sems dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du gyur pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid la sems dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: That bodhisattva is one who delights in the mind of non-performance, because he is one who has attained the perfection of wisdom that is directed toward non-attached intuition.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i @208b mngon par 'du byed pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i @208b mngon par 'du byed pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: He is not one who delights in the performance of the higher realms.

original: de la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen por de dag rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen por de dag rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established as the antidotes to delight in that.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The intuition of means and intuition of wisdom is the intuition of the selflessness of dharmas together with the view of sentient beings.

original: lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par ni gnyen pos yongs su zin pa mngon par mtho ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par ni gnyen pos yongs su zin pa mngon par mtho ba'i lam mo //
translated: The difference in the composition of other paths is the path of the higher realms that is supported by the antidote.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzhan dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon par mtho ba'i lam las gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzhan dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon par mtho ba'i lam las gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: That is different from the mundane path of the higher realms and from the supramundane path.

original: yon tan rnam pa bzhis khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhis khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: It is superior by way of four qualities.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du longs spyod dang / lus kyi khyad par thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams sogs pas longs spyod dang / lus kyi khyad par gyi rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji srid 'dod pa'i bar du longs spyod dang / lus kyi khyad par thob pa'i rgyu bsod nams sogs pas longs spyod dang / lus kyi khyad par gyi rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The cause of obtaining the special enjoyments and bodies that one desires and for as long as one desires is merit.

original: smon pa med pa shin tu bsgom pa'i yid dang ldan la /
analyzed: smon pa med pa shin tu bsgom pa'i yid dang ldan la /
translated: The cause of the special enjoyments and bodies is the mind that is endowed with the cultivation of emptiness, signlessness,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ba sogs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde ltar khyad par thob pa tshad med pa bsgoms pas sems can rnams la log par mi sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ba sogs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o // de ltar khyad par thob pa tshad med pa bsgoms pas sems can rnams la log par mi sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: and wishlessness.

original: nyes par spyod pa las kun du bsrung ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang gang zag med pa'i chos rnams la yang 'jug la tshad med pa bzhi mngon par sgrub pa yang mi gtong ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa las kun du bsrung ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang gang zag med pa'i chos rnams la yang 'jug la tshad med pa bzhi mngon par sgrub pa yang mi gtong ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The cause of protecting sentient beings from misdeeds through cultivating immeasurable special attainments is the engagement in the phenomena of selflessness, life force, and the individual, and the non-abandonment of the accomplishment of the four immeasurables.

original: bsod nams kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams legs par byed pas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rang bzhin gyi chos kyi tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams legs par byed pas /
translated: The cause of protecting the roots of virtue is that he accumulates the collections of merit and knowledge, which are the natures of the perfections, and

original: de'i khyad par 'thob pa'i rgyu 'phel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'thob pa'i rgyu 'phel ba'i phyir /
translated: he increases the cause of attaining their distinctions.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bsrung ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bsrung ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The cause of protecting the roots of virtue is that he accumulates the collections of merit and knowledge, which are the natures of the perfections, andüîΩhe increases the cause of attaining their distinctions.üîΩThe cause of protecting the roots of virtue is that he accumulates the collections of merit and knowledge, which are the natures of the perfections, and

original: bsod nams kyi chos kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed la /üîΩchos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi chos kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed la / chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he increases the cause of attaining their distinctions.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa de yang sgo bdun nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa de yang sgo bdun nas rig par bya ste /
translated: The cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.

original: gtso bo dang mthun par byed pas gtso bos sems can gzhan 'dul ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir khams gsum pa thams cad las dben par gyur pa yang thob la /
analyzed: gtso bo dang mthun par byed pas gtso bos sems can gzhan 'dul ba'i phyir bsam bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir khams gsum pa thams cad las dben par gyur pa yang thob la /
translated: The cause of benefiting sentient beings is that he benefits sentient beings through seven doors.üîΩThe

original: khams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin no zhes gsungs @209a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin no zhes gsungs @209a * //
translated: and the accomplishment of the adornment of the three realms is also an accomplishment.

original: pa'o // kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal 'gags pas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi bas nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gnyen po ston pa ni /
analyzed: pa'o // kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal 'gags pas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi bas nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gnyen po ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the antidote for the complete pacification of the afflictions through complete peace and thorough peace by the cessation of the entanglements and the latent tendencies is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa dang 'bar ba thams cad dang bral bas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba yang yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa dang 'bar ba thams cad dang bral bas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba yang yin la /
translated: Because of being completely peaceful and thoroughly peaceful through being free from all afflictions and burning,

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and because of accomplishing the complete pacification of the burning afflictions of desire, hatred, and ignorance of all sentient beings, it is an accomplishment.

original: sa lnga pa las gnod pa rnams pa bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa'i gnod pa zhi bar byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sa lnga pa las gnod pa rnams pa bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa'i gnod pa zhi bar byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The pacification of the four kinds of harm that are taught in the fifth ground is as follows: Because of being free from the harm of the afflictions,

original: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa'i rang bzhin lta bur gnyis su med par yang khong du chud la /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / chu zla dang / gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa'i rang bzhin lta bur gnyis su med par yang khong du chud la /
translated: They are also skilled in the non-duality of all things, which is like an illusion, a dream, a mirage, an echo, the moon in water, a reflection, or a magical creation.

original: las bya ba rnam par phye ba tshad med pa'i bsam pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: las bya ba rnam par phye ba tshad med pa'i bsam pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They also accomplish the accomplishment of the immeasurable intention to discriminate the performance of actions.

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su 'du bar byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su 'du bar byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: They gather in the circles of the assembly in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: zhing gi tha gru nam mkha' dang mnyam par shin tu bsgom pa'i yid dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: zhing gi tha gru nam mkha' dang mnyam par shin tu bsgom pa'i yid dang yang ldan la /
translated: They also have the mind that is cultivated to the extent of the vastness of the sky.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They also accomplish the accomplishment of the creation of the adornments of the Buddha-land.

original: lta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang mchod par sbyor ba rnams kyi bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba dang / mnyan pa dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang mchod par sbyor ba rnams kyi bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa ni /
translated: They increase the merit of those who are engaged in seeing, hearing, attending, and worshipping.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du yang 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du yang 'jug la /
translated: Because all the Buddhas enter into the nature of the Dharma Body,

original: gzugs dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and they also accomplish the adornment of form, the major and minor marks.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The turning of the wheel of the Dharma is because

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral te /
translated: the Tathagata's speech is inexpressible and free from sound and voice,

original: rang bzhin gyi zhi bar yang mos la dbyangs dang yan lag thams cad rnam par phye bas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi zhi bar yang mos la dbyangs dang yan lag thams cad rnam par phye bas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and he is also intent on the peacefulness of the nature of things, and he also accomplishes the adornment of the purification of all the aspects of speech.

original: dris pa lung ston pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu thugs su chud pa la yang 'jug la sems can gyi bsam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dris pa lung ston pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu thugs su chud pa la yang 'jug la sems can gyi bsam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The prediction of the future is because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, enter into the understanding that the three times have the same characteristic, and for the sake of expressing the thoughts of sentient beings,

original: bskal pa 'grangs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa shes pa la yang 'jug pa yin te @209b zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa 'grangs pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa shes pa la yang 'jug pa yin te @209b zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It also engages in knowing the characteristics of the eons that are completed.

original: de dag ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: These are the ten distinctions of beginning another path, together with the thorough cultivation of the antidotes.

original: de dag gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa shin tu bsgoms pa dang / bdag med pa'i chos la 'jug pa la sogs pas ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa shin tu bsgoms pa dang / bdag med pa'i chos la 'jug pa la sogs pas ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The thorough cultivation of the antidotes should be understood as the thorough cultivation of emptiness and so on and the engagement with the Dharma of selflessness and so on, as is appropriate.

original: 'di dag snang bar gyur pas sa 'di la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag snang bar gyur pas sa 'di la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Since these are illuminated, one abides on this bh≈´mi.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa las rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pas byang chub sems
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa las rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pas byang chub sems
translated: O sons of the victors, through these ten distinctions of beginning another path that is accomplished by means of method and wisdom, the bodhisattva has thoroughly distinguished the sixth bodhisattva bh≈´mi and

original: dpa'i sa bdun pa gnon to //
analyzed: dpa'i sa bdun pa gnon to //
translated: ascends to the seventh bodhisattva bh≈´mi.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi tshogs thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po snang bar gyur pa de dag mngon par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam gyi tshogs thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par bcu po snang bar gyur pa de dag mngon par bsgrubs pas /
translated: O sons of the Victor, in this way, the ten special compositions of the path of the Bodhisattva-mahasattva, which are the path of the accumulation of the path of means and insight, are manifested.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa non zhes bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa non zhes bya ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: By accomplishing them, he is said to have mounted the seventh Bodhisattva stage.

original: de ltar re zhig mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas sa bdun pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas sa bdun pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the seventh stage is to be understood as being established by the antidote to the delight in the absence of the activity of the will.

original: de'i 'og tu de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: After that, the antidote to the distraction of that stage is to be understood as twofold:

original: tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam la sbyar ba'o //
translated: the cultivation of the immeasurable aspects and the application to the path of the absence of the activity of the will.

original: de la tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the immeasurable aspects is as follows:

original: gang gi don du byed pa dang / gnas gang yin pa dang / gang gi dang / ji lta bu dang / gang du dang / de dag tha dad pas rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du byed pa dang / gnas gang yin pa dang / gang gi dang / ji lta bu dang / gang du dang / de dag tha dad pas rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as having ten aspects, in terms of what is done, where it is done, who does it, what it is like, where it is done, and their differences.

original: de la gang dag gi don du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can tshad med pa de dag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / gdul bya'i las tshad med pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag gi don du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can tshad med pa de dag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / gdul bya'i las tshad med pa byed pa ste /
translated: Here, what is done is that immeasurable sentient beings are brought to full maturity and immeasurable work for the sake of those to be trained is done.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: For, on the seventh bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva enters into the immeasurable realm of sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / 'dul ba'i phrin las tshad med pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / 'dul ba'i phrin las tshad med pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and he enters into the immeasurable work of the Lord Buddhas in bringing sentient beings to full maturity and training them.

original: gnas gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams tshad @210a * //
analyzed: gnas gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams tshad @210a * //
translated: Where it is done is in immeasurable world systems.

original: med pa dag na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: med pa dag na sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la brten pa ste /
translated: In the absence of anything, they enter into the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mang po tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mang po tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: Because they enter into the immeasurable world-realms,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis zhing yongs su dag pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis zhing yongs su dag pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and they enter into the purification of the Buddha-field of the Lord Buddhas.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la chos tha dad pa nyid dang / ye shes tshad med pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gang gi phyir chos tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la chos tha dad pa nyid dang / ye shes tshad med pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gang gi phyir chos tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: By means of what? They enter into the immeasurable differentiation of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par thugs su chud pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and they enter into the immeasurable realization of the knowledge of the Lord Buddhas.

original: bskal pa 'grangs pa dang / dus gsum tshad med par rtogs pas ni gang gi phyir bskal pa 'grangs pa tshad med pa rtogs pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: bskal pa 'grangs pa dang / dus gsum tshad med par rtogs pas ni gang gi phyir bskal pa 'grangs pa tshad med pa rtogs pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: By means of the realization of the immeasurable duration of the world-realms and the three times, they enter into the realization of the immeasurable duration of the world-realms,üîΩand they enter into the realization of the immeasurable duration of the three times.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dus gsum thugs su chud pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dus gsum thugs su chud pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and they also enter into the immeasurable comprehension of the three times by the Lord Buddhas.üîΩHow?

original: ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In three ways:üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.

original: lha tha dad pa la mos pa rnams la lus dang sems 'dra bar 'jug pas /
analyzed: lha tha dad pa la mos pa rnams la lus dang sems 'dra bar 'jug pas /
translated: For those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,

original: de dag la mos pa bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de dag la mos pa bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: and he turns them away from that devotion.

original: sems can gyi mos pa tha dad pa'i khyad par tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa tha dad pa'i khyad par tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: For those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ming dang gzugs kyi sku tha dad pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ming dang gzugs kyi sku tha dad pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.

original: sngon gyi bsam pa las byung ba'i dbang po rtul po dang / 'bring dang rnon po rnams la ci rigs par chos ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi bsam pas dbang po tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam pa las byung ba'i dbang po rtul po dang / 'bring dang rnon po rnams la ci rigs par chos ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi bsam pas dbang po tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: For those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs,üîΩand he turns them away from that devotion.üîΩFor those who are devoted to the different gods, he enters into a body and mind like theirs

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung brjod pas sems can gzhan tshim par mdzad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung brjod pas sems can gzhan tshim par mdzad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and also they engage in the immeasurable satisfaction of other sentient beings by the speech of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sems can rnams kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnyen po'i gdams ngag rjes su ston pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnyen po'i gdams ngag rjes su ston pa ni /
translated: The instruction in the antidote in accordance with the conduct of sentient beings is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi sems kyi spyod pa tha dad pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: and also they engage in the immeasurable different conducts of the minds of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes rab 'byam tshad med pa rjes su rtog pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes rab 'byam tshad med pa rjes su rtog pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and also they engage in the immeasurable knowledge of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum la ste /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum la ste /
translated: Where? In the three vehicles.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni gang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par @210b 'byung ba la mos pas tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni gang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par @210b 'byung ba la mos pas tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: Therein, in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, they engage in the immeasurable faith in the renunciation by the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi lam bstan pa tshad med pa la 'jug pa la yang mos so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi lam bstan pa tshad med pa la 'jug pa la yang mos so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They aspire to enter the immeasurable teachings of the path of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ni gang gi phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par sgrub pa 'grub pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la ni gang gi phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par sgrub pa 'grub pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: In the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, they enter the accomplishment of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes zab mo'i sgor 'jug pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes zab mo'i sgor 'jug pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: they enter the immeasurable teachings of the entry into the profound wisdom of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: theg pa chen po la ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor ba'i tshad med pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: In the Great Vehicle, they enter the immeasurable application of the Bodhisattvas‚Äô Bodhisattva conduct and

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la 'jug pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la 'jug pa bstan pa tshad med pa la yang 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: they enter the immeasurable teachings of the entry into the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: de ltar de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa bcu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po tshad med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa bcu bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught ten kinds of immeasurable meditations as the antidote to distraction,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam la sbyor ba ston te /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam la sbyor ba ston te / gang gi phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he teaches the application to the path without deliberate effort.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul de ni de ltar tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul de ni de ltar tshad med pa ste /
translated: For what reason does he think, The domain of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones is immeasurable.

original: de ni bskal pa byed ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag ji snyed pa de snyed kyis kyang bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bskal pa byed ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag ji snyed pa de snyed kyis kyang bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not easy to measure it in eons, in hundreds of eons, in thousands of eons, in hundreds of thousands of eons, in hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of eons.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul de bdag gis yang dag par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul de bdag gis yang dag par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will generate that domain of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: lhun gyis grub pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med par yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med par yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: I will perfect it spontaneously, non-conceptually, and without discrimination.

original: de la ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la rnam par rtog pa med pas lhun gyis grub pa nyid de rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma gnyis kyis ston to //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid dang bye brag la rnam par rtog pa med pas lhun gyis grub pa nyid de rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og ma gnyis kyis ston to //
translated: Since it is free from conceptual thought regarding the essence and the particulars, it is spontaneous, as shown by the two words non-conceptual and non-discursive.

original: de ltar legs par so sor brtag pa'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing rtag par rgyun du mngon par brtson pa de /
analyzed: de ltar legs par so sor brtag pa'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing rtag par rgyun du mngon par brtson pa de /
translated: Thus, the wisdom of thorough analysis, endowed with the superknowledges, is always and continuously applied.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su bsgom pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par rnams la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis shin tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su bsgom pa'i lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par rnams la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis shin tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well-established in the special compositions of the other paths of cultivation by means of skill in means and wisdom, in the manner of non-distraction. This is because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: de ltar de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas sa 'di bstan nas zung du 'brel pa'i lam 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa @211a * //
analyzed: de ltar de'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po rnam par gzhag pas sa 'di bstan nas zung du 'brel pa'i lam 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa @211a * //
translated: Thus, having taught this ground by way of the presentation of the antidotes to distraction, the attainment of the path of union is presented

original: rnam pa bzhis ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis ston te /
translated: in four ways.

original: gnyis cig car dang / rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / don chen po byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis cig car dang / rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / mos pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang / don chen po byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: the simultaneous occurrence of the two, the uninterrupted occurrence of the two, the special purity of aspiration, the performance of great benefits, and the classification of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de skad cig gcig la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam mngon sum du byed pas gnyis cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad cig gcig la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam mngon sum du byed pas gnyis cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The simultaneous occurrence of the two should be understood as the actualization of the path of serenity and insight in a single moment.

original: spyod pa'i lam thams cad du de dang ldan pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i lam thams cad du de dang ldan pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
translated: The uninterrupted occurrence of the two is in all the paths of practice.

original: gang gi phyir de skad cig gcig la yang lam mngon par sgrub cing mi ldang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad cig gcig la yang lam mngon par sgrub cing mi ldang ste /
translated: Because in a single moment he accomplishes the path and does not rise from it.

original: de 'gro'am / 'greng ngam /
analyzed: de 'gro'am / 'greng ngam /
translated: Whether he is walking, standing,

original: 'dug gam / nyal lam /
analyzed: 'dug gam / nyal lam /
translated: sitting, lying down,

original: rmi lam na yang ye shes de lta bu la mngon par brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang ye shes de lta bu la mngon par brtson pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: or even in dreams, he is intent on that knowledge.

original: sgrib pa med pas mos pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir sgrib pa med pas spyod lam thams cad la gnas shing /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pas mos pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir sgrib pa med pas spyod lam thams cad la gnas shing /
translated: The special purity of aspiration is due to the absence of obscurations.

original: 'du shes yid la bya ba rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mi 'bral pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes yid la bya ba rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mi 'bral pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is never separated from these kinds of perception and attention.

original: de la ye shes tshad med pa de dag la bkra bar byed pa'i phyir 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la ye shes tshad med pa de dag la bkra bar byed pa'i phyir 'du shes so //
translated: Among them, perception is the vividness of those immeasurable knowledges.

original: mngon du 'dun par byed pa'i phyir yid la byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon du 'dun par byed pa'i phyir yid la byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Attention is the mental orientation toward them.

original: sems can re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yang dag par sgrub pa'i don chen po byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yang dag par sgrub pa'i don chen po byed pa ste /
translated: The great purpose is the accomplishment of the ten perfections for each sentient being.

original: gang gi phyir de'i sems bskyed pa re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yang dag par sgrub pa yang dag par 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i sems bskyed pa re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yang dag par sgrub pa yang dag par 'grub bo //
translated: Because in each generation of the thought of enlightenment, the bodhisattva accomplishes the ten perfections and the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba'i sems bskyed pa 'byung ba re re thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir te /üîΩde la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba'i sems bskyed pa 'byung ba re re thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir te / de la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol zhing /
translated: Thus, for the bodhisattva, each arising of the generation of mind preceded by great compassion is the accomplishment of the qualities of a buddha and the dedication to the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba gtong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba gtong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the perfection of generosity is the seeking of the wisdom of the Buddha and the giving of the roots of virtue to sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the pacification of all the torments of the afflictions.

original: snying rje dang byams pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can thams cad la gnod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang byams pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can thams cad la gnod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the non-harming of any sentient being preceded by compassion and love.

original: gong nas gong du rtsom pas dge ba'i chos kyis mi ngoms pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brtson @211b 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du rtsom pas dge ba'i chos kyis mi ngoms pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brtson @211b 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the virtue of not being satisfied with the good qualities that one has acquired.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i lam las mi 'phyar ba gang yin pa de ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i lam las mi 'phyar ba gang yin pa de ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the path that does not stray from the direct realization of omniscient wisdom.

original: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa mngon sum du bya bar bzod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa mngon sum du bya bar bzod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the patience that directly realizes the unborn nature of things.

original: ye shes kyis tshad med par mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis tshad med par mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of skillful means is the accomplishment of immeasurable wisdom.

original: ye shes kyis gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyis gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of aspiration is the accomplishment of higher and higher wisdom.

original: phas kyi rgol ba dang bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam gyi rgyun mi chod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dang bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam gyi rgyun mi chod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of power is that by which the continuum of the path is not interrupted by any adversaries or hosts of demons.

original: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the correct discernment of all dharmas.

original: de la thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshad med par mngon par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de la thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshad med par mngon par sgrub pa ste /
translated: Among these, the perfection of skill in means is the accomplishment of immeasurable knowledge.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyi ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa tshad med pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyi ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa tshad med pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: It is the knowledge of the distinctive transformation by which one accomplishes immeasurable giving, etc.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyis gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyis gong nas gong du mngon par sgrub pa ste /
translated: The perfection of vows is the accomplishment of knowledge in ascending order.

original: skye ba'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: It is the knowledge by which one accomplishes giving, etc., in ascending order, by taking up the distinctive rebirths.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phas kyi rgol ba dang / bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam gyi rgyun mi chod pa ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phas kyi rgol ba dang / bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam gyi rgyun mi chod pa ste /
translated: The perfection of power is the uninterrupted continuity of the path by all adversaries and hosts of demons.

original: lam gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the path by which one conquers the resistances to generosity, etc.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad la ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad la ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtog pa ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the certain understanding of all things as they are.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ye shes gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge by which one knows all the varieties of generosity, etc. for the sake of bringing beings to maturity.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs pa rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs pa rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The differentiation of the factors of enlightenment should be understood as fourfold:

original: theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams su dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams su dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The differentiation of the perfections is in terms of their inclusion in the Great Vehicle.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i pha rol tu phyin pa de dag skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsems can yongs su smin par byed par gtogs @212a * //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i pha rol tu phyin pa de dag skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o // sems can yongs su smin par byed par gtogs @212a * //
translated: O sons of the Victor, in this way, the perfections of the bodhisattva who is on the far-reaching stage are fulfilled moment by moment.

original: pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams su dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams su dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The classification of the means of gathering disciples is in terms of the bodhisattva's bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The four means of gathering disciples are fulfilled.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed par gtogs pa'i phyir gnas dang byang chub kyis phyogs pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i sko rnams su dbye ba ni gang la gnas nas gang zhig bsgoms te /üîΩsgo gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag par byed par gtogs pa'i phyir gnas dang byang chub kyis phyogs pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i sko rnams su dbye ba ni gang la gnas nas gang zhig bsgoms te /üîΩsgo gang gis rnam par dag par 'gyur bya ste /
translated: The classification of the stations, the dharmas of the wings of enlightenment, and the deliverances is in terms of the bodhisattva's purification of the obscurations of the afflictions.üîΩThe stations are the four immeasurables, loving kindness and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gnas bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because the four stations of Brahma, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and the three gateways to liberation are completely fulfilled.

original: shes bya'i sgrib ba rnam par dag par byed par gtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib ba rnam par dag par byed par gtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it belongs to the purification of the obscurations to omniscience,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad du dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad du dbye ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the classification of all the dharmas of the factors of awakening is as follows.

original: mdor na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In brief, all the dharmas of the factors of awakening are completely fulfilled in each moment.

original: de ltar zung du 'brel pa'i lam thob pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'brel pa'i lam thob pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the attainment of the path of union,

original: sa snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni sa 'og ma dang / gong ma bas khyad zhugs pa dang / dma' ba gnyis kyis sa bdun pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni sa 'og ma dang / gong ma bas khyad zhugs pa dang / dma' ba gnyis kyis sa bdun pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: the distinction in terms of the earlier and later stages is as follows: The distinction of the seventh stage is to be known through two things: the distinction of superiority and the distinction of inferiority in relation to the lower and higher stages.

original: khyad zhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction of superiority?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the conduct that arises from application is completely perfected.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon te /
translated: Therefore, the conduct of exalted wisdom and the superknowledges is mastered.

original: gang gi phyir de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: For that reason, when this was said, the bodhisattva Vimukti candra said to the bodhisattva Vajra garbha,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors, do all the branches of enlightenment of the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage become completely perfected in every instant,

original: 'on te sa bcu po thams cad la yang de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te sa bcu po thams cad la yang de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: or do they become completely perfected in the same way on all ten stages?‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said,üîΩ‚ÄúO son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, the Far-reaching, has completely perfected the branches of enlightenment.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po thams cad la yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par lta 'gyur te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po thams cad la yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par lta 'gyur te /
translated: O son of the victors, you should see that the branches of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas are perfected on all ten bodhisattva stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la lhag par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la lhag par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But they are perfected in a special way on this seventh bodhisattva stage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe @212b na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe @212b na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed bas ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed bas ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O son of the victors, it is because the bodhisattvas perfect the conduct that arises from application, in order to master the conduct of knowledge and higher perception.

original: de la mngon par shes pa ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa ni lnga'o //
translated: Among those, the higher perceptions are five.

original: ye shes ni ji skad du bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni ji skad du bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Knowledge should be understood as it is taught.

original: ji ltar nas 'di la sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nas 'di la sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the conduct that arises from application perfected on this stage?

original: de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lam las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the path that is superior to the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: For this very reason, the limbs of enlightenment are perfected in this stage, since all the qualities of the Buddha are generated.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal pa'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la ni smon lam thams cad la lhag par dmigs pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal pa'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la ni smon lam thams cad la lhag par dmigs pas /
translated: O son of the victors, on the first stage of the bodhisattva, all aspirations are especially focused.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are perfected.

original: gnyis pa la ni sems kyi dri ma bsal bas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sems kyi dri ma bsal bas so //
translated: On the second, by removing the stains of the mind.

original: gsum pa la ni smon lam rnam par 'phel ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thob pas so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni smon lam rnam par 'phel ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thob pas so //
translated: On the third, by the increase of aspirations and the attainment of the light of the Dharma.

original: bzhi pa la ni lam la zhugs pas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni lam la zhugs pas so //
translated: On the fourth, by entering the path.

original: lnga pa la ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba dang mthun par 'jug pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'jig rten gyi bya ba dang mthun par 'jug pas so //
translated: On the fifth, by engaging in the activities of the world.

original: drug pa la ni chos zab mo'i sgor 'jug phas so //
analyzed: drug pa la ni chos zab mo'i sgor 'jug phas so //
translated: On the sixth, he enters the door of the profound Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: On this seventh bodhisattva stage, the branches of enlightenment are perfected because all the qualities of the Buddha are generated.

original: da ltar sa 'og ma las khyad zhugs pas snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar sa 'og ma las khyad zhugs pas snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the superiority of the later stages over the earlier ones should be understood as being established on the basis of the perfection of the branches of enlightenment.

original: sa 'og ma las dma' ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og ma las dma' ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they inferior to the lower stages?

original: ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i yan lag rnams 'bad pa dang bcas pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i yan lag rnams 'bad pa dang bcas pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The branches of application for the realization of transcendent knowledge are perfected with effort.

original: gang gi phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first bodhisattva stage,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpas ye shes dang mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa la sbyor ba'i yan lag gang dag mngon par bsgrub pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub parüîΩyongs su 'grub po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpas ye shes dang mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa la sbyor ba'i yan lag gang dag mngon par bsgrub pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub par yongs su 'grub po //
translated: The branches of application for accomplishing the knowledge and higher perceptions of the bodhisattvas up to the seventh bodhisattva level are fully accomplished spontaneously on the eighth bodhisattva level and above.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /üîΩdper na kun nas nyon mongs pa la @213a * //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste / dper na kun nas nyon mongs pa la @213a * //
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones, it is like this:üîΩFor example, the space between a world system that is completely defiled

original: rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni mngon par shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po ma gtogs par gya chom du 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni mngon par shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po ma gtogs par gya chom du 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: and a world system that is completely pure cannot be crossed except by the great power of higher perception.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa las yongs su dag pa la yang smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang mngon par shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po ma gtogs pa gya tshom du 'da' bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa las yongs su dag pa la yang smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang mngon par shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po ma gtogs pa gya tshom du 'da' bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O son of the victors, in the same way, it is not possible to pass over the pure bodhisattva conduct without the great power of aspiration, skillful means, wisdom, and superknowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par shes par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par shes par bya ba yin nam /
translated: O son of the victors, is it the case that on the seventh bodhisattva ground the bodhisattva conduct is to be understood as being afflicted by the conduct of afflictions?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po kho na nas bzung ste /
translated: O son of the victors, from the first bodhisattva ground onward,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam dang mthun pa nyid du byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang bral bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam dang mthun pa nyid du byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang bral bar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that all the bodhisattva practices are free from the faults of the afflictions by the power of their being completely dedicated to enlightenment in accordance with the appropriate path.üîΩHowever, one should not say that the seven stages are completely beyond the practice of the afflictions.

original: de tsam gyis nas bdun po rnams la nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa las shin tu 'das zhes ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis nas bdun po rnams la nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa las shin tu 'das zhes ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, these stages are called ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù and ‚Äúpurified,‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of the practice of the afflictions.

original: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam dang mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa de dang de ni ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam dang mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa de dang de ni ji ltar 'tsham pa'i lam la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn accordance with the appropriate path‚Äù means that each stage is related to the appropriate path.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpes ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pas 'khor los sgyur ba mi lus 'das pa ltar /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpes ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pas 'khor los sgyur ba mi lus 'das pa ltar /
translated: The example of the universal monarch shows that, like a universal monarch who has taken birth in the world of Brahma, he has transcended the human body.

original: sa brgyad pa la rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa las shin tu 'das pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa las shin tu 'das pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: On the eighth level, they are shown to be utterly beyond the flaws of defilement because they acquire the path that arises from the maturation of that potential.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni /
translated: O children of the buddhas, it is like this. For example, a universal emperor

original: lha'i glang po rin po che la zhon zhing gling bzhi dag tu yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha'i glang po rin po che la zhon zhing gling bzhi dag tu yang 'gro'o //
translated: rides the precious elephant of the gods and goes to the four continents.
