original: mi'i sdug bsngal dang / dbul ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mi'i sdug bsngal dang / dbul ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the sufferings of humans and their poverty and defilements,

original: nyes pa de dag gis gos pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag gis gos pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: but he is not affected by those faults.

original: de tsam gyis mi'i lus las shin tu 'das pa @213b yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis mi'i lus las shin tu 'das pa @213b yang ma yin te /
translated: However, he has not transcended the human body to that extent.

original: gang gi tshe ma'i lus spangs nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma'i lus spangs nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he abandons his human body and is reborn in the world of Brahma,

original: tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang na gnas te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang na gnas te /
translated: he dwells in the palace of Brahma.

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mthong zhing rnam par rgyu la tshangs pas snang ba yang ston te /
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mthong zhing rnam par rgyu la tshangs pas snang ba yang ston te /
translated: They see and move through a thousand world systems and they manifest the appearance of Brahma.

original: mi zhes kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: mi zhes kyang mi brjod do //
translated: They are not called humans.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: O child of the conquerors, in the same way, from the first bodhisattva level onward,

original: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattvas ride in the vehicle of the transcendent perfections and move through all the worlds,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te yang dag pa'i lam du zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gis kyang mi gos kyi /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te yang dag pa'i lam du zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gis kyang mi gos kyi /
translated: they know the defects of defilement and, by following the right path, they are not affected by those defilements.

original: de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams la nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams la nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: But it is not said that on the seven levels they have completely transcended the defects of defilement.

original: gang gi tshe sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa spangs nas sa bdun pa nas sa bdun pa nas sa brgyad pa non par gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnam par dag pa la zhon te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa spangs nas sa bdun pa nas sa bdun pa nas sa brgyad pa non par gyur pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnam par dag pa la zhon te /
translated: When they have abandoned the conduct that arises from practice and have reached the eighth from the seventh stage, then they ride the vehicle of the pure bodhisattva stages.

original: 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: They travel everywhere and also understand the faults of afflictions.

original: shin tu 'das pas de dag gis gos par gyur ces mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsa 'di ni rnam par smin pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / lam mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu 'das pas de dag gis gos par gyur ces mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o // sa 'di ni rnam par smin pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / lam mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have transcended them, it is not said that they are tainted by them.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya mi bya'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya mi bya'o /
translated: This stage is not called ‚Äúwithout affliction‚Äù because it does not dwell in karmic maturation and because its intention is not fully accomplished by the path that is accompanied by formative influence.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phyir gong ma rnams la ni mi brjed de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phyir gong ma rnams la ni mi brjed de /
translated: But the higher stages are not called that because they are the opposite of that.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag par 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad las kyang shin tu 'das te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag par 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad las kyang shin tu 'das te /
translated: O son of the victors, because the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva ground has gone far beyond all the masses of afflictions such as attachment,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa dang bas pa zhes kyang mi bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa dang bas pa zhes kyang mi bya /
translated: the bodhisattva who practices on this bodhisattva ground Gone Far is not called one who has abandoned the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: nor is he called one who is without afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi 'byung ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi 'byung ba nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Because the non-arising of the afflictions is not called having afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde ltar snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag @214a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o // de ltar snga phyi las khyad par rnam par gzhag @214a * //
translated: And because he has not fulfilled his wish and aspiration for the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas, he is not called one who is without afflictions.

original: pa bstan nas /
analyzed: pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the presentation of the differences between the earlier and later grounds,üîΩnow, the explanation of the distinctive features of the seventh ground:

original: las rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par 'thob pa dang / sa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa dang / rnam pa bzhis sa 'di'i zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: las rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par 'thob pa dang / sa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa dang / rnam pa bzhis sa 'di'i zung du 'brel pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yongs su ston to //
translated: The path of union on this ground is presented in terms of four topics: the purification of karma, the attainment of special meditative absorption, the transcendence of the levels, and the attainment of special abiding.

original: de la las rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de la las rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su ston te /
translated: The purification of karma is presented in four ways.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The special purity of discipline is presented in the following:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /üîΩlhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva ground possesses a physical activity that is utterly pure in its intention.üîΩHe possesses a verbal activity that is utterly pure in its intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He possesses a mental activity that is utterly pure in its intention.

original: de mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa de dag las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa yin /
analyzed: de mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa de dag las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa yin /
translated: He has completely transcended all those paths of unwholesome action that the Tathagata has condemned.

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa de dag la rtag par rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa de dag la rtag par rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He always and continuously practices those paths of wholesome action that the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, has taught.üîΩThe distinctive feature of the purity of mundane knowledge is that all those mundane arts,

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas gang dag mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad kyang 'dir lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas gang dag mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad kyang 'dir lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: skills, and crafts that he has accomplished on the fifth Bodhisattva stage arise here effortlessly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su slob dpon du grags pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su slob dpon du grags pa yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Except for the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and the Bodhisattvas who are on the eighth stage and above, he is the master in the great billion-fold world-system.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor bas mnyam pa med pa'i lus kyi khyad par 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor bas mnyam pa med pa'i lus kyi khyad par 'thob pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The attainment of the special body which is unequaled in thought and practice is as follows:

original: de dang bsam pa'am sbyor ba mnyam pa su yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bsam pa'am sbyor ba mnyam pa su yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because there is no one who is equal to him in thought or practice.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa'i khyad par gyis nus pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa'i khyad par gyis nus pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ni /
translated: The attainment of the special ability through the special realization of the concentrations, etc. is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams @214b dang ; mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams gang yin pa de dag kyang bsgom pa'i sgo'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du de la mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams @214b dang ; mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams gang yin pa de dag kyang bsgom pa'i sgo'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du de la mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all the meditative concentrations, all the meditative stabilizations, all the meditative attainments, all the superknowledges, and all the liberations will manifest for him through the method of meditative development.

original: 'on kyang de tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he has not yet fully completed the maturation of the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems bskyed pa thams cad la shes rab dang thabs bsgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems bskyed pa thams cad la shes rab dang thabs bsgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because for the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, all his thoughts are completed through the power of meditative development of wisdom and liberative art.

original: de bas kyang shas cher byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And he obtains the completion of all the limbs of enlightenment, even more so than before.

original: de la bsam gtan rnams ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan rnams ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The meditative stabilizations are for the sake of bringing sentient beings to full maturity and for the sake of abiding in the bliss of peace.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: The concentrations and meditative attainments are the basis for accomplishing the superknowledges and the deliverances.

original: 'gog pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are like cessation and meditative attainment, respectively.

original: de ltar zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi las yang dag par 'das pa yongs su bstan nas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par 'thob pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bcus yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi las yang dag par 'das pa yongs su bstan nas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par 'thob pa ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bcus yongs su ston te /
translated: Thus, having taught the four kinds of results of the path of union, he now teaches the attainment of the distinctive meditative stabilizations, by means of ten kinds of meditative stabilization.

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i don las brtsam pa ni gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i don las brtsam pa ni gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: And that is in terms of the nonconceptual and the meaning of the nonconceptual, because it is for the sake of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: He enters the meditative absorption called ‚Äúthe thorough differentiation of the bodhisattva‚Äôs meditative absorption.‚Äù

original: don shin tu bsam pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don shin tu bsam pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is thoroughly contemplated.

original: tshig gcig la don gyi khyad par du mar 'byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: tshig gcig la don gyi khyad par du mar 'byed pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The differentiation of many different meanings in a single word is because

original: khyad par ni blo gros zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni blo gros zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: the differentiation is called ‚Äúintelligence.‚Äù

original: don gcig la rnam grangs du mar ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: don gcig la rnam grangs du mar ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The teaching of a single meaning in many different ways is because

original: rab tu dbye ba'i don gyis mdzod ces bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i don gyis mdzod ces bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: the meaning of the differentiation is called ‚Äútreasury.‚Äù

original: rig pa thams cad kyi gnas shes pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rig pa thams cad kyi gnas shes pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The knowledge of the domain of all the sciences is because

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the meaning is thoroughly differentiated.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs te /
translated: Focusing on suchness,

original: rtsa ba bstan pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba bstan pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the purification of the afflictive obstructions by teaching the root is because

original: rtsa ba shin tu gnas pas brtan pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba shin tu gnas pas brtan pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the root is thoroughly stabilized.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par sbyong @215a * //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par sbyong @215a * //
translated: It purifies the four kinds of obscurations.üîΩüîΩ

original: ba'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ba'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the purification of the knowable is begun for the sake of the purification of the four kinds of obscurations.üîΩThe four kinds of obscurations are: the obscuration of the special qualities, the antidote to which is called the door of knowledge and superknowledge;üîΩ the obscuration to the unobstructed knowledge of the knowable, the antidote to which is called the door of the knowledge of the aspects of the path;üîΩthe obscuration to unobstructed knowledge, the antidote to which is called the door of the knowledge of the aspects of the path;

original: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi la yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa de'i gnyen por ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i sgo zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩchags pa med pa'i ye shes la sgrib pa de'i gnyen por chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bzhi la yon tan khyad par can la sgrib pa de'i gnyen por ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i sgo zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o // chags pa med pa'i ye shes la sgrib pa de'i gnyen por chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab cing rgya che ba la zhum pa'i sgrib pa de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab cing rgya che ba la zhum pa'i sgrib pa de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i phan yon zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the obscuration to unobstructed knowledge, the antidote to which is called the door of the knowledge of the aspects of the path;

original: mi gnas pa'i lam la sgrib pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i lam la sgrib pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the obscuration to unobstructed knowledge, the antidote to which is called the door of the knowledge of the aspects of the path;üîΩthe obscuration to unobstructed knowledge, the antidote to which is called the door of the knowledge of the aspects of the

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin don sna tshogs kyi mdzod 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin don sna tshogs kyi mdzod 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He enters the bodhisattva absorption called ‚Äúthe treasury of various meanings, the gateway to sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: don sna tshogs kyi mdzod ces bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don sna tshogs kyi mdzod ces bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe treasury of various meanings‚Äù should be understood as the various roots of virtue.

original: de dag la sogs pa ye shes dang mngon par shes pa chen po'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa 'bum phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa ye shes dang mngon par shes pa chen po'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa 'bum phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He enters into the ten complete sets of one hundred thousand absorptions that purify the stages, the gateways to the great wisdom and superknowledges.

original: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyong ba'i ting nge 'dzin de dag thob nas snying brtse ba dang / snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa yin no ;
analyzed: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyong ba'i ting nge 'dzin de dag thob nas snying brtse ba dang / snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa yin no ;
translated: Having attained those absorptions that purify through method and wisdom, through the power of his love and compassion he transcends the activities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: / shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa yang mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba de la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa ni thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa'i stobs dang / snying rje'i stobs dang rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su ston to //
analyzed: / shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa yang mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba de la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa ni thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa'i stobs dang / snying rje'i stobs dang rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su ston to //
translated: The transcendence of the activities of the disciples and the solitary sages is shown by two aspects: by the power of the cultivation of wisdom and means, and by the power of compassion.

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The stage of investigation by wisdom and knowledge is the eighth stage.

original: mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The manifestation is the near stage.

original: der ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam grub pa yin te /
analyzed: der ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam grub pa yin te /
translated: There, the path of serenity and insight is accomplished,

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: and there is only investigation.

original: yang dag par 'das pa de yang las kyi khyad par gyis rab tu ston te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'das pa de yang las kyi khyad par gyis rab tu ston te /
translated: That transcendence is shown by the special activity.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung /
translated: Because for the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, immeasurable physical actions arise that are free from signs.

original: dag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung /
analyzed: dag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung /
translated: Immeasurable verbal actions arise that are free from signs.

original: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa mi skye @215b ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa mi skye @215b ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Immeasurable mental actions arise that are free from signs, well purified, and illumined by the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: Here, being free from signs is due to being in meditative equipoise.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las mtshan ma dang bral bar 'byung du zin kyang sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bya ba med pas tshad med pa ma yin no//
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las mtshan ma dang bral bar 'byung du zin kyang sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bya ba med pas tshad med pa ma yin no//
translated: Although the actions of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas arise free from signs, they are not immeasurable because they do not have the activity of working for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de'i 'og tu tshad med pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir spyod pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshad med pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir spyod pa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: After that, in order to demonstrate the superiority of this bodhisattva stage over the other bodhisattva stages, the perfection of the practice of the practice and the perfection of the purification by the completion of the practice and the perfection of the illumination by the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas are taught.

original: rgyal po'i bu'i dpes ni sa 'di yang dag par 'das pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu'i dpes ni sa 'di yang dag par 'das pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: The example of the prince demonstrates the superiority of this stage over the other stages.

original: sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mthar thug ba'i yid la byed pa la gnas pa'i phyir rang gi yul shes pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyor ba'i mthar thug ba'i yid la byed pa la gnas pa'i phyir rang gi yul shes pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is situated in the knowledge of his own domain because he is situated in the final mental attention of the completion of the practice of the practice.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva Vimuktasena says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang yid kyi lus tshad med pa yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag dang yid kyi lus tshad med pa yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin nam /
translated: O son of the victors, is it not the case that the bodhisattva who is on the first bodhisattva stage has an immeasurable body, speech, and mind that transcends the conduct of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de lta yang yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de lta yang yin te /
translated: O son of the victors, it is so.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i che ba nyid kyis gyur du zad kyis /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i che ba nyid kyis gyur du zad kyis /
translated: That is due to the greatness of his special focus on the qualities of the Buddha,

original: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of his own intellectual analysis.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i spyod yul rnam par dpyod pa thob pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i spyod yul rnam par dpyod pa thob pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: On this seventh bodhisattva stage, however, the bodhisattva has attained the domain of his own intellect‚Äôs analysis, and therefore he is not surpassed by any of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: O son of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu'i rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i bu'i rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
translated: For example, a prince born into a royal family, who has the marks of a king, outshines the entire assembly of ministers by the power of the king,

original: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the power of his own intellect.

original: nam de nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam de nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he has grown up,

original: rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas blon po'i bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i stobs bskyed pas blon po'i bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
translated: then by the power of his own intellect he surpasses all the activities of the ministers.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /üîΩrang gi blos @216a * //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi / rang gi blos @216a * //
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors, in the same way, as soon as the bodhisattva has produced the thought, he outshines all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and solitary buddhas by the greatness of his superior intention,

original: rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the power of his own intellect.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul shes pa la gnas pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul shes pa la gnas pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bya ba las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, the Far-¬≠Reaching, is established in the knowledge of his own domain and so has gone far beyond the activities of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lus kyi las la sogs pa tshad med pa smos pa des na mang ba nyid kyis tshad med par ma zad kyi mthus kyang tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bye brag tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi las la sogs pa tshad med pa smos pa des na mang ba nyid kyis tshad med par ma zad kyi mthus kyang tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bye brag tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: The above passage mentions the bodhisattva‚Äôs immeasurable physical activities and so on. This is to distinguish them as immeasurable not only in quantity but also in power.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: O son of the victors, when the bodhisattva is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, the Far-¬≠Reaching,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben pa rgyu ba med pa yang thob pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben pa rgyu ba med pa yang thob pa yin te /
translated: he attains the profound, secluded, and inactive activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: gong du yongs su tshol ba'i brtson pa yang mi gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gong du yongs su tshol ba'i brtson pa yang mi gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: But he does not give up the effort to seek further.

original: de la ring du song ba'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de la ring du song ba'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: It is profound because it has gone far.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir dben pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir dben pa'o //
translated: It is isolated because it eliminates the obscurations that are incompatible with that.

original: de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; 'jig rten pa'i sa la mi rgyu ba'i phyir rgyu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; 'jig rten pa'i sa la mi rgyu ba'i phyir rgyu ba med pa'o //
translated: It is without movement because it does not move to other supramundane and mundane levels.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las de'i mtshan ma dang bral yang de lta bu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi las de'i mtshan ma dang bral yang de lta bu yang ma yin la /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are free from the signs of that karma, but they are not like that.

original: gong du yongs su mi tshol bas /
analyzed: gong du yongs su mi tshol bas /
translated: They do not seek higher,

original: de tsam la gnas par yang zad do //
analyzed: de tsam la gnas par yang zad do //
translated: and so they remain at that level.

original: de ltar sa las yang dag par 'das pas zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa las yang dag par 'das pas zung du 'brel ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the result of the path of union through transcending the levels,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir srid pa mi gtong bas gnas pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir srid pa mi gtong bas gnas pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: in order to teach the distinctive abiding, since they abide in the limit of reality and do not actualize cessation, they do not abandon existence.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: For that reason, the bodhisattva Vimukti candra said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: O son of the victors, from which bodhisattva stage onward do bodhisattvas enter into the absorption of cessation?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha replied, O son of the victors, from the sixth bodhisattva stage onward bodhisattvas enter into the absorption of cessation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage enters into the absorption of cessation in every instant of mind.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: However, it is not said that he actualizes cessation.

original: des na de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: des na de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Therefore, he is said to possess inconceivable physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: @216b kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi bya'o //
analyzed: @216b kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi bya'o //
translated: O son of the victors, in this way, the bodhisattva who abides in the limit of reality does not abide and does not actualize cessation.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig rgya mtsho chen po'i gru chen por zhugs te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig rgya mtsho chen po'i gru chen por zhugs te /
translated: O son of the victors, it is like this: for example, a man who has boarded a great ship on the great ocean

original: rgal ba'i thabs la mkhas pas rlung la mkhas pa dang / chu la mkhas pa ni rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i nyes pas mi gos so //
analyzed: rgal ba'i thabs la mkhas pas rlung la mkhas pa dang / chu la mkhas pa ni rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i nyes pas mi gos so //
translated: and who is skilled in the means of crossing, skilled in the wind, and skilled in the water is not affected by the faults of the water of the great ocean.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i grur zhugs pa yang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa'i grur zhugs pa yang /
translated: O son of the victors, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, having boarded the ship of the perfections,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: while abiding in the limit of reality, does not abide and does not actualize cessation.

original: de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the distinctive features of the attainment of meditative equipoise,

original: sbyor ba gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa rnam par brgyad kyis rgyu ba thob pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyen po yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa rnam par brgyad kyis rgyu ba thob pa'i gnas pa'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The special state of progress in attainment is shown by the eight kinds of application, which are accompanied by the remedy.

original: sbyor ba rnam pa brgyad la de 'khor ba'i sgo yin bas bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam pa brgyad la de 'khor ba'i sgo yin bas bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application of the accumulation of merit, because of which

original: de ltar ye shes thob pa de ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi stobs bsgom pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir blo dang thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs skyed pa chen pos 'khor ba'i sgo yang ston la /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes thob pa de ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi stobs bsgom pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir blo dang thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs skyed pa chen pos 'khor ba'i sgo yang ston la /
translated: the bodhisattva, although he has attained such gnosis, still shows the door of cyclic existence by the great power of his intelligence, means, and wisdom, in order to accomplish the cultivation of the power of concentration and gnosis.

original: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And he has the intention of remaining in nirvana.

original: phung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phung po yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application of the appropriation of the aggregates, because of which

original: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar yang snang la /
analyzed: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar yang snang la /
translated: the bodhisattva appears to be surrounded by a great retinue,

original: rtag par rgyun du shin tu dben pa'i sems thob ba yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du shin tu dben pa'i sems thob ba yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and yet always attains a mind of complete solitude.

original: bsams bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application of deliberately taking on existence is because

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba yang mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba yang mngon par sgrub la /
translated: he accomplishes birth in the three realms through the power of his vows,

original: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and he is not defiled by the faults of the world.üîΩThe application of the family lineage is because, although he has abandoned the entanglements of desire and the latent dispositions of desire,

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal yang spangs la 'khrig pa bsten pa yang ston pas rigs kyi rgyud la sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir ;
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal yang spangs la 'khrig pa bsten pa yang ston pas rigs kyi rgyud la sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir ;
translated: he displays the enjoyment of sexual intercourse.

original: zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yang yin la /
analyzed: zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yang yin la /
translated: He is peaceful and completely peaceful,

original: thabs kyis kyang rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: thabs kyis kyang rab tu 'bar te /
translated: and he is also burning with the fire of passion through skillful means.

original: de ltar 'bar yang tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bar yang tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Although he burns in this way, he is not burned.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application of engagement is because

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la yang yongs su 'jug la /üîΩnyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag @217a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la yang yongs su 'jug la / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dag @217a * //
translated: he engages in the wisdom of the Buddha,

original: kyang 'grub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kyang 'grub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and he accomplishes the states of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: zas dang nyal ba ni bdud kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zas dang nyal ba ni bdud kyi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Food and sleep are the domain of Mara.

original: ston pa la sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi thil du yang son la /
analyzed: ston pa la sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi thil du yang son la /
translated: The application to the teacher is that he has arrived at the domain of the Buddha,

original: bdud kyi yul na 'dug par snang ba yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul na 'dug par snang ba yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but he appears to be in the domain of Mara.

original: bdud kyi yul na ba dang ; rga ba dang 'chi ba 'di gsum ston pas 'chi 'pho'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul na ba dang ; rga ba dang 'chi ba 'di gsum ston pas 'chi 'pho'i sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application to death is that he shows the three: sickness, aging, and death.

original: bdud bzhi'i lam las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i lam las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
translated: He has transcended the path of the four Maras,

original: bdud kyi spyod yul gyi thil du yang ston pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi spyod yul gyi thil du yang ston pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but he appears in the domain of Mara.

original: rnam par bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩlta ba ngan pa la chags pa las rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste / lta ba ngan pa la chags pa las rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The application to the reversal is threefold.

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad na 'dug pa yang snang la /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad na 'dug pa yang snang la /
translated: The reversal from attachment to bad views is that he appears in all the abodes of the tirthikas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mu'i gnas mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mu'i gnas mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but he has the intention of not abandoning the abode of the Buddha.

original: gnod pa las rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa las rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns them away from harm, because

original: 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad dang ldan par yang snang la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad dang ldan par yang snang la /
translated: he appears to be engaged in all worldly activities,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par gzhol ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par gzhol ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but is truly intent on the Dharma which transcends the world.

original: lha la sogs pa dag pas kyang lhag pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pas de dag gi chags pa rnam par bzlog pas chags pa rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa dag pas kyang lhag pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pas de dag gi chags pa rnam par bzlog pas chags pa rnam par bzlog pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: He turns them away from attachment, because he has a body which is superior to that of the gods, etc., and so he turns them away from their attachments.

original: lha dang ; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad las lhag pa'i bkod pa rnam par sgrub pa yang thob la /
analyzed: lha dang ; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad las lhag pa'i bkod pa rnam par sgrub pa yang thob la /
translated: He has attained the power to create arrays which surpass those of all the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, demigods, garudas, kinnaras, and human and nonhuman beings, as well as those of Indra, Brahma, and the world guardians.

original: chos la dga' ba yid la bya ba yang mi spong ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba yid la bya ba yang mi spong ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He never abandons the mental activity of delight in the Dharma.

original: bstan pa 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: And he becomes a holder of the teaching, because the practice of application is perfected.

original: slob dpon du grags pas de 'dzin pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon du grags pas de 'dzin pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the best holder of the teaching, because he is renowned as a master.

original: sa 'di ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / chos kyi bzod pas rab tu phye bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'di ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / chos kyi bzod pas rab tu phye bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This stage should be known as distinguished by the benefit of sentient beings and by the acceptance of the Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang ches sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang ches sems can la phan 'dogs pa dang / chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because on this stage the bodhisattva's benefit of sentient beings and his pure acceptance of the Dharma become greater than before.

original: sa 'di ni sbyor ba'i mthar phyin par 'gro bas ring du song ba zhes bya'o //üîΩgser gyi sa le sbram rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa'i dpes ni @217b byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba'i lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas /
analyzed: sa 'di ni sbyor ba'i mthar phyin par 'gro bas ring du song ba zhes bya'o // gser gyi sa le sbram rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa'i dpes ni @217b byang chub kyi phyogs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba'i lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas /
translated: This stage is called Gone Afar because it goes far by finishing the practice.

original: sa 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shin tu 'od gsal bar yongs su ston te /
analyzed: sa 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shin tu 'od gsal bar yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of gold ornamented with jewels shows that the roots of virtue of this stage are very bright, because all the practices such as the elements leading to enlightenment are perfected.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid rin po che thams cad kyis spras na de bas shin tu bzang zhing 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid rin po che thams cad kyis spras na de bas shin tu bzang zhing 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: when that very refined gold is adorned with all the jewels, it becomes even more excellent and radiant.

original: de ma yin pa'i rgyan gyi rnam pa gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa de'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa de dag kyang de bas ches shin tu rab tu
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rgyan gyi rnam pa gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro // kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa de'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par sgrub pa de dag kyang de bas ches shin tu rab tu
translated: It cannot be surpassed by any other kind of ornament.

original: byang ba dang / shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang ba dang / shin tu 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: O sons of the victors, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage, Gone Far, are even more purified and radiant through being created by wisdom and skillful means.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They cannot be surpassed by those of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyi dpes ni snga ma bzhin du khyad par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyi dpes ni snga ma bzhin du khyad par yongs su ston te /
translated: The example of the light of the sun shows the excellence as before.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od ni skar ma'i tshogs thams cad dang / zla ba'i 'od rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od ni skar ma'i tshogs thams cad dang / zla ba'i 'od rnams kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: The light of the sun is not outshone by the light of the hosts of stars and the light of the moon.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling na rlan gyi bag yod pa thams cad kyang shin tu skem par byed do //üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling na rlan gyi bag yod pa thams cad kyang shin tu skem par byed do // kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang /
translated: And it dries up all the moisture that exists in the world.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing /
translated: O sons of the victors, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this bodhisattva bh≈´mi Gone Far are not outshone by all the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa yang yongs su skems so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa yang yongs su skems so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And they dry up the turbidity of the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: lhag ma snga ma'i tshul bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma snga ma'i tshul bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be applied in the same way as before.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: The explanation of the seventh bh≈´mi is complete.

original: sa brgyad pa ni yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sa bsdu ba dang / rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa thob pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / dbang thob pa dang che ba nyid kyi khyad par dang /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sa bsdu ba dang / rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa thob pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / dbang thob pa dang che ba nyid kyi khyad par dang /
translated: The eighth level is the level of engaging in the process of refinement, for it is the level of the attainment of the acceptance that phenomena are not produced and the attainment of the distinctive states of patient acceptance and the distinctive states of patient acceptance that are related to the level of buddhahood.

original: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa bdun gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa bdun gyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the eighth level is presented in terms of seven topics: the level of engaging in the process of refinement, the attainment of acceptance, the attainment of a distinctive state of patient acceptance, the purification of a buddhafield, the attainment of controlling power, the distinctive feature of greatness, the distinctive feature of preeminence, the distinctive feature of supremacy and the distinctive feature of the absence of pride.

original: de la yongs su sbyang ba bya ba'i sa bsdu ba ni spyi dang so so nas sa bdun @218a * //
analyzed: de la yongs su sbyang ba bya ba'i sa bsdu ba ni spyi dang so so nas sa bdun @218a * //
translated: The level of engaging in the process of refinement is subsumed by the seven levels that are to be refined.

original: bsdus pa'o // spyir bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsdus pa'o // spyir bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it subsumed in general?

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis gong nas gong du rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab kyis mi gnas pa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba dang / sbyor bas bsdus pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis gong nas gong du rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab kyis mi gnas pa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba dang / sbyor bas bsdus pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: It is subsumed in the following four aspects: the superior realization of the two kinds of absence of self, the purification of the path of nonabiding through the wisdom that is supported by the means for attaining that realization, the completion of the accumulations that are subsumed by the application and the purification of the obscurations that are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la rnam par dbye ba legs par byas pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la rnam par dbye ba legs par byas pa /
translated: For what reason, O sons of the Victor, is the bodhisattva on the seven bodhisattva stages called one who has well prepared the analysis,

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi lam shin tu yongs su sbyongs pa /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi lam shin tu yongs su sbyongs pa /
translated: one who has well purified the path of wisdom and means,

original: tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: one who has well accumulated the collections?

original: so so nas bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: so so nas bsdu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the individual summary?

original: sa dang po la sogs pa la smon lam shin tu btab pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa la smon lam shin tu btab pa la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: On the first stage and so on, he has well made aspirational prayers and so forth, for which reason

original: smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he is called one who has well made great aspirational prayers.

original: de la sa gnyis pa la ni de lta bas na bdag gis sa rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing /
analyzed: de la sa gnyis pa la ni de lta bas na bdag gis sa rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing /
translated: On the second stage, he thinks, Therefore, I will strive to purify and accomplish all the stages.

original: mngon par sgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba skabs 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba skabs 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs su rig par bya ste /
translated: In this context, one should understand that he is empowered by the Tathagata,

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis shin tu brlabs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis shin tu brlabs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: for which reason he is called one who is well empowered by the Tathagata.

original: sa gsum pa la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba las mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa gsum pa la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba las mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: On the third level, they attain the meditative concentrations and so forth that are free of attachment and do not degenerate.

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs bskyed pa rjes su thob pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs bskyed pa rjes su thob pa ste /
translated: They attain the enhancement of their own roots of virtue.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa rjes su thob pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa rjes su thob pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why it is said that they attain the enhancement of their own roots of virtue.

original: sa bzhi pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos ston pas shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yid la byed pa dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos ston pas shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yid la byed pa dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: On the fourth level, they are intent on the qualities of buddhahood, because they teach the Dharma that is classified in terms of the topics of the aggregates, sense spheres, senses-and-fields and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why it is said that they are intent on the powers, fearlessnesses and the distinctive qualities of the buddhas.

original: lnga pa la ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dag gi bsam pa la sogs pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dag gi bsam pa la sogs pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: On the fifth level, they should be known as being thoroughly trained in the attitude of sameness of mind with regard to purity and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i brang pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i brang pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the purification of the breast of superior intention, it is said here.

original: sa drug pa la ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / dbang byed pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par spyod pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi @218b stobs kyis mngon par 'phags pa de nyid gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang / dbang byed pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par spyod pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi @218b stobs kyis mngon par 'phags pa de nyid gang gi phyir /
translated: On the sixth ground, because of the preeminence of great compassion, the mastery, and the practice of dependent origination, the power of merit and wisdom is exalted.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis mngon par 'phags pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis mngon par 'phags pa zhes 'dir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the preeminence of the power of merit and wisdom, it is said here.

original: sa bdun pa la ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par rnams kyis sems can rnams la sbyor ba mi gtong ba nyid de /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par rnams kyis sems can rnams la sbyor ba mi gtong ba nyid de /
translated: On the seventh ground, because of the special practice of other paths, the application to sentient beings is never relinquished.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje dang byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad la sbyor ba mi gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje dang byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad la sbyor ba mi gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the non-relinquishment of application to all sentient beings through great compassion and great love, it is said here.

original: sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that they have immeasurable paths of wisdom in relation to the immeasurable realms of sentient beings and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa de zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa de zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because they have immeasurable paths of wisdom, they are said to be endowed with immeasurable paths of wisdom.

original: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sa bsdus pa rnam par gzhag pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i sa bsdus pa rnam par gzhag pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus presented the eighth stage as the stage of thorough preparation,

original: rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa thob pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa thob pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su ston te /
translated: he presents the stage of obtaining pure acceptance.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains pure acceptance through obtaining the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: de rnam par dag pa nyid lhun gyis grub par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa nyid lhun gyis grub par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that very purity to be spontaneous.

original: bzod pa de yang mi skye ba rnam pa bzhi la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de yang mi skye ba rnam pa bzhi la rig par bya'o //
translated: That acceptance should be understood as fourfold in relation to the nonarising of phenomena.

original: mi skye ba rnam pa bzhi ni yod pa mi skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye ba dang / grangs kyi bye brag mi skye ba dang / las kyi bye brag mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba rnam pa bzhi ni yod pa mi skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mi skye ba dang / grangs kyi bye brag mi skye ba dang / las kyi bye brag mi skye ba'o //
translated: The four kinds of non-production are: non-production of what exists, non-production by intrinsic nature, non-production of a particular number, and non-production of a particular action.

original: de la yod pa mi skye ba ni rnam pa bdun mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa mi skye ba ni rnam pa bdun mi skye ba ste /
translated: Non-production of what exists is the non-production of the seven kinds of existence.üîΩThe seven kinds of existence are: the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of purification, the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of defilement, the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of both, the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of neither, the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of the past, the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of the future, and the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of the present.

original: yod pa rnam pa bdun la rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la chos rnam pa snga nas yod pa de'i gnyen por chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa rnam pa bdun la rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la chos rnam pa snga nas yod pa de'i gnyen por chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of purification is the entry into the non-production of all dharmas from the beginning.

original: gsar du skye ba de'i gnyen por ma skyes pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩmtshan nyid yod pa de'i gnyen por mtshan med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gsar du skye ba de'i gnyen por ma skyes pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // mtshan nyid yod pa de'i gnyen por mtshan med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of defilement is the entry into the non-production of what is newly produced.üîΩThe antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of both is the entry into the non-production of what is produced and not produced.üîΩThe antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of neither is the entry into the non-production of what is produced and not produced.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yod pa de'i gnyen por byung ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yod pa de'i gnyen por byung ba med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of the past is the entry into the non-production of what has passed away.üîΩThe antidote to the existence of the Dharma in the aspect of the future is the entry into the non-production of what has not yet arisen.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la sngon gyi mtha' na yod pa de'i gnyen por 'jig pa med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la sngon gyi mtha' na yod pa de'i gnyen por 'jig pa med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: In the case of the side of defilement, the remedy for the existence of a prior limit is the non-existence of cessation.

original: sems can rnams rdzogs pa yod pa de'i gnyen por thug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams rdzogs pa yod pa de'i gnyen por thug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: In the case of the existence of a final limit for sentient beings, the remedy is the non-existence of a final limit.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid yod pa de'i gnyen por 'jug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid yod pa de'i gnyen por 'jug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the case of the side of purification, the remedy for the existence of defilement is the non-existence of engagement.

original: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of intrinsic reality is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de na bdag med pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de na bdag med pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That is the nature of selflessness.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces @219a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces @219a * //
translated: Because of the statement: ‚Äúthe nature of the non-existence of things,‚Äù

original: gsungs pa'o // bzod pa 'di ni de la dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // bzod pa 'di ni de la dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: this patience is not the object of the non-existence of things, because it is the object of that.

original: bdag med pa ni gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because selflessness is the characteristic of non-duality.

original: grangs kyi bye brag mi skye ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dus gsum du 'bri ba'am 'phel ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grangs kyi bye brag mi skye ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dus gsum du 'bri ba'am 'phel ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-production of the particularities of number is because the phenomena of defilement and purification are neither diminished nor increased in the three times.

original: gang gi phyir thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma mnyam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, The equality of beginning, middle, and end.

original: las kyi bye brag mi skye ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tha dad du bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi bye brag mi skye ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tha dad du bya ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-production of the particularities of action is because, just as suchness is pure, the wisdom of the Buddha is not differentiated.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs par bya ba nyid las brtsams nas 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs par bya ba nyid las brtsams nas 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, Just as with suchness, one should begin with the realization of the non-conceptual wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i dmigs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i dmigs pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the object of the acceptance of the non-production of phenomena,

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rlom sems dang / yul rnam par rig pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'du shes dang bral bas 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rlom sems dang / yul rnam par rig pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'du shes dang bral bas 'jug pa ston te /
translated: it shows the engagement free from the discriminations that are the nature of the concepts included in karmic maturation, conceit, and the cognition of objects.

original: gang gi phyir de thams cad du sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes dang bral zhing zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de thams cad du sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes dang bral zhing zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he is free from the discriminations of mind, mentality, and consciousness, and of conceptualization.

original: 'du shes smos pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du shes smos pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of discrimination is for the sake of negating the discriminations of the counteragent,

original: gnyen po'i 'du shes de la yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i 'du shes de la yod pa'o //
translated: because the discrimination of the counteragent is present there.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum gyis sa 'og ma las khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum gyis sa 'og ma las khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: It is superior to the lower stages in three ways:

original: lhun gyis grub pas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir thogs pa med ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir thogs pa med ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is superior by spontaneity, because it is unimpeded.

original: khyab pas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir nam mkha' 'dra zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir nam mkha' 'dra zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is superior by pervasiveness, because it is like space.

original: rang gi ngang gis de bzhin nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir mi g-yo bas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis de bzhin nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir mi g-yo bas khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is superior by stability, because it is unshakable, being naturally engaged in reality.

original: bla gab med pa'i rang bzhin du zhugs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa'i rang bzhin du zhugs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: By entering into the nature of the open sky, one is said to attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa brgyad pa'i rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa 'thob pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the establishment of attaining the acceptance of purity on the eighth ground,

original: gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ston to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ston to //
translated: the attainment of the distinctive abode is taught.

original: de la gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ni gnas pa zab mo thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i khyad par 'thob pa ni gnas pa zab mo thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the distinctive abode is the attainment of the profound abode.

original: de ni zab pa nyid rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste //
analyzed: de ni zab pa nyid rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste //
translated: That should be known as having seven profundities.

original: ring ba'i sa la 'jug pas zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ring ba'i sa la 'jug pas zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The profundity of engaging the distant ground is stated thus:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i @219b byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa zab mo ring ba'i ye shes zhes gsungs pa'o //
