analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i @219b byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa zab mo ring ba'i ye shes zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who possesses such acceptance, as soon as he attains the bodhisattva ground Immovable, enters the bodhisattva abode called Profound Wisdom, which is distant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dag pa pa rnams dang / thun mong ba'i zab ba nyid ni gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩgzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med par gyur pas yul zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /üîΩmtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa ngan pa thams cad las phyir log pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dag pa pa rnams dang / thun mong ba'i zab ba nyid ni gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa zhes gsungs pa'o // gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba med par gyur pas yul zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa ngan pa thams cad las phyir log pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The profundity that is shared with the bodhisattvas who are on the pure stages is indicated by the fact that it is not differentiated.üîΩThe profundity of the object is due to the fact that there is no appearance of subject and object, as indicated by the fact that it is free from all signs.üîΩThe profundity of the object is due to the fact that there is no appearance of subject and object, as indicated by the fact that it is free from all signs.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes dgag pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ngan pa smos so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes dgag pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ngan pa smos so //
translated: The profundity of the object is due to the fact that there is no appearance of subject and object, as indicated by the fact that it is free from all signs.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas sgrub pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir tshad med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩzil gyis mi gnon pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pas sgrub pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir tshad med pa zhes gsungs pa'o // zil gyis mi gnon pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The profundity of practice is due to the fact that it is engaged in the benefit of self and other, as indicated by the fact that it is immeasurable.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The profundity of invincibility is indicated by the fact that it is not overcome by any of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs srab pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir dben pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs srab pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir dben pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The profundity of the thinness of adverse elements is taught by the word ‚Äúisolated.‚Äù

original: gnyen po la mngon du phyogs pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po la mngon du phyogs pa zab pa nyid ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The profundity of the orientation toward the antidote is taught by the word ‚Äúrealization.‚Äù

original: thams cad las dben pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad las dben pa mngon du gyur pa rjes su thob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú One attains the realization of the isolation of everything.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad las dben pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni thams cad las dben pa'o //
translated: Thusness is the isolation of everything.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dpes ni gnas pa de'i zhi ba nyid yongs su ston te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dpes ni gnas pa de'i zhi ba nyid yongs su ston te /
translated: The profundity of the peacefulness of that state is taught by the example of the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na dge slong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na dge slong rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚Äú O sons of the victors, it is thus. For example, a bhik·π£u who has the supernormal cognitive power of magical abilities,

original: sems kyi dbang mchog thob pa mthar gyi sa dgu pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni g-yo ba dang / rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang mchog thob pa mthar gyi sa dgu pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni g-yo ba dang / rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba yin no //
translated: who has attained the mastery of mind, who has entered the ninth stage of meditative absorption, and who has entered the meditative absorption of cessation is free from all movement and conceit.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba 'di thob ma thag tu 'bad pa thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba 'di thob ma thag tu 'bad pa thams cad dang bral te /
translated: O children of the Victor, in the same way, as soon as the bodhisattva has attained this eighth bodhisattva stage, the immovable, he is free from all effort.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi rtsol ba dang bral nas rnam par smin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi rtsol ba dang bral nas rnam par smin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He has attained the nature of spontaneity, and is free from the exertion of body, speech, and mind, and abides in the state of evolutionary maturity.

original: de la g-yo ba dang rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba ni de dag gi gnas sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la g-yo ba dang rlom sems thams cad dang bral ba ni de dag gi gnas sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, being free from all movement and conceit is due to the absence of mind in that state.

original: 'bad pa thams cad dang bral ba ni 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhun gyis grub pa'i @220a * //
analyzed: 'bad pa thams cad dang bral ba ni 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro // lhun gyis grub pa'i @220a * //
translated: Being free from all effort is due to his transcendence of the stage of effort.

original: chos nyid thob pa ni de'i gnyen po rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid thob pa ni de'i gnyen po rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having attained the nature of spontaneity is due to his acquisition of its antidote.

original: da ni lhun gyis grub cing rtsol ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa las gnas pa nyid kyi lhun gyis grub pa'i chos 'thob pa de yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: da ni lhun gyis grub cing rtsol ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa las gnas pa nyid kyi lhun gyis grub pa'i chos 'thob pa de yang dag par ston te /
translated: Now, the attainment of the spontaneously accomplished qualities, which are spontaneously accomplished because they are effortless and because they are based on evolution, is correctly taught.

original: rtsol ba dang mi mthun pa'i gnas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang mi mthun pa'i gnas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has attained a state that is incompatible with effort.

original: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la shin tu gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la shin tu gnas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The quality of being based on evolution should be understood as being based on the suchness of the store consciousness.

original: gnyid kyis log pa las dpa'i dpas ni gnas pa 'di la 'du shes 'gog pa'i nyes pa sel to //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa las dpa'i dpas ni gnas pa 'di la 'du shes 'gog pa'i nyes pa sel to //
translated: The example of a person who is awakened from sleep removes the fault of the cessation of ideation in this state.

original: 'du shes yod du zin kyang bzod pa de ni de kho na shes pa dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: 'du shes yod du zin kyang bzod pa de ni de kho na shes pa dang ldan par ston to //
translated: Even though ideation exists, it shows that this patience is endowed with the knowledge of reality.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the conqueror, it is thus.

original: dper na mi zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na bdag chu bo chen pos khyer ba snyam byed la /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na bdag chu bo chen pos khyer ba snyam byed la /
translated: For example, a person who is asleep and dreaming dreams that he is carried away by a great river.

original: de de nas ci phyin du 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsol rtsol ba las /
analyzed: de de nas ci phyin du 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsol rtsol ba las /
translated: Then, after that, through great effort and exertion,

original: de 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po de nyid kyis sad na sad ma thag tu 'bad cing rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po de nyid kyis sad na sad ma thag tu 'bad cing rtsol ba thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he awakens. As soon as he awakens, he is free from all effort and exertion.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can gyi tshogs chu bo chen po bzhis khyer bar shes nas 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsom mo //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can gyi tshogs chu bo chen po bzhis khyer bar shes nas 'bad cing rtsol ba chen po rtsom mo //
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the victors, in the same way, the bodhisattva, seeing that the mass of sentient beings is carried away by the four great rivers, undertakes great effort and exertion.

original: de brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu 'bad pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus chen po brtsams pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu 'bad pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through undertaking great effort and exertion, as soon as he attains the bodhisattva ground Immovable, he is free from all effort.

original: de'i gnyis su kun du spyod pa dang / mtshan ma kun du spyod pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyis su kun du spyod pa dang / mtshan ma kun du spyod pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: All his dualistic activity and all his activity with signs completely disappear.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of purity,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su kun du spyod pa dang / yul la yongs su spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshan ma kun du spyod pa snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su kun du spyod pa dang / yul la yongs su spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas mtshan ma kun du spyod pa snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-appearance of the practice of signs is considered in terms of the practice of cyclic existence and nirvana, and the practice of objects.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i dpes ni sa 'og ma'i de dag kun du mi 'byung bas rnam par smin pa thob ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i dpes ni sa 'og ma'i de dag kun du mi 'byung bas rnam par smin pa thob ste /
translated: The example of birth in the Brahma world shows that the lower levels do not occur, and so the result of evolution is obtained.

original: rgyang ring bas khyad par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rgyang ring bas khyad par yongs su ston te /
translated: The distance shows the difference.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes shing gnas pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes shing gnas pa la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, the afflictions of the desire realm do not occur for one born and dwelling in the Brahma world.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems @220b dpa'i sa la yang sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa kun du 'byung ba yang kun du mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems @220b dpa'i sa la yang sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa kun du 'byung ba yang kun du mi 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious One, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva ground Immovable has no arising of mind, thought, or consciousness.

original: de sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: He has no arising of a buddha,

original: byang chub la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of bodhisattva conduct,

original: rang sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of a solitary buddha,

original: nyan thos la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: nyan thos la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of a ≈õrƒÅvaka,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la kun du 'byung ba'am /üîΩdgra bcom pa la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la kun du 'byung ba'am / dgra bcom pa la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of nirvƒÅ·πáa,üîΩno arising of an arhat,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of a non-returner,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: no arising of a once-returner,

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyang kun du mi 'byung na /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la kun du 'byung ba thams cad kyang kun du mi 'byung na /
translated: and no arising of a stream enterer.

original: 'jig rten pa la kun du 'byung ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la kun du 'byung ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention the worldly?

original: de la 'jug pa dang / log pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro//üîΩsangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag dang / theg pa chen po la yang gang zag dang / chos kyi bye brag dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang chos dang /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa dang / log pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro// sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag dang / theg pa chen po la yang gang zag dang / chos kyi bye brag dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang chos dang /
translated: In this regard, the non-occurrence of mind, etc. in the sphere of engagement and the sphere of the opposite, and the non-occurrence of the Buddhas, etc.

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i bye brag gis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i bye brag gis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the Buddhas, etc. is taught in terms of the distinctions of the Universal Vehicle and the Sravaka Vehicle, and in terms of the distinctions of the individual and the teaching in the Universal Vehicle, and in terms of the distinctions of the teaching and the training and the post-training in the Sravaka Vehicle.üîΩIn this regard, the non-occurrence of mind, etc. in the sphere of engagement and the sphere of the opposite, and the non-occurrence of the Buddhas, etc.

original: de la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med ces bya ba de la 'jug pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba med pa ni gang gi phyir sems dang /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med ces bya ba de la 'jug pa'i phyogs la sems la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba med pa ni gang gi phyir sems dang /
translated: In this regard, the non-occurrence of mind, etc. in the sphere of engagement is because of the non-existence of mind, etc. in the sphere of engagement.

original: yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i kun du 'byung ba kun du mi 'byung ste zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩlog pa'i phyogs la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med pa ni sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i kun du 'byung ba kun du mi 'byung ste zhes gsungs pa'o // log pa'i phyogs la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba med pa ni sangs rgyas la kun du 'byung ba'am zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and the arising of the mind and consciousness do not arise.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la kun du 'byung ba yang kun du mi 'byung na zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la kun du 'byung ba yang kun du mi 'byung na zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: As for the perversions, the non-arising of the Buddhas, etc. is stated beginning with ‚Äúthe arising of the Buddha‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthe arising of the Stream-enterer.‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag de la theg pa chen po'i bye brag ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod ba la kun du 'byung ba rnams so //üîΩnyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag ni nyan thos dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dgra bcom @221a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag de la theg pa chen po'i bye brag ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod ba la kun du 'byung ba rnams so // nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag ni nyan thos dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dgra bcom @221a * //
translated: The difference between the Great Vehicle and the Disciple‚Äôs Vehicle is that the Great Vehicle is the arising of the Buddha, the arising of Awakening, the arising of the Bodhisattva, and the arising of the Bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life.

original: pa la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Disciple‚Äôs Vehicle is the arising of the Disciple, the arising of the Solitary Buddha, the arising of the Arhat, and so on.

original: theg pa chen po la gang zag gi bye brag ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la gang zag gi bye brag ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the Great Vehicle, the distinctions of persons are the Solitary Realizers and the Bodhisattvas.

original: chos kyi bye brag ni byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag ni byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The distinctions of teachings are the enlightenment and the Bodhisattva activities.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag gi bye brag la chos kyi bye brag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag gi bye brag la chos kyi bye brag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the teaching of the Hearers‚Äô Vehicle, the distinctions of persons are the trainees and the non-trainees. The distinctions of teachings are the occurrence of nirvana.

original: mi slob pa'i bye brag ni dgra bcom pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i bye brag ni dgra bcom pa la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The distinction of the non-trainees is the occurrence of the Arhats.

original: slob pa'i bye brag ni phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i bye brag ni phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The distinction of the trainees is the occurrence of the Non-Returners and so forth.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang / chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la gnas pa de la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang / chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la gnas pa de la /
translated: ‚ÄúO children of the Victorious One, in this way, the Bodhisattva who is on this Immovable ground, the seventh Bodhisattva ground, by the power of his previous aspirations and by abiding in the stream of the Dharma door,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas cause them to attain the wisdom of a Tathagata.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal te /üîΩrigs kyi bu legs so legs so sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su thob par bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang bka' stsal te / rigs kyi bu legs so legs so sangs rgyas kyi chos rjes su thob par bya ba la /
translated: They also say this:

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin na 'on kyang gang nged kyi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de khyod la med kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su btsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom shig / bzod pa'i sgo 'di nyid kyang ma dor cig ces bya ba
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin na 'on kyang gang nged kyi stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de khyod la med kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de yongs su btsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom shig / bzod pa'i sgo 'di nyid kyang ma dor cig ces bya ba
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, excellent, excellent! This is the ultimate patience, but you do not have the perfection of the qualities of a Buddha, such as our ten powers and four forms of fearlessness. Therefore, apply yourself to the practice of the perfection of the qualities of a Buddha. Do not abandon this very door of patience.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa 'dis ni de la gnas pas mngon par dga' ba tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa 'dis ni de la gnas pas mngon par dga' ba tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa zlog par mdzad de /
translated: By this attainment of the wisdom of a Tathagata, they turn them away from being satisfied with just the joy of remaining there.

original: byas pa bsngags pa dang / mi byed pa bskul ba dang / de la gnas pa mi 'dor bas sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa ma thob pa thob par byed nus pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad do //
analyzed: byas pa bsngags pa dang / mi byed pa bskul ba dang / de la gnas pa mi 'dor bas sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa ma thob pa thob par byed nus pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad do //
translated: He turns them away in terms of the power to attain what has not been attained, the perfection of the qualities of a Buddha, by praising what has been done, exhorting to do what has not been done, and not abandoning those who abide in that.

original: yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la sems can gyi don bya ba don che ba nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la sems can gyi don bya ba don che ba nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad de /
translated: He turns them away in terms of the great purpose of working for the welfare of sentient beings, for those sentient beings who are afflicted by the side of the householder and the renunciant, by the entanglements, and by the latent tendencies.

original: gang gi phyir rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa thob kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa thob kyang /
translated: Because, son of noble family, you have attained such a liberation of peace,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo ma zhi ba rab tu ma zhi ba nyon mongs pa sna @221b tshogs kun du 'byung bar gyur pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo ba 'di dag la soms shig ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo ma zhi ba rab tu ma zhi ba nyon mongs pa sna @221b tshogs kun du 'byung bar gyur pa rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo ba 'di dag la soms shig ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Think of these childish ordinary beings, who are not peaceful, not very peaceful, who have the arising of various afflictions, who are agitated by various thoughts.

original: de la ma zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: There, not peaceful is the entanglement of afflictions.

original: rab tu ma zhi ba ni de'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi ba ni de'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Not very peaceful is the non-abandonment of their latent tendencies.

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The arising of various afflictions is on the side of householders.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo ba ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis g-yen spyo ba ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs so //
translated: Agitation by various thoughts is on the side of those gone forth.

original: yang smon lam dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang zlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: yang smon lam dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang zlog par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, with regard to the resultlessness of aspirations, the ripening of beings, and the accumulation of wisdom, he also turns them away.

original: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi don thob par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa dran par gyis shig ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi don thob par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa dran par gyis shig ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For what reason? ‚ÄúO son of noble family, you should remember your former aspirations, the benefit of sentient beings to be attained, and the inconceivable door of wisdom.‚Äù

original: yang thun mong ma yin pa'i don du dub pa 'bras bu med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang zlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: yang thun mong ma yin pa'i don du dub pa 'bras bu med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang zlog par mdzad de /
translated: Again, with regard to the uncommon meaning, he turns it back, taking into account the exhaustion of the fruitlessness of effort.

original: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
translated: For what reason? ‚ÄúO son of noble family, this is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Whether the TathƒÅgatas arise or not, this dharma-element abides.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyi tshe rab tu dbye bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyi tshe rab tu dbye bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: By this, the TathƒÅgatas are not the only ones to be distinguished,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid 'di 'thob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid 'di 'thob bo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: but all ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas also attain this nonconceptual intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa las brtsams nas lus tshad med pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de'i nus pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can gyi don mdzad pa las brtsams nas lus tshad med pa la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa de'i nus pa yongs su ston te /
translated: Then, beginning with the performance of benefit for sentient beings, it shows the power of that perfect buddha-dharma through immeasurable bodies and so on.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pa de yang gnas gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod nged kyi lus tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pa de yang gnas gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod nged kyi lus tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: As for the place where that performance of benefit for sentient beings is done, it is said, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, it is because of our immeasurable bodies.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ye shes gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir ye shes tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: As for the performance of benefit for sentient beings by means of which conventional and ultimate wisdoms, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is because of our immeasurable wisdom.‚Äù

original: zhing yongs su dag pa gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩgdul bya'i spyod pa mkhyen pa gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // gdul bya'i spyod pa mkhyen pa gang gis mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: As for the performance of benefit for sentient beings by means of which pure fields, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is because of our immeasurable buddha-fields.‚Äù

original: ye shes mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: As for the performance of benefit for sentient beings by means of which knowledge of the conduct of those to be trained, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is because of our immeasurable accomplishment of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang gis bsdus te mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir 'od kyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bsdus te mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir 'od kyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one who compiled and performed it is the one who is said to have an immeasurable orb of light.üîΩ

original: bshad pa gang gis @222a * //üîΩmdzad pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa gang gis @222a * // mdzad pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The one who has gathered and performed is the one who has taught the immeasurable mandala of light.

original: sgra skad kyi yan lag tshad med pa nyid la ltos te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra skad kyi yan lag tshad med pa nyid la ltos te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one who has taught is the one who has taught the immeasurable branches of speech and sound.

original: khyod kyis kyang de bzhin du mngon par sgrub pa skyed cig ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa de ston to //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang de bzhin du mngon par sgrub pa skyed cig ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa de ston to //
translated: You should also generate such accomplishment, which shows the Tathagatas' activity for the sake of sentient beings.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par yang ston te /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par yang ston te /
translated: Moreover, it shows the special blissful state of the Tathagatas.

original: gang gi phyir rigs kyi bu gang khyod kyis chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i snang ba 'di ni khyod kyi snang ba gcig pur zad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs kyi bu gang khyod kyis chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i snang ba 'di ni khyod kyi snang ba gcig pur zad do //
translated: Son of noble family, this non-conceptual appearance of yours towards all phenomena is your sole appearance.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni chos snang ba'i sgo 'di 'dra ba yongs su mtha' yas par song ba mdzad pa mtha' yas shing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni chos snang ba'i sgo 'di 'dra ba yongs su mtha' yas par song ba mdzad pa mtha' yas shing /
translated: Son of noble family, the tathƒÅgatas have made this kind of Dharma gateway to illumination go to infinity,

original: 'brel pa mtha' yas pa yin gyis de dag thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa skyed cig ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa mtha' yas pa yin gyis de dag thob par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa skyed cig ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: and it is infinite in its activity and infinite in its connections. Therefore, generate the accomplishment that will attain them.

original: de la mtha' yas par gyur pa dag ni sgo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtha' yas par gyur pa dag ni sgo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, they go to infinity because of the different gateways.

original: mdzad pa mtha' yas pa dag ni mdzad pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mdzad pa mtha' yas pa dag ni mdzad pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: They are infinite in their activity because of the different activities.

original: /'brel pa mtha' yas pa dag ni gong nas gong du rten pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'brel pa mtha' yas pa dag ni gong nas gong du rten pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are infinite in their connections because of the different supports that are higher and higher.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can dang chos rab tu dbye ba ji ltar mthong ba rnams la lta ba tsam zhig bya ba'i phyir tshegs chung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can dang chos rab tu dbye ba ji ltar mthong ba rnams la lta ba tsam zhig bya ba'i phyir tshegs chung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zlog par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, in order to see just a little bit of the divisions of world systems, sentient beings, and phenomena, he turns the wheel of Dharma with little difficulty.

original: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod kyis phyogs bcu'i zhing tshad med pa nyid dang / sems can tshad med pa nyid dang / chos rnam par dbye ba tshad med pa nyid la ltos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang rigs kyi bu khyod kyis phyogs bcu'i zhing tshad med pa nyid dang / sems can tshad med pa nyid dang / chos rnam par dbye ba tshad med pa nyid la ltos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of good family, you should consider the immeasurability of the fields in the ten directions, the immeasurability of sentient beings, and the immeasurability of the classifications of phenomena.

original: de dag thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyis shig ces bka' stsal to //üîΩkyi rgyal ba'i sras de ltar sa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo tshad med pa de dag la sogs pa gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' ye shes rnam par
analyzed: de dag thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyis shig ces bka' stsal to // kyi rgyal ba'i sras de ltar sa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo tshad med pa de dag la sogs pa gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' ye shes rnam par
translated: You should understand all of them as they are.‚Äù

original: dbye ba tshad med pas mngon par sgrub pa'i las mngon par sgrub par mdzad do //üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras khyod mos par bya'o //
analyzed: dbye ba tshad med pas mngon par sgrub pa'i las mngon par sgrub par mdzad do // kye rgyal ba'i sras khyod mos par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, O son of the victors, the blessed buddhas cause the bodhisattvas who possess such a stage to accomplish the immeasurable gateways of wisdom, and so forth, by means of which the bodhisattvas accomplish the activity of accomplishing the immeasurable classifications of wisdom.üîΩ‚ÄúO son of the victors, you should have conviction in this.

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: You should understand this.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de la mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams su gzhug pa ma mdzad du zin na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de la mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo rnams su gzhug pa ma mdzad du zin na /
translated: If those Bhagavat Buddhas had not caused that Bodhisattva to enter the doors of realization,

original: de'i de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: he would have attained final Nirvana,

original: sems @222b can thams cad kyi bya ba yang rgyun gcad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems @222b can thams cad kyi bya ba yang rgyun gcad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the activities of all sentient beings would have been interrupted.

original: de la de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i dgos pa ston to //üîΩyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de la skad cig gcig la ye shes kyi las gang mngon par sgrub pa la dang po'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i dgos pa ston to // yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de la skad cig gcig la ye shes kyi las gang mngon par sgrub pa la dang po'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: There, ‚Äúhe would have attained final Nirvana‚Äù shows the purpose of the establishment of gnosis.

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyi rtsom pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i bar gyi rtsom pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: Moreover, those Bhagavat Buddhas cause that Bodhisattva to accomplish the activity of gnosis in one instant, and the previous effort from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the seventh stage does not approach even a hundredth part of that.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //üîΩgrangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / bskrun pa dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe'i bar du yang mi bzod ba de snyed du tshad med pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig 'bum gyi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o // grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / bskrun pa dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe'i bar du yang mi bzod ba de snyed du tshad med pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part, or a ten millionth part, or a thousand millionth part, or a ten thousand millionth part, or a million millionth part, or a hundred thousand million millionth part of it.üîΩIt does not approach even a count, or a fraction, or a comparison, or an example of it.üîΩAnd why?üîΩ

original: 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lus rnam par g-yo ba tshad med pa dang / sgra skad mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang ; ye shes mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang / skye ba mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lus rnam par g-yo ba tshad med pa dang / sgra skad mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang ; ye shes mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang / skye ba mngon par sgrub pa tshad med pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are on this bhumi have immeasurable ways of moving their bodies, immeasurable ways of accomplishing speech, immeasurable ways of accomplishing wisdom, immeasurable ways of accomplishing birth,

original: zhing yongs su dag par bya ba tshad med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba tshad med pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang rim gro bya ba tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshul khong du chud pa tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag par bya ba tshad med pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba tshad med pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang rim gro bya ba tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshul khong du chud pa tshad med pa dang /
translated: immeasurable ways of purifying realms, immeasurable ways of ripening sentient beings, immeasurable ways of making offerings to and serving the buddhas, immeasurable ways of comprehending the way of the Dharma,

original: mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i stobs skyed pa tshad med pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba tshad med pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i stobs skyed pa tshad med pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba tshad med pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: immeasurable ways of generating the power of accomplishing super-knowledge, and immeasurable ways of arranging the ma·πá·∏çala of the retinue. Through these, they accomplish the power of bodhisattva conduct.

original: tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi stobs mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis yang dag par 'grub bo zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi stobs mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis yang dag par 'grub bo zhes bya ba de la /
translated: By means of the immeasurable activities of body, speech, and mind, he accomplishes all the bodhisattva practices by the method of unshakable power.

original: de snyed du tshad med pa'i ye shes mngon par 'grub pa'i las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi khyad par te /üîΩrgyu dang @223a * //
analyzed: de snyed du tshad med pa'i ye shes mngon par 'grub pa'i las nye bar sgrub pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi khyad par te / rgyu dang @223a * //
translated: He accomplishes the activities of immeasurable knowledge to that extent. This is the special cause for taking up the virtues of that stage.

original: bcas par brjod pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: bcas par brjod pa yongs su ston to //
translated: The cause is stated along with the result.

original: grangs dang cha la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o //üîΩrgyu ni gcig dang gcig ni gnyis kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: grangs dang cha la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o // rgyu ni gcig dang gcig ni gnyis kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The explanation of number, part, and so on should be understood as connected.

original: gnyis dang gcig ni gsum gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gnyis dang gcig ni gsum gyi rgyu'o //
translated: One is the cause of two, two is the cause of three,

original: gnyis dang gnyis ni bzhi'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis ni bzhi'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: two is the cause of four, and so on.

original: dper yang mi bzod ces bya ba ni cha gang gis dpag pa'o //
analyzed: dper yang mi bzod ces bya ba ni cha gang gis dpag pa'o //
translated: The phrase not even a fraction refers to the part by which it is measured.

original: lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lus rnams bdag gi lus nyid du mos pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lus rnams bdag gi lus nyid du mos pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite analysis of the body‚Äù is the bodhisattva‚Äôs conviction that all bodies are one‚Äôs own body.

original: sgra skad mngon par sgrub pa la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: sgra skad mngon par sgrub pa la sogs pa yang /
translated: The ‚Äúaccomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the Buddha‚Äôs speech.üîΩThe ‚Äúaccomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.

original: bcu pa 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / tshogs bsags pa dang sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bcu pa 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / tshogs bsags pa dang sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.

original: lus dang ngag la gnas bshad pa gang gis /
analyzed: lus dang ngag la gnas bshad pa gang gis /
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.

original: ye shes la brten pa gang gis /
analyzed: ye shes la brten pa gang gis /
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.

original: skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa gang gis /üîΩzhing gang du /
analyzed: skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa gang gis /üîΩzhing gang du /
translated: The ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of speech‚Äù is the conviction that all sounds are the sound of the Buddha.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the mind‚Äù is the conviction that all beings are enlightened.üîΩThe ‚Äúinfinite accomplishment of the body‚Äù is the conviction that all bodies are the body of

original: sems can gang yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul khong du chud pa gnyis kyis ji ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / ji ltar mngon par shes pa la sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul khong du chud pa gnyis kyis ji ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / ji ltar mngon par shes pa la sgrib pa dang /
translated: The second is the accumulation of merit and wisdom through the two means of bringing sentient beings to full maturity and making offerings and serving the buddhas and the third is the elimination of obscurations to preternatural knowledge.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba ste /
translated: By means of two things, the full maturation of sentient beings and the worship and service of the Buddhas, he accumulates the stores of merit and knowledge, and he purifies the obscurations to the superknowledges and the obscurations to perfect knowledge.

original: 'di thams cad du yang tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad du yang tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las su rig par bya'o //
translated: All of this is to be known as the activity of body, speech, and mind endowed with the immeasurables.

original: mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par sogs pa'o //
translated: By means of the unmoving method, that is, the uninterrupted method, etc.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru bo che ni rgya mtsho chen po la ma thug gi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i gru bo che ni rgya mtsho chen po la ma thug gi bar du ched du bskyod cing 'gro bar bya ba yin te /
translated: O sons of the victors, it is like this: a great ship sailing in the ocean is to be rowed with effort until it reaches the ocean current,

original: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod nas ched du bskyod mi dgos par 'gro ste des na rgya mtsho chen po la nyin gcig gis ci chod pa de ni sngon ched du bskyod cing 'gro bas /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po la zhen ma thag tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod nas ched du bskyod mi dgos par 'gro ste des na rgya mtsho chen po la nyin gcig gis ci chod pa de ni sngon ched du bskyod cing 'gro bas /
translated: As soon as they enter the great ocean, they are carried by the wind and do not need to be propelled, so they travel without effort. The distance they cover in a day on the great ocean is greater than the distance they previously covered in a month when they traveled with great effort.

original: lo brgyar yang de srid du tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
analyzed: lo brgyar yang de srid du tshad med par phyin par mi nus so //
translated: As soon as it enters the great ocean, it is moved by the circle of wind and goes without having to make a special effort. Therefore, in one day it goes as far as the great ocean as it could not go in a hundred years by making a special effort.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa /
translated: ‚ÄúO son of the victors, in the same way, the bodhisattva who has accumulated the great collection of roots of virtue

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par sgrub pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtsho chen por phyin nas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par sgrub pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtsho chen por phyin nas /
translated: and has correctly accomplished the Great Vehicle, once he has entered the great ocean of bodhisattva conduct,

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis yud @223b tsam cig la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ji tsam gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyi bskal ba 'bum du yang de snyed du dpag tu med pa gnod par mi nus so zhes bya
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis yud @223b tsam cig la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ji tsam gnon pa de ni sngon gyi ched du bya ba'i las kyi bskal ba 'bum du yang de snyed du dpag tu med pa gnod par mi nus so zhes bya
translated: in one instant, through effortless wisdom, he can reach the wisdom of omniscience to a degree that cannot be reached in a hundred thousand eons of previous purposeful activity.‚Äù

original: ba'i gru bo che'i dpes ni gnas pa de'i mngon par shes pa myur ba'i rgyu nyid kyi khyad par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: ba'i gru bo che'i dpes ni gnas pa de'i mngon par shes pa myur ba'i rgyu nyid kyi khyad par yongs su ston to //
translated: The example of the great ship shows the special quality of the swiftness of his superknowledges.

original: dge pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba ni sa bdun po rnams kyis theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: dge pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba ni sa bdun po rnams kyis theg pa chen po yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having accumulated the great collection of roots of virtue refers to the accomplishment of the Great Vehicle by means of the seven stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa'o /
translated: The phrase having reached the ocean of the bodhisattva's way of life refers to the eighth stage.

original: // / de ltar gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas sa brgyad ba rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar gnas pa'i khyad par thob pas sa brgyad ba rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Having thus presented the eighth stage by means of the attainment of special stations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pas rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pas rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: he presents it by means of the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag bar byed pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang / ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag bar byed pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang / ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbang ba'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: Therein, the purification of the Buddha-field consists in the application to the mastery of the receptacle world, the application to the mastery of the world of sentient beings, the application to the mastery of the complete clear knowledge of gnosis, and the application to the mastery of action.

original: dbang ba'i sbyor ba rnam la gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ba'i sbyor ba rnam la gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Mastery is to be understood in terms of three kinds of mastery:

original: de la snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Mastery over the world-receptacle is fivefold:

original: gang 'dod pa de kun du ston pa'am /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de kun du ston pa'am /
translated: one can make it appear as one wishes;

original: mi snang bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mi snang bar byed pa'am /
translated: one can make it disappear;

original: ci 'dra bar 'dod pa de 'dra ba ston pa dang / dus ji srid du 'dod pa dus de srid du ston pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa dang / ji snyed 'dod pa de srid ston pa ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar 'dod pa de 'dra ba ston pa dang / dus ji srid du 'dod pa dus de srid du ston pa dang / bsdus pa dang rgyas pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa dang / ji snyed 'dod pa de srid ston pa ste /
translated: one can make it appear as one wishes, just as one imagines it; one can make it appear for as long as one wishes; one can make it appear as one wishes, either condensed or extensive; and one can make it appear as one wishes, however much one likes.üîΩO child of the Conqueror, the bodhisattva who has attained the eighth

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni /
translated: bodhisattva stage,üîΩwith his great intelligence, which is spontaneously accomplished throughüîΩhis skill in means, analyzes the gnosis of omniscience and analyzes the

original: thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par sgrub pa lhun gyis grub pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rnam par dpyod cing 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba la yang rnam par dpyod do //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par sgrub pa lhun gyis grub pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rnam par dpyod cing 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba la yang rnam par dpyod do //
translated: arising of the world-receptacle.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa la yang rnam par dpyod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa la yang rnam par dpyod do //
translated: He also analyzes the destruction of the world systems.

original: de 'jig rten ji ltar 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de 'jig rten ji ltar 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows how the world is destroyed.üîΩHe knows how the world is formed.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba la sogs pa shes pa de ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i rnam pa dang po'i sbyor ba ste gang 'dod pa de ston pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba la sogs pa shes pa de ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba'i rnam pa dang po'i sbyor ba ste gang 'dod pa de ston pa'am /
translated: The knowledge of the formation and so on of the world systems is the first aspect of the application of the mastery of the receptacle world.

original: mi snang bar byed ces bya ba de'i'o //üîΩlas sogs pa gang gis 'jig rten 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi snang bar byed ces bya ba de'i'o // las sogs pa gang gis 'jig rten 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He manifests whatever he wishes or he makes it invisible.üîΩHe knows the karma and so on by which the world is destroyed.

original: las zad pa gang gis 'jig @224a * //
analyzed: las zad pa gang gis 'jig @224a * //
translated: He knows the exhaustion of karma by which the world is formed.

original: rten 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / zad pa shes pa ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rten 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / zad pa shes pa ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: And so on. The knowledge of exhaustion is the second.

original: ci 'dra bar 'dod pa de 'dra bar ston to zhes bya ba de'i'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra bar 'dod pa de 'dra bar ston to zhes bya ba de'i'o //
translated: He manifests whatever he wishes.

original: dus ji srid du 'jig rten 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dus ji srid du 'jig rten 'jig pa de yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows for how long the world will be destroyed.

original: dus ji srid du 'jig rten 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so //üîΩ'jig rten zhig nas dus ji srid du gnas pa de yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dus ji srid du 'jig rten 'chags pa de yang rab tu shes so // 'jig rten zhig nas dus ji srid du gnas pa de yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows for how long the world will remain in the process of formation.üîΩHe also knows for how long the world will remain after its destruction.üîΩHe also knows for how long the world will remain in the process of formation.

original: 'jig rten 'chags nas dus ji srid cig tu gnas pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la dus ji srid du 'jig pa la sogs pa shes pa ni gsum pa'i ste /üîΩdus ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du ston to zhes bya ba de'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'chags nas dus ji srid cig tu gnas pa de yang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la dus ji srid du 'jig pa la sogs pa shes pa ni gsum pa'i ste / dus ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du ston to zhes bya ba de'i'o //
translated: He also knows for how long the world will remain after its destruction.

original: de sa'i khams chung bar yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de sa'i khams chung bar yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the earth element to be small.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par che ba yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par che ba yang rab tu shes so //

original: de chu'i khams chung ba yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de chu'i khams chung ba yang rab tu shes so //

analyzed: lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa la mkhas pas skye ba mngon par sgrub pa rnams la blo gtong ste /
