of the bodhisattva is not carried away by them.

original: ye shes mi bzlog pa'i phyir mi bzlog pa'i sa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩzab pa nyid gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir rnyed par dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩspyod pa dang gnas pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir gzhon nu'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes mi bzlog pa'i phyir mi bzlog pa'i sa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩzab pa nyid gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir rnyed par dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩspyod pa dang gnas pa rnam par dag pa ni gang gi phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir gzhon nu'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The antidote to the secondary defilements is the Far-Reaching Stage,

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbang byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it controls the arising of the mind in accordance with its intention, it is called the stage of arising.

original: @230a * // de la spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni bya ba thams cad la nyes pa med pas gzhon nu'i dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: @230a * // de la spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni bya ba thams cad la nyes pa med pas gzhon nu'i dang 'dra'o //
translated: Among these, the purity of practice is like that of a prince, because it is without fault in all activities.

original: gnas pa rnam par dag pa ni bsam pa 'byor pas skye skye ba'i sa la gnas pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa rnam par dag pa ni bsam pa 'byor pas skye skye ba'i sa la gnas pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The purity of abiding is like abiding in the stage of arising, because the intention is fulfilled.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir yang bya ba med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o //üîΩye shes kyis rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir yang bya ba med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o // ye shes kyis rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pa'i phyir /
translated: The distinction of the purity of the conditioned, both mundane and supramundane, is called the stage of completion, because there is no activity beyond that.

original: yongs kyi mthar thug pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs kyi mthar thug pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The stage of culmination is called the stage of culmination because it is the ultimate culmination of the thorough analysis of wisdom.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni ye shes kyis rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pas shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde gnyi ga'i 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni ye shes kyis rnam par dbye ba shin tu byas pas shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro // de gnyi ga'i 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The difference in the purity of the conditioned supramundane is that it is the purification of the obstacle to knowledge, because it is well-made by the discrimination of knowledge.

original: smon lam shin tu mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par gyi 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: smon lam shin tu mngon par bsgrubs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o // sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par gyi 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The difference in the purity of the unconditioned of both is that it is called the stage of nirvana, because it is the accomplishment of the vow.

original: gzhan gyis rnam par mi 'khrugs pas byin gyi rlabs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rnam par mi 'khrugs pas byin gyi rlabs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the non-abandonment of the aims of sentient beings by the power of the former vow, and the difference in the purity of the unconditioned of the Bodhisattva stage is that it is called the stage of consecration, because it is not disturbed by others.

original: sngon gyi mthar mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i sa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is called the stage of spontaneity, because it is accomplished at the beginning.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par ni sa drug pa dang / bdun pa la khyad zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par ni sa drug pa dang / bdun pa la khyad zhugs pa ste /
translated: The distinction of the bodhisattva stages is the distinction between the sixth and seventh stages.

original: sa drug pa la ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par gyi gzhan gyis rnam par 'khrugs so //
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni lam gzhan rtsom pa'i khyad par gyi gzhan gyis rnam par 'khrugs so //
translated: On the sixth stage, he is disturbed by others because of the distinction of his undertaking of other paths.

original: bdun pa ni 'bad pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni 'bad pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: On the seventh stage, he is endowed with effort.

original: 'di ni thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o //
translated: On the eighth stage, he enters into the nondiscriminative and the nondiscriminative-transcendent by way of the spontaneous process of the accomplishment of all.

original: de la gang zag gi nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi nges pa'i tshig rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The verbal definition of the person is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' don gang gis na byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ces bya ba de ston pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don gang gis na byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ces bya ba de ston pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is so called because he has attained the stage of the bodhisattva called the Immovable.

original: de ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis brjod de ;
analyzed: de ni don rnam pa gnyis kyis brjod de ;
translated: This is expressed in two ways:

original: gcig tu mi g-yo ba dang / gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gcig tu mi g-yo ba dang / gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The immovable and the unmoving from the one are the causes for the bodhisattva‚Äôs entry into the stage of the Immovable.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu mngon par bsgrubs pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de lta bu mngon par bsgrubs pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: For what reason is it said that, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva is endowed with the accomplishment of such knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba zhes @230b gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba zhes @230b gsungs pa'o //
translated: and has gone to the lineage of the buddhas?

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni khams brtas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni khams brtas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Therein, the lineage of the buddhas is the special development of the element.

original: de'i rjes su song ba ni yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nye ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su song ba ni yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nye ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: Having gone to that, he is distinguished by three aspects: by taking up the qualities, by practice, and by proximity.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan shin tu snang bar gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi yon tan shin tu snang bar gyur ba /
translated: For what reason is it said that he is endowed with the light of the qualities of the buddhas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam dang / spyod pa spyad pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam dang / spyod pa spyad pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: and has gone to the conduct and practice of the tathagatas?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For what reason is it said that he has gone to the buddha-field?

original: de la shin tu snang bar gyur pa'i don ni shin tu sbyang ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la shin tu snang bar gyur pa'i don ni shin tu sbyang ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the meaning of light should be known as the meaning of purification.

original: gnas pa dang spyod pa'i spyad pa ni spyod lam dang spyod pa'i spyad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang spyod pa'i spyad pa ni spyod lam dang spyod pa'i spyad pa'o //
translated: The practice of abiding and conduct is the practice of deportment and conduct.

original: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba ni rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pas yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba ni rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pas yongs su ston te /
translated: Among them, the immovable is always and continuously fully empowered by the blessings of the Tathagatas.

original: gang gi phyir rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is always and continuously fully empowered by the blessings of the Tathagatas.

original: de la yon tan rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood in terms of five aspects of qualities.

original: mchod pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mchod pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The quality of worship is stated because

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsu ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsu ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Indra, Brahma, and the world protectors welcome them.

original: kun du bsrungs pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: kun du bsrungs pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The quality of protection is stated because

original: lag na rdo rje rtag par phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rtag par phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Vajrapani always follows behind them.

original: rten gyi yon tan ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis yongs su ma btang ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi yon tan ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis yongs su ma btang ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The quality of the basis is mentioned in the statement: ‚Äúbecause of the non-abandonment by the power of meditative concentration.‚Äù

original: zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan ni gang gi phyir lus rnam par phye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The quality of the purification of the realm is mentioned in the statement: ‚Äúbecause of the accomplishment of the immeasurable manifestation of bodies.‚Äù

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan de rnam pa lngas yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan de rnam pa lngas yongs su bstan te /
translated: The quality of the development of living beings is indicated by five aspects.

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir lus thams cad kyi spyod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir lus thams cad kyi spyod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The assumption of a birth according to one‚Äôs desire is mentioned in the statement: ‚Äúbecause of the power of the performance of all bodily actions.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal shes par nus pa ni gang gi phyir mngon par shes pa chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal shes par nus pa ni gang gi phyir mngon par shes pa chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ability to know the faculties, the inclinations, and the latent proclivities is mentioned in the statement: ‚Äúbecause of the accomplishment of the maturation of the great superknowledges.‚Äù

original: chos kyi tshul la gzud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul la gzud pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to introduce them to the way of the Dharma,

original: chos mtha' yas pa 'dzin par nus pa ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mtha' yas pa 'dzin par nus pa ni gang gi phyir ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is able to hold limitless Dharma, because he has mastery over limitless meditative absorptions.

original: len par nus pa ni @231a * //
analyzed: len par nus pa ni @231a * //
translated: He is able to take up,

original: gang gi phyir lung bstan pa tshad med pa yang dag par nod pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung bstan pa tshad med pa yang dag par nod pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because he is able to take up limitless predictions.

original: bshad par nus pa ni gang gi phyir 'gro ba ji ltar yongs su smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston par byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par nus pa ni gang gi phyir 'gro ba ji ltar yongs su smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston par byed pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is able to explain, because he demonstrates complete and authentic awakening in accordance with the full maturation of living beings.

original: de lta bu dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni gcig tu mi g-yo ba'o //üîΩde la gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni gcig tu mi g-yo ba'o // de la gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba ni /
translated: Endowed with such qualities, he is unshakable.

original: theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas yongs su bstan te /
translated: Among them, unshakable from singularity is taught by the entry into the ma·πá·∏çala of the Great Vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu dang ldan zhing theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu dang ldan zhing theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he is endowed with such qualities and has entered the ma·πá·∏çala of the Great Vehicle.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi don ni mi phyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi don ni mi phyed pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the ma·πá·∏çala is the meaning of indivisibility.

original: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known as ninefold:

original: ye shes mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of intuition is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe is endowed with the great superknowledges of the intuition of thorough analysis.‚Äù

original: bshad pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of explanation is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe always emits the light rays of the shining of wisdom.‚Äù

original: rnam par grol ba mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o /
translated: The indivisibility of liberation is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe has entered the path of the attachment-free Dharma-element.‚Äù

original: zhing yongs su dag pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lam rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lam rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of the purification of the realm is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe is skilled in the analysis of the paths of the world-realms.‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of entry into the Great Vehicle is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe manifests all aspects of excellence.‚Äù

original: mngon par shes pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir rang gis sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir rang gis sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The unbreakable knowledge of superknowledge is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe has power over the generation of his own mind.‚Äù

original: dri ba lan 'debs par nus pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes can zhes gsungs pa'o /üîΩbyang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dri ba lan 'debs par nus pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes can zhes gsungs pa'o / byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa mi phyed pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The unbreakable ability to answer questions is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe has the knowledge that well penetrates the limits of the past and the future.‚Äù

original: bdud kyi lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa dang / ldog pa shes pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi phye dang ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bdud kyi lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa dang / ldog pa shes pa dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o // mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi phye dang ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The unbreakable sitting at the site of enlightenment is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe has the knowledge that enters into and turns back from all the paths of Mara.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The unbreakable full realization of enlightenment is because of the statement, ‚Äúhe has entered into all the domains and spheres of activity of the Tathagatas.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam mu med pa dag na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul gyis spyod pas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba don yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byam mu med pa dag na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshul gyis spyod pas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba don yod pa'o //
translated: In the infinite, limitless world systems, he practices the bodhisattva practices by the irreversible way.

original: de bzhin gshegs @231b pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @231b pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: He attends on those tathagatas,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba sngon du 'gro ba chos snang bar sgrub pa yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba sngon du 'gro ba chos snang bar sgrub pa yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: and he takes up the Dharma illumination that is preceded by the classification of the world systems.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po la btags pa'i dpes ni /
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po la btags pa'i dpes ni /
translated: The example of the gold coin of Jambudvipa, the lord of the world, shows

original: rnam par dag pa'i sa thob pas gnas khyad par can du byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'od gsal bar yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sa thob pas gnas khyad par can du byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'od gsal bar yongs su ston te /
translated: the illumination of the roots of virtue that are made special by attaining the stage of purity.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /
translated: For, O son of the victors, it is like this:

original: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pas zin par byas te /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pas zin par byas te /
translated: For example, that very gold coin of Jambudvipa, made by a skilled goldsmith,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po'i mgul lam /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po'i mgul lam /
translated: is worn around the neck of the lord of Jambudvipa,üîΩor on the head of the lord of the gods.

original: mgo la btags na 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rgyan gyi rnam pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mgo la btags na 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i sems can thams cad kyi rgyan gyi rnam pa rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin no //
translated: If it is placed on the head, it cannot be surpassed by any ornaments of the beings of Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i bar dag gis mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i bar dag gis mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this Immovable bodhisattva ground cannot be surpassed by those of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and solitary buddhas, up to and including the bodhisattvas on the seventh ground.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩ'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no // 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The rest is as before.

original: // / sa dgu pa ni /
analyzed: // / sa dgu pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the eighth ground of the noble ones in the Ten Grounds is complete.üîΩThe ninth ground is called the Excellent Intelligence.

original: smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as being established by four kinds of excellence: excellence of the speaker's effort, excellence of intuition, excellence of engagement in practice, and excellence of explanation.

original: sa brgyad pa'i ye shes kyi las mngon par bsgrubs pa rnams kyis zhing yongs su dag par bya ba bsgrubs nas ;
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i ye shes kyi las mngon par bsgrubs pa rnams kyis zhing yongs su dag par bya ba bsgrubs nas ;
translated: Having accomplished the deeds of intuition on the eighth stage, he accomplishes the purification of the field.

original: 'di la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba sgrub ste /
translated: Here he accomplishes the evolutionary development of living beings.

original: 'di ni de'i khyad par ro //üîΩde la smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don dang / bdag gi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i khyad par ro // de la smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don dang / bdag gi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: This is his distinction.

original: tshig gcig dang / gcig dang lnga dang gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: tshig gcig dang / gcig dang lnga dang gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: Therein, the excellence of the speaker's effort is taught in one verse each for the sake of others' aims and one's own aims, and three verses for both.

original: gzhan gyi don ni gzugs med pa rnams su thar pa thob par 'gyur bar 'du shes pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni gzugs med pa rnams su thar pa thob par 'gyur bar 'du shes pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: For the sake of others, it is for the sake of those disciples who imagine that liberation is attained in the formless realms.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar ye shes tshad med pas rnam par dpyad pa'i blos yang rnam par thar pa zhi ba gong ma rnams shes par byed ces @232a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar ye shes tshad med pas rnam par dpyad pa'i blos yang rnam par thar pa zhi ba gong ma rnams shes par byed ces @232a * //
translated: Because, O son of the victors, the bodhisattva, by a mind that analyzes with immeasurable wisdom, also understands the higher liberations that are peaceful.

original: gsungs pa'o // bdag gi don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ma thob pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa'o // bdag gi don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ma thob pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The benefit for oneself is from the perspective of not yet attaining the wisdom of a buddha,

original: gang gi phyir yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gong ma ma rdzogs pa la rnam par dpyod ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gong ma ma rdzogs pa la rnam par dpyod ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said that he analyzes the incomplete higher wisdom of the tathagatas.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa dag gi dbang du byas pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la sbyor ba'i gdul bya rnams dang / mi shes pa dag chos kyi tshul bstan par shes par bya ba dang / skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa dag gi dbang du byas pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la sbyor ba'i gdul bya rnams dang / mi shes pa dag chos kyi tshul bstan par shes par bya ba dang / skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, it is from the perspective of bodhisattvas who are fully matured, those to be guided who are engaged in improper thought, those who do not know how to teach the way of Dharma, and those who have entered into bad refuges.

original: mtho ris la mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas tshig lngas go rims bzhin du gzhan gyi don ston te /
analyzed: mtho ris la mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas tshig lngas go rims bzhin du gzhan gyi don ston te /
translated: Five phrases show the benefit for others in order, from the point of view of those who aspire to the higher realms.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug par bya ba la 'jug / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i che ba nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug par bya ba la 'jug / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i che ba nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed /
translated: Because they enter into the secret of the Tathagata, they enter into the inconceivable greatness of wisdom.

original: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yongs su sbyong /
analyzed: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yongs su sbyong /
translated: They purify the discernment of retention and concentration.

original: mngon par shes pa rgya chen po mngon par sgrub /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rgya chen po mngon par sgrub /
translated: They accomplish the vast superknowledges.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba shes par byed ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba shes par byed ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: They know how to discern the world realms.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa kun du ston pas mtho ris la mos pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa kun du ston pas mtho ris la mos pa zlog par byed do //
translated: By showing the complete purity of the realm, they turn away from the aspiration for the higher realms.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun du bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bdag gi don ston te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun du bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bdag gi don ston te /
translated: The three phrases respectively teach the benefit for oneself, in terms of demonstrating the complete enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and the parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa yongs su sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa yongs su sbyong bar byed /
translated: Because he purifies the unassailable powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khyu mchog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'jug / snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs thob pa mi 'dor zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khyu mchog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'jug / snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs thob pa mi 'dor zhing /
translated: He follows the turning of the wheel of the Dharma of the TathƒÅgatas, and he does not abandon the attainment of the blessing of great compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa gnon te zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu pa gnon te zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: He conquers the ninth bodhisattva stage.

original: sems can gyi don la lta ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs thob pa mi 'dor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la lta ba dang bcas pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs thob pa mi 'dor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Because he has the vision of the benefit for sentient beings, he does not abandon the attainment of the blessing of great compassion.

original: de ltar chos smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pas sa dgu pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos smra ba po'i rtsol ba phun sum tshogs pas sa dgu pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the ninth stage as being the perfect effort of the Dharma teacher,

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: he teaches the perfection of knowledge.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni chos gang ngag bshad par bya ba de dag gi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni chos gang ngag bshad par bya ba de dag gi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge should be understood in terms of the Dharma that is to be taught.

original: de dag ni @232b rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de dag ni @232b rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: They are the purified dharmas, the defiled dharmas, and the dharmas that are neither.

original: gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa de dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa de dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because, on this Bodhisattva stage, he knows well the formation of the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral dharmas.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag ste /
translated: The purified dharmas are also the defiled and undefiled.

original: gang gi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said that one should manifest the dharmas that are with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dag ste /
translated: The without-outflows are also mundane and supramundane,

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said that one should manifest the mundane and supramundane dharmas.

original: de rnams kyang bsam du yod pa dang / bsam gyis mi lang ba dag ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bsam du yod pa dang / bsam gyis mi lang ba dag ste /
translated: Those are also conceivable and inconceivable,

original: gang gi phyir bsam gyis khyab pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gyis khyab pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said that one should manifest the conceivable and inconceivable dharmas.

original: bsam du yod pa rnams kyang nges pa dang ma nges pa dag ste /
analyzed: bsam du yod pa rnams kyang nges pa dang ma nges pa dag ste /
translated: The conceivable are also definite and indefinite,

original: gang gi phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said that one should manifest the definite and indefinite dharmas.

original: de rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag ste /
translated: Those are also the three vehicles,

original: gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the Abhidharma of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, the Abhidharma of the bodhisattva conduct, and the Abhidharma of the ground of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: theg pa gsum po'i chos de dag kyang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po'i chos de dag kyang /
translated: And those dharmas of the three vehicles

original: lam dang gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam dang gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: are distinguished by the path and the transformation.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba dag ste /
translated: Therefore, they are distinguished by the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the Abhidharma of conditioned dharmas and the Abhidharma of unconditioned dharmas, one knows them as they are in reality.

original: de ltar ye shes phun sum tshogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes phun sum tshogs pas /
translated: Thus, having taught the arrangement of the grounds with the perfection of wisdom,

original: sa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: sa rnam par gzhag pa bstan nas spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: he teaches the perfection of engaging in conduct.

original: de la spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rten dang bcas pa las brtsams pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /üîΩrnam par byang ba gnyis su nges pa dang ma nges pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams @233a * //
analyzed: de la spyod pa la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rten dang bcas pa las brtsams pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la brten pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis su nges pa dang ma nges pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams @233a * //
translated: The perfection of engaging in activity should be understood in terms of the afflictions, the afflicted karma and its basis, and the afflicted birth that is its support.

original: par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in terms of the two certainties and the two uncertainties of purification.

original: gang gi phyir de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i blo sems can gyi sems kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i blo sems can gyi sems kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Because he, endowed with such knowledge, with his mind, correctly knows the dense thicket of sentient beings' mental activity.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po dang las kyi rgyu ba thibs po zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po dang las kyi rgyu ba thibs po zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The dense thicket of afflictions and the dense thicket of karma are mentioned.

original: mos pa la sogs pa ni dbang po la sogs dang mthun pa'i phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa'i gnas skabs de ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rim gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa ni dbang po la sogs dang mthun pa'i phyir nges pa dang ma nges pa'i gnas skabs de ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rim gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Interest and so on are similar to the faculties and so on, so that state of certainty and uncertainty should be understood through the sequence of the faculties and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / mos pa'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / khams kyi rgyu ba thibs po dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi rgyu ba thibs po dang / skye ba'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu ba thibs po dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / mos pa'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / khams kyi rgyu ba thibs po dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi rgyu ba thibs po dang / skye ba'i rgyu ba thibs po dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu ba thibs po dang /
translated: Because he knows well the dense thicket of the movement of the faculties, the dense thicket of the movement of aspirations, the dense thicket of the movement of the elements, the dense thicket of the movement of thoughts and latent tendencies, the dense thicket of the movement of birth, the dense thicket of the movement of the connection of habitual tendencies,

original: phung po gsum gyi gnas pa'i rgyu ba thibs po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gsum gyi gnas pa'i rgyu ba thibs po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the dense thicket of the movement of abiding in the three aggregates, just as it is.

original: thibs po ni mang ba'i don dang / spyod pa shes par mi nus pa'i don du rig par bya'o //üîΩsems can gyi rgyu ba thibs po ni sems rnam pa tha dad pas ston te /
analyzed: thibs po ni mang ba'i don dang / spyod pa shes par mi nus pa'i don du rig par bya'o // sems can gyi rgyu ba thibs po ni sems rnam pa tha dad pas ston te /
translated: It should be understood that ‚Äúthicket‚Äù means ‚Äúmany‚Äù and ‚Äúincapable of being known through conduct.‚ÄùüîΩThe dense thicket of the movement of sentient beings is taught by the different types of minds.

original: gang gi phyir de sems can rnams kyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de sems can rnams kyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he knows well the different types of minds of sentient beings, just as they are.

original: sems rnam pa tha dad pa de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis rab tu ston te ;
analyzed: sems rnam pa tha dad pa de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis rab tu ston te ;
translated: That mind is also shown to have eight aspects:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug rab tu dbye bas rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems rnam pa sna tshogs nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug rab tu dbye bas rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir sems rnam pa sna tshogs nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of differentiation is shown by the differentiation of the six kinds of mind, thought, and consciousness, because of the statement: ‚ÄúThe mind is of various kinds.‚Äù

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang skye bar 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of transformation is shown by the transformation, destruction, and origination, because of the statement:

original: sems skad cig tu myur du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems skad cig tu myur du 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is momentary, quickly changing, and perishable.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa de las sems kyi lus gud na med pas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa de las sems kyi lus gud na med pas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is shown by the fact that the body of the mind is not separate from the object, because of the statement:

original: sems lus med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems lus med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is incorporeal.‚Äù

original: yul mtha' yas pa la 'jug pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: yul mtha' yas pa la 'jug pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of its own nature is shown by its engagement with the infinite field of objects, because of the statement:üîΩ‚ÄúThe mind is infinite.‚Äù

original: sems mtha' yas shing thams cad du mang ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems mtha' yas shing thams cad du mang ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The mind is limitless and all-pervading.

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of being essentially uncontaminated is taught because

original: sems 'od gsal ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'od gsal ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the mind is luminous.

original: kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa dang / @233b kun nas dkris pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa dang / @233b kun nas dkris pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of being associated with and free from the entanglements is taught because

original: sems nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the mind is associated with and free from afflictions.

original: bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang / bag la nyal med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang / bag la nyal med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of being associated with and free from latent tendencies is taught because

original: sems bcings pa dang rnam par thar pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems bcings pa dang rnam par thar pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the mind is bound and liberated.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba dang / de ma yin pa sems can rnams rang gi las dag gi skye bas rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba dang / de ma yin pa sems can rnams rang gi las dag gi skye bas rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis ston pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: How the bodhisattvas are born intentionally and how other sentient beings are born by their own karma is shown by the characteristic of cause.

original: sems sgyu ma lta bur rnam par sgrub pa nyid dang / sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid nas /
analyzed: sems sgyu ma lta bur rnam par sgrub pa nyid dang / sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid nas /
translated: Because of that, the mind is established as being like an illusion, and the mind abides in accordance with the world.

original: sems tha dad pa 'bum phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems tha dad pa 'bum phrag du ma'i bar dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Up to the point where he knows correctly many hundreds of thousands of different minds.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is naturally luminous,

original: sems nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems bcings pa dang / rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems bcings pa dang / rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: the mind is defiled and undefiled, bound and liberated.

original: mtshan nyid drug pa dang bdun pas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid drug pa dang bdun pas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ston to //
translated: The sixth and seventh characteristics show the defilement of the afflictions.

original: sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa ste brgyad pas skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ston to //
analyzed: sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa ste brgyad pas skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ston to //
translated: The mind is situated just as the beings are. The eighth shows the defilement of birth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The division of the thick growth of the cause of defilement is shown by three aspects.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ring du song ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du ring du song ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It extends far, up to the peak of existence, because

original: de nyon mongs pa rnams ring du song ba nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa rnams ring du song ba nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he knows just as it really is the far extension of the defilements.

original: dge ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba mtha' yas pa kun du 'byung bas shes par dka' ba ni gang gi phyir sbyor ba mtha' yas pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba mtha' yas pa kun du 'byung bas shes par dka' ba ni gang gi phyir sbyor ba mtha' yas pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is difficult to know because of the occurrence of infinite applications to virtue, etc., because it is said that it is infinite application.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nyon mongs par byed pa ni de la ji ltar 'ching ba gang gis gang bcings pa de bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su ston
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nyon mongs par byed pa ni de la ji ltar 'ching ba gang gis gang bcings pa de bstan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su ston
translated: The afflictions, birth, and karma afflict it.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that which is bound by which bondage, he says:

original: to // gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes shing mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: to // gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes shing mi 'bral ba nyid dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa nyid dang / sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The affliction of affliction is taught as affliction because it is co-arisen and inseparable, and because latency and entanglements are synonyms, and because it is associated with and dissociated from the mind.

original: de la ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, ‚Äúhow‚Äù refers to

original: gcig gi grogs su gcig @234a * //
analyzed: gcig gi grogs su gcig @234a * //
translated: one being the companion of the other.
